story:
What I'm doing:

Hello, my name is Hannah Chutzpah. I'm a seasoned performance poet, and this year for the first time I'm taking a one-woman show to the Edinburgh Fringe Festival. The show is on the topic of Permission. How, why, when and where we ask for permission. 

"One-woman poetry show about the power dynamics of permission and politeness with rhymes and reasons. Hannah Chutzpah looks at consent, kicking ass and when asking nicely turns nasty. Contains: feminism, funnies, psychology, sociology, wit and wordplay. "
Taking a show up to the Fringe is an expensive venture. This IndieGoGo is to fund a pamphlet of poems for merchandise, and help me with other Fringe costs: flyers, accommodation, props, and some prints of individual poems. 

What I need:

  • £130 will pay for the production and printing of 200 pamphlets of my poems.
  • £80 will help with flyers and posters for the show
  • £55 will pay for props
  • Any extra will go towards accommodation (£340), transport, food, and making prints to also sell as merchandise.

Why this show is awesome:

Poetry is a fantastic medium for vignettes, 'case studies' and expressing thoughts and situations succinctly. This show is an exploration of power, assertiveness, consent, mental health, gender politics and much more. A pamphlet of poems is a way of taking something of the show home with you, and being able to share it with others. I will also include some other poems - some of the 'big hitters' from my performance poetry career such as Tetris as a relationship analogy (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4CDwHVja6ZM), Butterflies (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OKuHUfkK2oU), and Raise You (http://hannahchutzpah.com/2012/06/23/raise-you/).

I've been performing at poetry nights, festivals, and more for five years. I've taught workshops to adults and children at schools, literary festivals, and the National Space Centre. I run the Whippersnapper Press (www.whippersnapperpress.com) for short, sharp, funny creative writing. Once a year we run an annual Vogon Poetry Slam of geeky/so-bad-it's-good poetry as a Douglas Adams tribute. 

This one-woman poetry show is the most focused, detailed and extensive thing I've ever tried to do with my poetry. I've been getting feedback from audiences, slam champions and editors to help make this the best work I can do. The pamphlet will be a distillation of years and years of work. I just need a little help to get me over the final financial hurdle.

Risks & Challenges

Design software is something I'm only learning my way around. Also the timing will be a little tight: but I have to make it because the Edinburgh Fringe Festival is in August. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, but would still like to help, you could:

  • Tell people about the campaign and encourage them to support it
  • Come to the show in Edinburgh: https://www.edfringe.com/whats-on/spoken-word/asking-nicely 
  • Come to my upcoming shows - keep an eye out here: http://hannahchutzpah.com/gigs/#2 
  •  Watch and 'like' my YouTube videos: https://www.youtube.com/user/HannahChutzpah/videos 
  • Go 'like' my page on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/HannahChutzpah

story:
I am a 25-year old independent researcher and writer. I have my own website (www.andrewgavinmarshall.com) and have been running a writing project for nearly one year, The People's Book Project, which is a crowd-funded project aiming to write a series of books on a radical history of power and resistance in the modern world, taking a highly critical and heavily researched look at institutions and ideas of social, political, economic, cultural, psychological and historical power. However, I only have a small following and limited resources. 

My objective is to get the first book in the series out as soon as possible, since it is dealing with issues relevant to everyone's lives: the global economic crisis (its causes and consequences), and the development of anti-austerity movements around the world in resistance to the economic crisis and the actions of elites: from Greece, to Spain, Portugal, the U.K., Iceland, Chile, Mexico, Quebec, and beyond.

It seems that everywhere in the world, people my age are taking to the streets and finding creative new ways of resisting power, repression, impoverishment and exploitation. Whether Egypt, Spain, or here where I live in Quebec, it is the youth who are rising up against the excesses of elites, youth who graduate university with degrees and no job opportunities, who follow the 'rules' and are left with nothing but debts, who expected the world, and got the boot.

My objective with this first book in the series is to arm the youth - and others - of the world with a radical exposé of the institutions, individuals, and ideas of domination, and, alternatively, of resistance and revolution. I seek to bring information and analysis to what seems to be an ever-emerging and expanding global youth-driven revolution. 

I am a young student, researcher, and writer of meagre means, but I have been writing about issues of power and resistance for several years, and I would like to be able to travel to Europe in order to see the effects of the crisis and reactions of the people in the form of protest and creative resistance, to interview those participating in and documenting resistance movements, such as the 'We Don't Pay' movement out of Greece, the Indignados in Spain, etc., and to document the true nature of this global crisis, which is most acutely being felt in Europe at the moment.

I have already written a great deal of the book, focused almost exclusively on Europe at the moment, but I need funds to continue putting my time and effort into completing the book, as well as to travel to Europe to see 'the revolution' up close and personal. It is one thing to study a situation from afar, and entirely another to see it up close and in person.

My only income derives from donations from readers and supporters around the world, but that has largely dried up of late, and I need to expand my reach. I am hoping to raise $9,000 so that I can continue putting the necessary time and resources into finishing this book by the New Year, and to travel to Europe for at least one month in a 'revolutionary tour' of crisis and resistance, and to document the trip in both articles for public consumption and to add to the final book. Most of the money would have to go to the trip to Europe to cover flight, train/travel, lodging, food and other necessities (at least $6,000); the rest would cover my living expenses while I research and finish writing the book, essentially, food and rent.

I have been writing this particular volume of the book for less than two months, and already have completed more than 300 pages (single-spaced) of unedited research. I have made samples of both my research and analysis available to the public on my websites, so that people may read and see for themselves the type of material I produce, and decide if they think it is worth supporting. I will continue to do this for supporters, who would receive samples of my work and research.

I have been living very modestly for some time, and live well below the poverty line, but writing is my passion and my purpose in life. While constantly being broke takes a toll, my research and writing give me sustenance and a determination like nothing else in my life. Supporting a writer is always risky, but I hope you think it might just be worth it. The world around us is changing so rapidly, prices go up, and wages go down, debts get higher and job searches harder; while poverty spreads, the elites take more for themselves, in profits and power. But something is changing: the people, and most especially the youth of the world are waking up, rising up, from Occupy to Athens, from Santiago to Cairo, taking to the streets, raising questions, demanding change, and planting the seeds of creating an altogether new society which is not designed to benefit the few at the expense of the many.

I want to be a part of this process, I want to document, analyze and help it forward, to inform action and inspire thought and discussion, to give strength to those who struggle, strength through the 'mighty pen' instead of the seraded sword. I want to Write the Revolution, as best as I can.

I need your support to make this a reality.

So in the name of solidarity, thank you to all who have and continue to support this project!

Sincerely,

Andrew Gavin Marshall

story:
Avenue Montaigne 12 will be a novel about the extraordinary friendship between Marlene Dietrich and her long-time private secretary, Norma Bosquet. It will take an intimate look at the last years of the grand diva’s life, far removed from fame and glory.

The story is based on personal interviews with Norma Bosquet, as well as several written and oral documents, many of which have not been published until now. Norma Bosquet passed away just a few days after our last interview. It was her last wish to finally tell the story of her lifetime. This campaign should help me to turn the story into a novel. Supporting this project will give you access to even more exclusive information about the last years of one of the greates divas of all time.

story:
Who am I?

I'm a former Canadian Track team member with two thrillers and one anthology. My biology degree helped me to write my first novel, Pandora's Succession. Fans of Robert Ludlum and Clive Cussler will love this breakneck thriller about a CIA operative who learns that the brutal weapons consortium that killed his fiancée has acquired a hyper-deadly microbe called Pandora. I've followed up with the anthology, Unsavory Delicacies, and the standalone thriller, Chill Run.

 

What's the thriller about?

The Demeter Code is the sequel to the bestselling novel, Pandora's Succession. This will be the second book in a continuing series featuring CIA operatives, Ridley Fox and Doctor Nita Parris. As of this time, the plot is classified as "Top Secret." However some of the elements will include bioterrorism, cyberwarfare, sex, conspiracy, greed, and revenge. 

 

Why is this campaign important?

This is an independantly funded project. I don't have the backing of a large NYC publisher who'll cover the costs of editing, formating, printing, and marketing. This is where you come in. Your contribution will help me cover the costs of content editing, copy editing, eBook and paperback formating, printing, cover design, and marketing. With your help, this thriller would be indistinguishable from a novel you'll find in a bookstore or in a library.

 

What formats will this novel be available in?

The novel will be available in eBook format for your Amazon Kindle or other eReaders. For old-school readers, the book will also be in a 9x6 inch glossy softcover format.

 

If You Can't Contribute, How else can you help?

Spread the word by telling family and friends about this campaign. Post links to this page on Facebook, Twitter.

 

Want to sample what I've written? Check out excerpts from PANDORA'S SUCCESSION and CHILL RUN.

Thanks for your support,

Russell.

***UPDATE***

Those who pay by credit card will receive their perks after IndieGogo processes the payment. That date is usually after the campaign ends.

story:
WHAT IS "ME+YOU"??

When I began this project, I originally wanted to film a documentary that would attempt to answer the eternal question: What is love? “Project: L.O.V.E.” it was called. “Longing, Obsession, and Various Emotions.” See how I spelled out the word “LOVE” again right there? I thought that was pretty swanky.

I saw “When Harry Met Sally” in college, and the interviews interspersed throughout the film moved me deeply. The simplicity of two people talking about their relationship was fascinating. I wanted to take this idea and put it on a much larger scale. And, unlike the film, I wanted to have ordinary people sharing real stories. Not actors. Everyone has a story. Every story is unique and special. And more often than not, the truth is much stranger than fiction.

So I went on my merry way to shoot a documentary. I bought a camera and two microphones. I pretended that I knew how to frame a shot. I became the director and interviewer all in one. But I soon realized that in order to shoot a documentary professionally, I would need more people behind the scenes. I’d need two or three cameras. I’d need professional lighting. And finally, I’d need subjects who were willing to divulge private information in front of a lot of strangers. I began to realize that this was my baby, and I wanted to do it alone. This way I could come in, set up my camera, and talk to these wonderful people with no pressure to “get the right shot” or for them to “say the right thing.” I wanted the interviews to be as raw and untouched as possible. So I decided to write a book of interviews instead.  Thus "Me+You" was born.  

I have interviewed widows, couples who have been married for fifty years or more, and couples who have divorced and remarried. I have interviewed couples who have made the decision not to marry. I have interviewed interracial couples and same-sex couples. Each couple has their own unique story. The names have been changed out of respect to those interviewed, but the stories remain the same. What has evolved is a unique book of interviews that is full of heart. In short: ranging from ages thirty to eighty-seven, different couples share their stories of love, hardship and why they stay together through it all. 

WHAT I NEED:

"Me+You" has been written, self-published, and is available now on Amazon.  However, in order to cover printing and marketing costs and to push it to the next level, I need some extra help from you! I would be eternally grateful for anything you could donate. Even a dollar helps!

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that some people cannot contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help.

Please just spread the word. Share this link on your facebook and twitter pages. Tell your friends about the book! Visit the website and ask your friends and family to do the same!!

www.meandyouthebook.com

story:
"Harrowing, funny, vivid, entertaining and deeply humane, Fast Times in Palestine opens a rare window onto Palestinian life.  It’s impossible not to be moved on nearly every page."
        — Sandy Tolan, author of The Lemon Tree

"Authentic, funny, tragic and well-documented. Most of all, it was readable. Sometimes it's hard to swallow all the tradegies of the West Bank & Gaza. However, this book kept me turning pages on the Kindle."
        — Holly, Goodreads reader

One of the Top Ten Travel Books of 2013.
        — Publishers Weekly

How it all began...

I stumbled into Palestine on a post-college backpacking trip, intending to stay for a few days. To my surprise, I found myself both enchanted and shocked to my core. A few days turned into a month, then a year, and before I knew it I was working as a journalist in Ramallah, dating a Palestinian from a conservative Muslim village, and serving as the foreign press coordinator for a Palestinian presidential candidate.

These experiences changed everything I thought I knew about the Middle East, politics, and human nature. When I came home, I couldn't wait to share these stories and lessons with as many people as possible.

Five years later, my book is published -- and I'm taking this show on the road! (More info about the book can be found on my website.)

Book Tour USA

I'm putting together a coast-to-coast tour with 40 events in more than two dozen cities, including San Francisco, Portland, Seattle, Denver, Boulder, Oklahoma City, New York, Boston, Providence, Philadelphia, Princeton, and Washington, DC.

Many venues offer honoraria, but considering the months of planning in addition to the expenses of the tour itself, it's not sustainable for me to continue touring and presenting without supplemental financial support.

Your help will allow me to complete this tour and begin thinking about the next one(s) including tours in the central United States, Canada, and hopefully Europe and the Middle East. Please feel free to suggest cities, states, and venues!

Here's a schedule of book tour events.

The Impact

Below are some reader comments and reviews by respected academics, authors, diplomats, and journalists to give you an idea of the impact this book might have if it can reach enough people.

                                             Reader Comments

I have been studying the Israeli/Palestinian conflict since 9/11 and already own many books on the subject. But this is the one I have been waiting for to share with family and friends.
    ~ Ann, Amazon

This book surprised me. At first I thought the author was some tree-hugging liberal loon, but throughout the book she showed a rational mind, and wrote an interesting story about life in Palestine. I'll credit this book for changing my stance on the entire Israel-Palestinian conflict.
    ~ Joshua, Goodreads

It is refreshing and eye opening to read so many positive stories about the people of Palestine. I realize now how little I knew about them, and am sorry to say that most of it was negative. Since reading this, I have been doing a lot of research and talking with friends and family about what I am learning about Palestine.
    ~ Lori, Amazon

An unexpected, unlikely love letter to Palestine. It will invite comparisons to Eat Pray Love, I imagine. But Fast Times in Palestine is funnier, more interesting, and more levelheaded.
    ~ E, Book blogger

I bought this book with the hope of learning about Palestinian culture... and what I got out of it was so much more. I believe it should be required reading in schools, and I'm encouraging everyone I know to read it.
    ~ Adara, Amazon

                                                    Reviews
 
"I have read much of the writing on this conflict, and no other book has conveyed such an authentic, penetrating, and enchanting sense of the Palestinian people and their long struggle for rights and security."
        — Richard Falk, UN Special Rapporteur on Human Rights in the Palestinian Territories

"It's love in the time of occupation as Pamela Olson takes us on the emotional roller-coaster of her very personal experience of life in Ramallah—and in doing so lays bare the human drama of a people determined to live free."
        — Tony Karon, TIME Magazine

"Pamela Olson leads the reader on an exciting, funny, at times heart-wrenching journey, carefully deciphering complex political and historical issues."
        — Ramzy Baroud, author of My Father was a Freedom Fighter

"[T]he strength of the narrative lies in Olson’s investigation of the personal and mental effects of oppression and war on herself and her newfound friends, 'the atmosphere of mute shock expressed only in sidelong glances… of knowing something few people knew, and of genuine connection and collective struggle.' Where paradox is as common as breathing, Olson discovers a kind of freedom amid the barbed wire. An empathetic, intriguing memoir."
        — Kirkus Reviews

"More than a travelogue or a polemic, the book is a coming-of-age story, as Olson discovers her voice by directly confronting the challenges of living in a state of institutionalized paradox... Engaging and easy to read, this is a fascinating memoir."
        — Publishers Weekly

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute at this time, you can still help by:
  • Sharing this campaign with your social networks
  • Viewing the book tour schedule and attending some of my events!
  • Helping get the word out about these events in your city
  • Buying or reviewing my book
  • Friending or following me on Facebook or Twitter
  • Being active in the campaign for equal rights for Palestinians!

Thank you so much, and see you on the road!
story_txt:
"Harrowing, funny, vivid, entertaining and deeply humane, Fast Times in Palestine opens a rare window onto Palestinian life.  It’s impossible not to be moved on nearly every page."        — Sandy Tolan, author of The Lemon Tree"Authentic, funny, tragic and well-documented. Most of all, it was readable. Sometimes it's hard to swallow all the tradegies of the West Bank & Gaza. However, this book kept me turning pages on the Kindle."        — Holly, Goodreads reader
One of the Top Ten Travel Books of 2013.        — Publishers Weekly
How it all began...
I stumbled into Palestine on a post-college backpacking trip, intending to stay for a few days. To my surprise, I found myself both enchanted and shocked to my core. A few days turned into a month, then a year, and before I knew it I was working as a journalist in Ramallah, dating a Palestinian from a conservative Muslim village, and serving as the foreign press coordinator for a Palestinian presidential candidate.
These experiences changed everything I thought I knew about the Middle East, politics, and human nature. When I came home, I couldn't wait to share these stories and lessons with as many people as possible.
Five years later, my book is published -- and I'm taking this show on the road! (More info about the book can be found on my website.)


Book Tour USA
I'm putting together a coast-to-coast tour with 40 events in more than two dozen cities, including San Francisco, Portland, Seattle, Denver, Boulder, Oklahoma City, New York, Boston, Providence, Philadelphia, Princeton, and Washington, DC.
Many venues offer honoraria, but considering the months of planning in addition to the expenses of the tour itself, it's not sustainable for me to continue touring and presenting without supplemental financial support.
Your help will allow me to complete this tour and begin thinking about the next one(s) including tours in the central United States, Canada, and hopefully Europe and the Middle East. Please feel free to suggest cities, states, and venues!
Here's a schedule of book tour events.

The Impact
Below are some reader comments and reviews by respected academics, authors, diplomats, and journalists to give you an idea of the impact this book might have if it can reach enough people.
                                             Reader Comments
I have been studying the Israeli/Palestinian conflict since 9/11 and already own many books on the subject. But this is the one I have been waiting for to share with family and friends.    ~ Ann, AmazonThis book surprised me. At first I thought the author was some tree-hugging liberal loon, but throughout the book she showed a rational mind, and wrote an interesting story about life in Palestine. I'll credit this book for changing my stance on the entire Israel-Palestinian conflict.    ~ Joshua, GoodreadsIt is refreshing and eye opening to read so many positive stories about the people of Palestine. I realize now how little I knew about them, and am sorry to say that most of it was negative. Since reading this, I have been doing a lot of research and talking with friends and family about what I am learning about Palestine.    ~ Lori, Amazon
An unexpected, unlikely love letter to Palestine. It will invite comparisons to Eat Pray Love, I imagine. But Fast Times in Palestine is funnier, more interesting, and more levelheaded.    ~ E, Book bloggerI bought this book with the hope of learning about Palestinian culture... and what I got out of it was so much more. I believe it should be required reading in schools, and I'm encouraging everyone I know to read it.    ~ Adara, Amazon
                                                    Reviews

 
"I have read much of the writing on this conflict, and no other book has conveyed such an authentic, penetrating, and enchanting sense of the Palestinian people and their long struggle for rights and security."        — Richard Falk, UN Special Rapporteur on Human Rights in the Palestinian Territories"It's love in the time of occupation as Pamela Olson takes us on the emotional roller-coaster of her very personal experience of life in Ramallah—and in doing so lays bare the human drama of a people determined to live free."        — Tony Karon, TIME Magazine"Pamela Olson leads the reader on an exciting, funny, at times heart-wrenching journey, carefully deciphering complex political and historical issues."        — Ramzy Baroud, author of My Father was a Freedom Fighter"[T]he strength of the narrative lies in Olson’s investigation of the personal and mental effects of oppression and war on herself and her newfound friends, 'the atmosphere of mute shock expressed only in sidelong glances… of knowing something few people knew, and of genuine connection and collective struggle.' Where paradox is as common as breathing, Olson discovers a kind of freedom amid the barbed wire. An empathetic, intriguing memoir."        — Kirkus Reviews"More than a travelogue or a polemic, the book is a coming-of-age story, as Olson discovers her voice by directly confronting the challenges of living in a state of institutionalized paradox... Engaging and easy to read, this is a fascinating memoir."        — Publishers Weekly

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute at this time, you can still help by:


Sharing this campaign with your social networks
Viewing the book tour schedule and attending some of my events!
Helping get the word out about these events in your city
Buying or reviewing my book
Friending or following me on Facebook or Twitter

Being active in the campaign for equal rights for Palestinians!

Thank you so much, and see you on the road!

story:
I've bought a ticket to Coachella Music Festival - now what?

I recently took a huge leap of faith, and bought a ticket to one of the most popular and widely acclaimed music festivals in the USA, if not the world.

As a freelance music journalist from Cape Town, South Africa, it would be a dream come true to be able to report on a festival with the calibre of Coachella. But in making this decision to travel to the other side of the world, it has been a case of 'saddling up before finding the horse', and I need to be able to somehow fund my American Dream and create a professional, informative and interesting report on the festival.

I have an intrinsic passion to be creative and to write, borne by a life-long enthusiasm for English and journalism. At the same time, I have an analytical and logical spirit, which led me to study two Engineering degrees at the University of Cape Town, in the fields of Construction Studies and, most recently, Quantity Surveying.

After finally graduating from university in December 2012, I was torn between two career paths - a life as a Professional Quantity Surveyor, or one as a music journalist?

My creative heart led the way this time, taking my part-time blog "The Eagle's Nest" full-time in January 2013, and it soon led me to purchasing this ticket for an opportunity that very few South Africans have experienced, let alone SA music journalists.

My dream is now within my grasp, and together with your help, I'll have the funding to be able to reach out and grab it.

 

What I Need

To break it down for you, this is what I'll need in terms of funding to be able to make my trip from at least the 13th to 27th of April 2013 possible, and to help create a professional report:

 

  • Local and international flights from Cape Town, South Africa to San Francisco, California ($3180)
  • Visa application costs ($170)
  • Accommodation expenses ($2000)
  • Food and living expenses for the duration of the trip ($1400)
  • Design and printing costs ($1000)
  • Shipping costs ($250)

N.B. any research and time spent to write up the report is on my account.

 

What You'll Get

For you as the contributor, there are certain perks to supporting my campaign to Coachella; one's that could promote you or your business in a mutually beneficial way:

  • Name and credit given in the eventual festival report, on my website/online journalism portfolio (The Eagle's Nest), as well as on any social media relating to The Eagle's Nest

  • Advertising space in said report and on website

  • Physical and digital copies of said report

If I don't reach the entire goal for this campaign, the funds will still go towards the trip and to providing a report on the 2013 Coachella Music Festival.

 

The Impact

As a music journalist, I write with the intention to be factual, interesting, but most importantly: useful. I know that as a fervent fan of music, that’s the sort of journalism I want to consume. I want to see that constructive style become a standard in the industry, and I want to play my own part in making that vision a reality.

Reporting on this festival will provide me with such an opportunity, and will lay the platform to achieve greater things in my journalism career. If you are a music fan, I'm sure you will see value in the creation of well-researched, high-quality journalism about music, as it allows you to find and enjoy the music that you love.

By supporting this campaign, you will be allowing an earnest, diligent and passionate music journalist to do what he loves, and, at least in his home of country of South Africa, provide first-hand insight into the wondrous and exciting experience that is Coachella.

 

The Report Itself

My coverage will consist of reviewing the live performances of each artist I am physically able to see, and I will endeavour to plan a personal line-up that encompasses all the exciting artists that I am currently a fan of. This is so that the content will be imbued with a healthy background understanding and appreciation of the artists in question.

The end product will be a professional report, in digital PDF and physical formats, consisting of advance and post-festival coverage of Weekend 2 of the festival. Coverage will include an introduction to Coachella itself, snippets of this campaign to get me to the festival, pre-festival goals including my personal lineup, and stimulating post-festival analysis of the live acts I was able to see.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Just as I am a fledgling musical journalist, so may you be a fledgling contributor. But you are still important to the success of fulfilling this dream:

Please spread the word of this campaign however you may choose, and through whatever social media channels you may frequent. Every little bit counts, even if you're the one that informs another person to contribute.

story:
Help Send Stockwell on His Next Great Adventure

He’s traveled the world to find evil and punch it in the face for justice. This time the terror is closer to home as Damian Stockwell faces off against Nazis, ninjas and the mad science of Nikola Tesla. Please be a part of this great adventure/comedy by helping me fund The Bulletproof Adventures of Damian Stockwell: Terrors of Tesla.

About Me, Benjamin Wallace

I'm the father of three and a former copywriter. For years you've been reading my work at 7-Elevens and supermarkets everywhere. I'm also the author of several action and adventure/comedy novels as well as the Dumb White Husband stories.


Like so many others, I was recently handed a bunch of lemons in the form of a lay off. But, instead of making lemonade (Country Time already has the market cornered) I plan on making books. Lots of them.

But, I need your help.

Why I'm Asking for Support

Even ebooks cost money to produce. Your generosity will provide me with the time and ability to make this book right. Your support will help cover the cost of editing, formatting, cover design and proofreading.
 

You'll Get Stuff

There are several contribution levels and all of them have awesome rewards. A couple even include a lifetime subscription to my books. Please check them out.
 

Thank You for Your Support

-ben

story:
The Idea

People need to read books. They are informative, can make you forget about your ordinary day to day problems, and can even transfer you into entirely new worlds. Many people love to read, but often can’t find the time to do so.

This is why we’ve developed a new way of reading eBooks. We want to offer novels in digital episodes at affordable rates. Every week, we are going to release a new episode of each novel, which in total would add up to 12 different episodes per eBook.

 

 

 

The Product

We will offer two different versions of each episode, so that you can enjoy your books the way you want to:

  • Version one: normal text version for eReaders (.pdf,.epub,.mobi, etc.)

  • Version two: the special feature version designed for tablets (iPad,Galaxy,etc.), which contains a soundtrack and graphics. 

Independent writers will get the chance to publish their work through our project and every day a different genre will be available. 

From 'Monday Fantasy' to 'Crime Thursday', say goodbye to boring evenings at home when there’s nothing to watch on TV. And for the little ones, we will offer a special “Good night episode” each day! This way, there will be no more troubles on which bedtime story to choose at night.

Genres we will offer are the following: Crime, Fantasy, Romance, Sci-Fi, Horror, Lifestyle, and stories for Young Adults and Children. 

 

 

 

For Your Imagination

Now, just imagine reading The Lord of the Rings. Wouldn't you have loved to have some supplementary graphics to go with that book, such as a map describing the journey of Frodo and Sam? Wouldn’t it have been wonderful to have some background battle noises to dramatize the epic war scenes?

Or imagine reading a bedtime story to your children. Wouldn't they be excited to see images popping up and hear lions roar in tune to the story-telling? Or the sound of waves when the explorers are travelling on a ship as you read about the journey? Well, we are excited just thinking about it. 

 
 
 

Meet the Team

Now, we’d like to introduce ourselves to you so that you’ll have a bit of a clue as to who you might be contributing your hard earned money to.

Senserial Publishing is a digital publishing house founded by myself, Christian Jorda, on January of 2012. Manja Haensel was brought onboard 2 months later and is now managing the content and marketing side of the project, whilst I am working out all the technical and financial details. We’ve both worked together very hard to find suitable writers for the novels we wanted to offer and have found greatly skilled people to contribute to our dream. Website designer, Dimitar Dobchev, has put our plan furthermore into action by creating a fantastic website for our project. 

We and our writers have put in long hours to get this project ready for its launch and we are planning to have a full digital reading service by March 20th with our Spring Edition.

 

 

Why we need your help

We need financial help to maintain our website, pay the writers for their episodes, the composers for their musical work, the graphic designers for their images, and all of the other people working in the background, to finally realize what we’ve imagined.

To help us change the world of reading, you can pledge whatever you want. A few dollars or even a hundred will help us set the way.

We are grateful for every pledge, so please tell your friends & families as well and spread the word about this new reading adventure!

For more information on Senserial Publishing or for a look at our new site, please visit: http://www.senserial.com. You can also Like us on Facebook (http://www.facebook.com/Senserial) and Follow us on Twitter (http://twitter.com/senserial).

 

 

Be a contributor!

Are you an author, digital artist, composer, or do you simply have a vision for a fantastic series? We are going to create a community edition too so that everyone can have the chance to share their stories with the world. This fiction channel is for the community edition (fantasy, crime, horror, etc.) and the best voted writers will get the chance to have their work published on our main channel. CONTACT US NOW!

story:
Buy the Books

From the back of the book:

"When he isn't peddling guns to the Night Market, Apollo just wants to be left alone. That self-imposed exile is his antidote to a life filled with violence--a life he wants to leave behind. When the transcendent demigod he once tried to murder drags him back into the thick of things, Apollo must ally with an agent of a rival nation to tear down the City he's never been able to completely leave behind."

If that sounds like the sort of thing you'd enjoy reading, or if you like action, adventure, intrigue, and various other plot-related buzzwords that mean "excitement," then this book is for you. My editors feel like it's an even better book than "The Week the World Ended," too.

If you expect to see me at an event and want your book delivered there, please select the normal option without shipping cost added in. Shipped options include domestic (USA) shipping. At the end of the campaign, I will be contacting everyone who ordered a shipped copy to confirm your address. IMPORTANT: If you do not confirm your address, I will not be able to ship your book(s).

Praise for "The Week the World Ended"

"An Intelligent Introduction to the Apocalypse" - Michael David Anderson, author of "Teddy"

"Librarian Approved." - Kelsey, a Librarian

"[A] a well thought out story, believable characters, and unpredictable action." - Aaron Shober, coach

If you enjoyed TWTWE, and are expecting a sequel, this unfortunately isn't it. But! Helping out with Apollo will also help out with other projects down the road, making that highly-sought-after sequel come even faster.

Become part of the story

This is your chance to step into one of my stories. If an author tells you he never uses people he knows in his work, he's probably lying to you. Real life experiences shape everything we authors do and write. Some people, however, want to be part of the action.

If you've ever wanted to become a starship captain, a pirate, or even a corrupt politician, this is your chance. By choosing one of these tiers, you get to become a character. At minimum, someone named after you (or who shares your appearance, your choice) will appear in the story, probably to be killed in a suitable dramatic fashion. Higher tiers will allow you more input in the character and what happens to them.

FAQ

1. When will everything be delivered?

The eBooks will go out within one week of the end of the campaign. The print books will go out no more than two weeks after the end.

2. Will the physical copies come signed?

Yes, regardless of what book you choose, or even if you choose the lifetime subscription option, the books will come signed.

3. Why are "in person" copies cheaper?

Simple: I don't have to ship those to you.

4. When can we expect the books to arrive?

After the close of the campaign, I'll put the first orders in. Createspace is usually very fast when it comes to shipping things. Electronic copies are even faster.

5. How do the lifetime subscriptions work?

You'll receive copies of "The Week the World Ended" and "Apollo" now. After that, you'll receive copies of all future books when they're published, possibly before anyone else.

6. I selected the "in person" perk accicdentally, or I thought I would be able to meet you, but can't for whatever reason. Can I have it shipped?

Yes. Contact me and we'll work something out.

7. I live outside the USA, can I get the physical copies shipped to me?

Yes. Select the basic version of the perk you want (i.e., unshipped) and contact me for a shipping invoice.

8. I have this great idea...

Pick the "VIP" perk and we'll talk.

story:
Prince Charming is up to no good...

Every character we have ever created is alive and well, living together in their own world. There is an economy of scale in which every Prince Charming is the same person, and every new story told about him just adds to his personality.

Sometimes that compound effect can drive a character beyond the edge of reason.

Join Princess Sophia from Grimm’s “12 Dancing Princesses” as she is given a task by The Storyteller to figure out what Prince Charming is up to and stop him from destroying their universe. Less Than Charming is the first novel of the Mark of the Storyteller series by Rebecca A. Demarest, in hardcover, launching in May of 2016 with Parkhurst Brothers Publishing.

Less Than Charming is launching with a huge party in Seattle, WA on May 14th, 2016, but we know not all of you will be able to make it there, so we're offering you this chance to pre-order the hardcover book along with some of the extras that will only be available at the party.


What People are saying about Less Than Charming:










Pre-order with benefits!

Less Than Charming is launching with a party on May 14th in Seattle, WA, but we know not everyone will be able to make it, so we're offering you a chance here to pre-order your hardcover books and get in on some of the fun extras we'll only have available at the launch. What are these extras, you ask? Wonder no more!


Cover Art Postcard

It will look great on the wall of your cubicle!


Limited Edition Full Color Map Prints

This is a draft and not the final version. We're still working on the final version. But when you GET the final version, you can frame it and keep it next to you and track Sophia's journey with monopoly pieces...or you can use it in a collage. Your choice.


Limited Edition Crown and Fredderpillar Rampant buttons

These buttons will make you the style envy of all your friends.


Thea of Oz and Zosozo in Oz

Get your hands on both, or, if you only want one, you can do that, too. Check out the ducal levels of backing!


Stretch Goals? Of course we have stretch goals!

If we make our initial goal, we'll start including trading cards of artwork inspired by the novel for everyone who backs us at the $16 level and up. For every $1000 above our goal we hit, we'll add in a new trading card. And if we make it to $10,000 (gasp, is it possible?!) we'll include specially printed, high quality canvas bags with a design that you as a backer get to vote on.

Already pre-ordered elsewhere? No problem!

We have a special backer level just for you! Don't cancel your other order, just order the extras without the book. 

Still not sure? Try a sample!

Click below to read the first chapter of Less Than Charming for free, we are sure you'll love it.

Read the first chapter here!

Looking for discounts?

If you are a librarian, a teacher, or a book club, we'll give you discounts! The book club bulk rate is already on the backer bar (8 books for the price of 7!) and libraries and schools get 45% off list price when they order, and if you order during this campaign and let us know, we'll throw in some awesome backer prizes just for you!

Share the campaign for a chance to win...

See the share links? Share directly from this page to your social media or by email and the person who brings in the most additional backers will win a gift basket with signed copies of Less Than Charming, Thea of Oz, and Zosozo in Oz as well as be upgraded to the highest level of backer automatically. That's a pretty sweet deal if I do say so myself.

story:
---

What's What...

Hi! I'm Kevin Patterson and I'm the blogger behind Poly Role Models and the author of Love's Not Color Blind: Race and Representation in Polyamorous and Other Alternative Communities. I've been speaking and writing about representation and polyamory for going on 5 years. I've been consuming comics and sci-fi for my whole life. About halfway into writing Love's Not Color Blind, I took a break for NaNoWriMo to write a story I didn't think I'd share to anyone but my friends.  Friends like Alana Phelan, The Polyamorous Librarian, an educator, editor, and book reviewer also local to the Philadelphia area.

By our powers combined, we two polyamorous Wonder Twins kicked off a queer and polyamorous superheroic world for our first collaborative novel, For Hire: Operator. This time we're back in the fictional city of Cargill, New Jersey for another story of heroes and conflict.

---

What We Need & What You Get...

The goal of this campaign is to cover the cost of publishing and marketing For Hire: Audition. Though our advocacy work offers us a little bit of a platform, it isn't nearly enough to clear the hurdle of getting a book into all of the hands.

What we're looking to cover is:

  • Printing costs
  • Shipping supplies and postage
  • Artwork (credit to Therabeth)
  • Marketing materials (stickers, trailers, etc.)
  • A little financial breathing room to not take on new projects until this one is finished

 

What we're looking to give you:

  • Early copies of the ebooks
  • Signed copies of the paperback
  • Copies of our first book For Hire: Operator
  • Acknowledgements in the book itself
  • Custom artwork from our cover artist (Therabeth)

---

The Impact

We are nerds and we want to see ourselves represented in characters in a way we can't casually do...yet. We hope to one day see hundreds of books like ours, but until then we will keep writing our diverse world so that others can be reflected in our pages.

---

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this everywhere and follow us at For Hire Mag!

Kevin A. Patterson exists at:
Facebook - Twitter - Tumblr - Instagram - Patreon 

&

Alana Phelan does stuff at:
Facebook - Twitter - Wordpress - Patreon

story:
When I was little, I asked so many questions that my family gave me the nickname "Señorita Pregunta," which roughly translates to "Miss Question" in Spanish.

I've found that curiosity has been a driving force in my life that led me to discover my voice.

My book Señorita Pregunta is about my journey of wrestling with taboo subjects such as sexuality, religion, financial status, and mental health and wondering why I didn't fit in to the conventional understanding of the world.

Questioning these norms has been a challenging and painful process. I think one of the reasons suicide is the second leading cause of death among young people ages 10-24 is because we grow to believe that we are the problem and there is no place in the world for us; that being authentic is a death sentence.

I want to challenge that and help us realize there is enough room in the world for all of us exactly as we are.

While participating in Seth Godin’s Emerging Leaders program this past summer, I was told by multiple peers that my story resonated with them so much that I should write a book. During commencement from this program, a time when I, like most students, was questioning my next step, a fellow alumnus told me about the Creator Institute. And that’s when I knew it was time to take the leap - I needed to write this book.

This book explores my journey as a queer woman who grew up with certain systems that didn’t include a place for my authentic voice. As I grew up I learned to hide my sexuality and my desire to learn about topics deemed “boys only.”

In this book, you'll encounter multifaceted dimensions of self-discovery, the LGBTQ+ community, and abuse in both romantic relationships and the church through narratives like:

  • A Christian youth group “praying the gay away" from me in response to my willingness to openly question my sexuality. What happens when vulnerability is met with judgment instead of curiosity?
  • The exploration of how I entered into an abusive relationship and the realization that I’d been conditioned to think I deserved unwanted attention. A look at the complicated feelings involved in finally leaving my toxic relationship.
  • Coming out as pansexual to myself and my new friends during an internship in Washington D.C. when I allowed myself to be more curious about what I wanted outside of familial and societal expectations.

You will love this book if you are in the LGBTQ+ community, have struggled with abusive relationships, or are ready to question “the way things have always been done.” If you grapple with imposter syndrome and feeling like a misfit, Señorita Pregunta may help you find confidence in curiosity.

Ultimately, I hope that Señorita Pregunta inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • How do I feel more confident about my decisions when there are so many conflicting opinions about how I am supposed to live?
  • How do I communicate better with others by embracing curiosity instead of reacting defensively?
  • How do we get more comfortable asking difficult questions as a society without feeling more divided?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing taboo subjects and leaning into the tension of asking deeper questions will change us all for the better.

The book is written in 4 parts.

Part 1 contains the author’s note + chapters 1-6. Construction - The first part of this book is exploring where some of our social norms come from and the effects it had on me as a young child and early teenager. I end this part with my worst abusive relationship and my struggle to break free.

Part 2 contains chapters 7-11. Deconstruction - The second part of this book reveals the aftermath of my abusive relationship and my discovery of who I am outside of romantic relationships. This includes finally owning my queer identity and embracing other dreams I almost lost to my toxic romance.

Part 3 contains chapters 12- 14. Reconstruction - This part of the book includes when I first move out on my own and release myself from the expectations of my family and other authority figures. I wrestle with quitting a Master’s program, moving in with my partner Charlie, and coping with everything that 2020 has thrown at us.

Part 4 contains chapters 15-16. Freedom - I reflect on everything I’ve learned and this book ends on an open-ended posture of possibility.

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book.

Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book both they physical copy and ebook formats.
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring 2021.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook.

When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition.

When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

Natalie M. Esparza is an author and life coach in Marietta, Georgia. She is currently working as an Integrated Content Creator at Life University. She is also working on her own business, developing a podcast interviewing local Atlanta LGBTQ+ leaders, and creating her signature coaching course for her business. She is an alumni of the altMBA by Seth Godin and a member of the Cobb Chamber Diversity & Inclusion Council.

Her ultimate hope for this book is that through story she can provide an opportunity for others to to see what life could look like if they approached it with more curiosity instead of fear. Natalie believes that curiosity with ourselves, with others, and with society as a whole is a tool that can help us grow and move forward in our lives and in our culture.

Natalie is an avid Dungeon and Dragons player and loves to play Battle Chasers, the Witcher, and Destiny on her Xbox. She is well known by her friends and family for her watercolor paintings and advocating for self-care.

For more information, you can connect with Natalie M. Esparza at her website or Linkedin.

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible.

We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish.

You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #SeñoritaPregunta and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,

story:
Story

Nevertheless: The Resilience of the Modern Woman tells the stories of anything-but-ordinary women who have overcome the obstacles of contemporary gender norms and power relations to become leaders in their schools and fields.

Hi! My name is Jillian Giberson and I am the author of Nevertheless. Frankly, I never pictured myself writing a book. When I was presented with the opportunity to work with a program that supports first-time authors, especially university students, I thought, why not? What ensued was a rollercoaster of ups and downs, topic changes, and self doubt that eventually drove me to write what would become Nevertheless. It chronicles my experience of authoring my first book as a young female student and the complicated dynamics of gender relations in the 21st century. Throughout, I have included extraordinary stories of strength and perseverance of seemingly ordinary women who have confronted misogyny, harassment, and discrimination in their own respective fields.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will be inspired by the stories of the remarkable women I have had the privilege of speaking with and learn how you too can and deserve to take up space. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to think deeper about contemporary gender norms. To think of times you have been made to feel weak or less-than and to affirm that you do deserve to take up space in your discipline and community. For men reading, I hope that this is only the beginning of an opportunity for you to help make space for female voices in your own fields. Above all, my goal is to give a voice to the survivor, the young activist, and the professional who has overcome innumerable obstacles in their career- the women whose stories would otherwise be left untold.

I wrote Nevertheless for young women who are the precipice of their academic or professional journeys, women who need to know that they deserve to take and make up space.

Ultimately, I hope that Nevertheless inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • How can I better take up space myself or help uplift female voices?
  • How can we collectively support women through an intersectional lens, especially in fields lacking substantial female leadership?
  • How can we challenge contemporary gender norms and power relations?

I cannot wait to continue this conversation and hear of my readers’ own experiences.

 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs of publishing. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2020.
  • The Cover Design of the Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder
  • The Layout Design for the interior of the book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for the Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this December

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will be able to publish it. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also be able to publish an audiobook. And when I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

For those who pre-order my book now, I will provide early access to the Introduction and additional sections of the manuscript, with the opportunity to give me early feedback! Your name will also appear in a Special, Acknowledgements section in the printed copy. Other additional rewards for preordering my book include: 

  • A personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • And more...

 

About the Author

Jillian Giberson is a recent graduate of McGill University where she studied political science and international development. She is currently completing her MSc at the London School of Economics in international relations. 

She is passionate about social justice and activism, particularly surrounding gender equality, racial wealth gap, and environmental issues. She enjoys working at the intersection of race and gender, especially as it relates to international relations.

When she is not writing, unsurprisingly, Jillian enjoys reading. She also loves to travel and explore the culture and food of her destinations.

For more information, or travel suggestions, you can connect with Jillian at jillian.giberson1@gmail.com, as well as on Instagram @jilliangiberson and Twitter @GibersonJillian 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

For those who can’t contribute, but still want to help:

  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #Nevertheless and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Feel free to share the book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Much love,

Jillian

I want you to see this book as an opportunity to think deeper about contemporary gender norms. To think of times you have been made to feel weak or less-than and to affirm that you do deserve to take up space in your discipline and community. For men reading, I hope that this is only the beginning of an opportunity for you to help make space for female voices in your own fields. Above all, my goal is to give a voice to the survivor, the young activist, and the professional who has overcome innumerable obstacles in their career- the women whose stories would otherwise be left untold.

I wrote Nevertheless for young women who are the precipice of their academic or professional journeys, women who need to know that they deserve to take and make up space.Ultimately, I hope that Nevertheless inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

How can I better take up space myself or help uplift female voices?
How can we collectively support women through an intersectional lens, especially in fields lacking substantial female leadership?
How can we challenge contemporary gender norms and power relations?

I cannot wait to continue this conversation and hear of my readers’ own experiences.
 
What We Need & What You Get
This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs of publishing. Money raised will go towards the following:

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2020.
The Cover Design of the Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder
The Layout Design for the interior of the book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
The Copyediting for the Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this December

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will be able to publish it. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also be able to publish an audiobook. And when I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.For those who pre-order my book now, I will provide early access to the Introduction and additional sections of the manuscript, with the opportunity to give me early feedback! Your name will also appear in a Special, Acknowledgements section in the printed copy. Other additional rewards for preordering my book include: 

A personally signed copy of my book when I publish
A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
And more...

 
About the Author
Jillian Giberson is a recent graduate of McGill University where she studied political science and international development. She is currently completing her MSc at the London School of Economics in international relations. She is passionate about social justice and activism, particularly surrounding gender equality, racial wealth gap, and environmental issues. She enjoys working at the intersection of race and gender, especially as it relates to international relations.When she is not writing, unsurprisingly, Jillian enjoys reading. She also loves to travel and explore the culture and food of her destinations.For more information, or travel suggestions, you can connect with Jillian at jillian.giberson1@gmail.com, as well as on Instagram @jilliangiberson and Twitter @GibersonJillian 

Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
For those who can’t contribute, but still want to help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #Nevertheless and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
Feel free to share the book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!Much love,Jillian

story:
Story of My Book

The Unlearning is a collection of poems written to personalize and normalize growth in regards to various belief systems. This is a creative piece of work that attempts to capture the thoughts and feelings associated with unlearning certain beliefs that have become core to one’s being. In this work, the author walks through her journey, highlighting the torturous valleys of disconnecting from a belief system and that community, as well as the beautiful mountaintops of liberation that are found on the other side.

Maddy Garrett wrote this book because she knows that the process of unlearning a religious belief system can be daunting, challenging and lonely. By writing her story down, she feels that she is simultaneously healing her own wounds while also inviting others to explore and heal themselves. She wants others to know that it is completely normal to leave a religion behind, and it is acceptable for people to change and grow throughout their lives. Most importantly, she wants others to know they are not alone.

Maddy’s hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that each unlearning journey is unique, but that they all share a few common themes: confusion, pain, hope, growth and beauty. She want you to see this book as an opportunity to examine those beliefs which you find troubling, escape from the idea that you are bound to those beliefs forever, and learn how to accept, explore and heal your wounds, one small step at a time.

In this book, you’ll join her in using language to render distinct aspects of leaving a religion behind and finding immense beauty and joy on the other side through poems like:

Part I, Poem #10, which explores the many contradictions I found within Christian teachings that were fundamental to the beginning of my unlearning journey.

Part II, Poem #4, which captures the feelings associated with having one foot in the door of my religious community and beliefs, and one foot out the door and into the world of wild, endless possibility.

Part V, Poem #6, which breathes life and love over my body which I once thought I had to demonize and reject in order to live a pure and holy life.


You will love this book if you have ever left or considered leaving a belief system behind, in search of something more true to who you are, or if you are curious about what this journey is like. The Unlearning speaks to those who have gone through an unlearning journey themselves and those who want to grapple with religion and fundamental belief systems in a new way.

Ultimately, The Unlearning inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

How can I meaningfully create a life that I love, even if it means leaving certain beliefs or people behind?

How do I uproot myself from my community without losing my sense of worth and being in the process?

What does it look like to change and evolve without totally losing myself and my values in the process?

Maddy really looks forward to exploring these questions and beyond with her readers. Coming together and discussing change, growth, loss of community, body acceptance and the idea of truth will change us all for the better.
 

The Book - The Unlearning

The book is written in 5 Parts....

Part I, Growing Up In It, takes the reader through Maddy's adolescent days as a devout Christian, giving glimpses into some fond memories as well as some troubling experiences she had with the religion and the community she was surrounded by.

Part II, The Knowing, is written around the deep feeling that something was not quite right about the world views she held growing up. It invites the reader into the daily struggles and inner-conflicts she was trying to manage while still being a part of the faith community she grew up in.

Part III, The Letting Go, focuses on key moments and feelings that Maddy experienced as a result of deciding to let go of the religion she had loved, leaving behind a world of certainty. It touches on the pain and confusion of letting go as well as the first sight of light at the end of the tunnel.

Part IV, The Rebirth, is about the liberation, freedom, and happiness that she found on the other side of her unlearning journey. This section really brings the reader into intimate moments that shape the way she finally learned to love her thoughts, heart, and body.

Part V, What I Would Go Back and Tell Myself, is an uplifting section filled with poems that Maddy wishes she had read when she was in the thick of her journey out of faith. These words are meant to encourage anyone who may also be going through or has been through this journey themselves.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2020.

The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats).

The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish

A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book

Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)

Early access to the Introduction of my Book and some additional sections of my manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback

The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover

I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experiences of writing my book

And more...

 

About the Author

Maddy Garrett is a poet and writer as well as a digital marketer for political campaigns at BASK Digital Media in San Diego, CA.

Maddy wrote this book as a way to not only process her own unlearning journey, but to also share that experience with others in hopes that it is able to reach someone who may need to hear the words on these pages. She wants to be a source of hope, commonality and community for others out there who have experienced this journey.

Maddy is a lover of books, animals, crisp air, mountains and trees, morning coffee and house plants. If she’s not writing poems or working her 9-5 in political marketing, she can be found reading a book, walking her foster dogs, or planning her next adventure.

For more information you can connect with Maddy at hello@maddygarrett.com and on Instagram at @whoa_maddy_actually_ or @just.my.ramblings.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #TheUnlearning and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Maddy Garrett

story:
A Journey of the Heart & Soul

For many years I have been the one who stays at home and held a place for others who were off achieving their dreams.  That is honorable work and I am glad for those I have supported over the years.  But now it is my turn to claim my dream.  Ireland is the land of my ancestors and a place that has called to me my whole life.  The stories, the music, the history have all spoken to me and have been calling me there.  Now I am ready to heed that call.

Reaching For My Dream


This is a act of faith and of willingness to be open to whatever will come along the way.  For 9 days I will have the chance to put aside "real world" commitments and give myself over to Spirit.  To let the noise die away to hear the subtle voice within.  I have had a long spell of having to let go of people and things that have been very dear to me.  It has been in preparation for this journey.  It emptied me out that I can be refilled and reborn in a new way.

I knew the moment I read about this trip, that it was something I needed to do.  That this was the answer to the unidentified longing I have been feeling for months and I could not ignore it, even though I had no idea how I would get the means to do it.  This site is born of that certainty that I must make this trip.

Supporting My Journey

I need your help.  Your donation, whatever size, will help pay for me to travel to Ireland to fulfill my dream of walking the land of my ancestors and opening myself up to the gifts and guidence of Spirit and of the ancient sites I will be visiting along the ancient pilgrimage to Brigid's sacred places.

I walk to find a piece of myself that I have long forgotten.  I walk that I might rekindle the fire that has died into embers.  I walk that I might bring all that I take in back to those who are not able to take the journey.

It takes but a small step to begin a journey....

And your act of generousity will help begin mine

story:
The Spectator Tribune celebrates all that makes the Canadian Prairies extraordinary, recognizing the fact that our long winters and hot summers lead to a thriving, unique community of artists, entrepreneurs, athletes and innovators. 

The Spectator Tribune is yours, and if the Prairies decide to support this already popular project, it will be here for a long time.

I am the owner/editor, and, while I hope to be able to pay myself through this business, full disclosure, the money raised here will first and foremost go towards compensating all Spectator Tribune’s talented writers.

We launched in October of 2012. Our readership is large and growing. And the Spectator Tribune has already sold some lucrative ad campaigns, but, to be honest, the publication will not see those dollars for many months.

Your money will pay for writers, yes, but it will also pay for the development of a publication you’ll have the ability to steer. I respond to every email sent my way. And the direction of this publication as a means to tie the Prairies together is, in part, dependant on what you, the reader, want to see.

Manitoba, Saskatchewan and Alberta have a lot of writing talent and they have been completely forgotten by Canada’s national media. The print publications we pay for and hold so dear have little interest in what goes on in the Prairies, an opinion uncomfortably close to fact.

The bulk of news consumers have already committed to online consumption; what lags is the organizations themselves, unable to transform bloated, top-heavy newsrooms into media outlets focused on delivering content readers want, in the style they want, using mediums they have access to and use.

We in the Prairies have opinions about our politics, our culture and a unique perspective of what it means to be Canadian. We love our festivals, our sports teams, our burgeoning food culture and our hole-in-the-wall galleries. If it’s interesting, pressing, thought-provoking, divisive, you can be sure the Spectator Tribune will cover it.

Journalism is not dying. And, no, the media landscape is not changing. It has fully changed.

The hope for the Spectator Tribune, and all who want this great online-only publication to stick around should agree, is to find a balance between profitability, staying lean and sustainable, and remaining fair to the talent that makes it all possible.

Thanks for your support!

Toban Dyck
