story:
Short Summary


Hello, everyone! We -- Cheryl Tyiska and Fern Washington -- completed the ancient Camino de Santiago pilgrimage across  Northern Spain in October 2013. It was life-changing to walk hundreds of miles along the sacred path with only what we carried on our backs. Along the way, we met pilgrims like ourselves needing a change from the everyday. We went looking for an experience and we found it and more -- a spiritual life change. Now, we want to share that experience with others.

One way we can "give back" our experience is to become volunteers along the Camino. The American Pilgrims on the Camino (APOC) sponsors training for "hospitalero" volunteers to prepare them to volunteer in critical ways along the Camino. Cheryl and Fern are raising funds to attend the training in the US in April 2014, and then spend two weeks volunteering along the Camino in Spain later in the year. As APOC's website so eloquently states, "Many walkers on the Camino carry a strong sense of being part of a stream, a stream of humanity or even a flow of history, moving ever westward. As an hospitalero you become a rock in that stream. The rock stays in place and a drop of water hesitates briefly and then moves on, leaving the rock to interact with the next drop and the next and the next. You provide the resting place where fellow pilgrims can stop and renew themselves in body, mind and spirit."

Hospitalero volunteers exist to serve the pilgrims. They give warm welcomes, provide information and guidance (for example, on where to get first aid, where to buy supplies along the way, when and where to find pilgrim church services, organizing meals, cleaning the "albergues" where pilgrims sleep each night, checking people in and out of the albergues), and perhaps most importantly, listening to pilgrims as they talk about their spiritual journey or about the challenges they face. Like walking the Camino, volunteering to help other pilgrims is an intense form of service.

Also -- just so you will know -- after we return from volunteering as hospitaleros, it is our intention to return to the Camino annually to lead small groups of pilgrims. We will do fundraising to help offset the costs for people who otherwise would never have such an opportunity. But that is looking down the road just a bit ...

What We Need & What You Get

Registration fee for Fern to attend Hospitalero Training April 1-3, 2014, in Belleville, Illinois @ $250 = $250 (Cheryl has a scholarship)

Registration fee for 2 to attend 2014 Gathering of Pilgrims April 3-6, 2014, in Belleville, Illinois @ $360 each = $720.00

Information about the Gathering and Training can be found at http://www.americanpilgrims.com/events/events_national.html

Two round-trip tickets to Illinois (one from Oregon, one from Maryland) to Illinois (estimated @ $500 each) = $1,000

Ground Transportation @ $50 each = $100

Per Diem @ $40 each per day x 7 days = $560

The total estimated cost is $2,630

If there is any excess money left over, it will be saved to offset costs for our trip to Spain to serve as hospitalero volunteers later in the year. 

If we do not reach our goal and cannot attend the Gathering and Training in April, we will save the money for the next available 2014 Training and for the 2015 Gathering. 

The Impact

We first learned about the Camino de Santiago by watching the movie "The Way," produced by Emilio Estavez and starring his father, Martin Sheen. (See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Way_(film) for information about the movie.) That movie convinced us that we needed to walk the Camino ourselves, and the dreaming began. We are two out-of-shape women in our late 50's who had never undertaken such an adventure. But the Camino resonated with us. We did our homework, made our plans, and saved our coins one by one, until we were able to actually get on a plane and head to Spain for a month of pilgrimage. 

It sounds trite to say that the Camino changed our lives, but it did. And it is calling us back. We want to help other pilgrims along The Way the same way we were helped, and we want more Americans to know about the Camino, especially those like us who have few resources and big dreams. We want to share the spirit of the Camino so others can experience it in their own way, and to have a brief respite from the difficulties they live with day in and day out. Our ultimate goal is to create a small, personalized tour group experience for people who want to make the Pilgrimage but cannot do it by themselves.

Each pilgrim walks their own Camino. There are Christians and non-Christians. There are young and old, rich and poor. Each pilgrim comes home changed by the Camino. We want to be part of that experience on behalf of others.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please learn about the beautiful and historic Camino de Santiago yourself. There are many websites you can visit to see beautiful photos, read personal pilgrim blogs and learn about the Camino. The American Pilgrims on the Camino is a good place to start:  www.americanpilgrims.com.

Feel free to contact us directly at moonhawk1127@yahoo.com if you would like to communicate directly with us.

Also, please tell others about our campaign to raise funds to get training to become Camino volunteers and to ultimately lead small tours along The Way. 

Please know that as we train and volunteer and lead others, we will keep you and your generosity in our prayers. There is a lovely tradition of pilgrims leaving rocks, photos and other small personal items along The Way, especially at the Cruce de Ferro (Iron Cross) near Foncebadon. Each pilgrim leaves an item for personal reasons: to atone for a shortcoming or to give thanks for a blessing, but mostly to symbolize putting down a burden. When we went on our first Camino, we took "burdens" from our family members and laid them at the Cruce de Ferro on their behalf. We would be glad to do the same for you, too. Simply email us for a  mailing address. We don't need to know who you are or what your "burden" means. God will know.

story:
The Project

 

I was raised on fairy tales and religious fanaticism. They both affected me greatly as a little girl growing up in a very chaotic home. Due to these two enormous influences, I believe I was ill equipped for life. I believe that the way that society stereotypically programs little girls is suspect and must be reevaluated. I wrote my own life story and how my own reality failed me miserably despite all of my very best efforts. This memoir is my saga of self discovery: defining dramatic moments, life changing choices, and eventual real world redemption. After years and years of subconscious programming, I needed a huge wake up call! And boy did I get it! This memoir is a complete accounting of a little girl's journey to hell and back again. It is an exciting revelation about how she is now wide awake and ready to change the world for the better. She believes that one of the greatest ways that we can truly do this is by empowering women, one little girl at a time. My name is Jenna F. Hill. I want to invite you in making this memoir a reality and a way to truly transform lives through one woman's amazing story.

 

 

 

Why an Indiegogo Campaign?

 

I have chosen to self publish my story, because I want it to truly be MY story. I want my own personal words to be heard without any outside influences. I need your help in making this dream a reality. Indiegogo will help me raise the funds needed to self publish this memoir. The funds raised here will go directly to the editing, publishing, and marketing of this memoir. I have joined forces with a fabulous self publishing company.This company will faithfully work with me as an independent author in completing all of the steps of transferring my memoir from my private world into the public realm where it can help transform lives.

When I raise $10,000, I will be able to work with my publishing company to produce and market all parts of my memoir. The $10,000 covers all editing, producing, and marketing. It also provides social media promotion links, a You Tube video, and a complete package for me to truly make this memoir a reality. The company that I am working with has a reputation and history for producing only the best products.

 If the $10,000 is not raised in its entirety, the partial funds raised will still be used to produce this memoir. I am using a flexible campaign through Indiegogo so that any funds raised are kept and go directly towards publishing this book, "Cinderella, The Church, and A Crazy Lady". I am confident though that with your help I will raise the funds fully. I know how powerful and life transforming this book is. I know how much hope and healing it provides. Please help me to be the change that I want to see in this world. Please help me to publish this empowering story.

 

 

The Impact

 

This world has become so isolated and callus in my humble opinion. People are suffering and searching. It is time to end powerlessness and purposelessness. I believe that this memoir will help you to feel empowered. You will read about one woman's true story of enduring unbelievable abuse and overcoming insurmountable obstacles. You will read about her failures and frailty; her suffering and searching; and ultimately her redemption and revival. This story will show you the power of one: one story, one voice, and one soul seeking to change the world for the better. Please join me in funding this life changing campaign. Thank you so much for spreading the word, contributing financially, and ultimately buying this book when this project fulfills its ultimate purpose, publishing and promoting, "Cinderella, The Church, and A Crazy Lady". Oh! And when you contribute you will be funding a veteran of the US Armed Forces. I faithfully and happily served this country in the United States Army. It was by far one of the best times of my life and a huge part of this memoir. Please allow one woman veteran's voice to be heard. Please help fund this campaign. Thank you so much!!!

story:
Welcome To My First Indiegogo Campaign



My name is Kent Burden and I am a wellness coach and personal trainer. I found my way to the world of health and wellness after a college football injury left me a paraplegic at the age of 20. I was confined to a wheelchair for nearly a year. It was a tough time for me but after multiple surgeries and rehabilitation, I eventually made a full recovery. This powerful experience lead me to a career in mind/body wellness where I have trained Oscar-, Emmy-, and Grammy-winners, NFL and NBA champion athletes and people from all walks of life. 

What Our Project Is All About

The Modern Day Hunter Gatherer

So many people believe that better health and more vitality is just a new diet or exercise fad away, but research shows that doing one or both of these things for a short period of time has little or no effect on our long term health. In order to lose weight and keep it off and lower your risk of developing lifestyle diseases like diabetes, heart disease, obesity and cancer you have to make a lifestyle change. Our forefathers did not diet or exercise, yet they were thinner and had fewer lifestyle diseases than we do today. I believe this is because movement and real whole foods were the essence of our forefathers existence. The Modern Day Hunter Gatherer is a road map to a healthier lifestyle that combines ancient wisdom with modern research. This book gives you all the tools you need to slowly and painlessly change your lifestyle and look and feel your best. This book is filled with advice on:

How to eat like a Modern Day Hunter Gatherer (the healthiest food for modern man) 

How to choose the best produce, meat, grains, etc. that are best for your health and your budget.

How to grow your own produce and herbs even if you have very limited space.

Simple and delicious real food recipes.

Why sitting is killing you and what to do about it.

How to be more active all day long, burn tons of calories the easy, no-sweat way, and still be both productive and more creative at work.

Short workouts that fit into your schedule and fitness abilities.

Recipes for homemade natural household cleaning and beauty products that will lower your exposure to harmful chemicals that can affect your health and even make you fat.

How to do all of this one step at a time.


What We Need  

Let's face it, creating a high quality health and wellness book is expensive. We are new to crowd funding and have set a modest goal of $2,000 but what we really need is at least $6000 to pay for things like:

  • A full professional copy editing of the book
  • A professionally printed paperback book
  • Top quality cover art
  • Professional photography of food, recipes and exercises 
  • Fitness models to show readers how to do the exercises like an expert
  • Marketing

What You Get

Because we want to bring as many people into the tribe as possible, we have set up several levels of rewards so that anyone can afford to belong. Perks include personal thanks on our social media platform, pre-release book copies, other books published by the author, thanks in the book's acknowledgment page, Modern Day Hunter Gatherer T- shirts and pint glasses, personalized fitness programs and wellness coaching sessions.

My 25 years of health and wellness experience and passion for helping people is what I bring to this very special project. If you have the resources for the Shaman or Warrior package I will gladly bring those same years of experience and passion to you personally, just as I have for such A-list stars like Julia Roberts, Reese Witherspoon, Drew Barrymore, Clint Black, and Alanis Morissette.  

Whether we reach our goal or not, your donations will help us to create the best book possible and get it into the hands of as many people as we can.

Note: For packages that require shipping, if you live outside the continental USA please add $10.00.


Why Crowd Funding?

The real question is why not. Crowd funding allows me to reach out to like-minded individuals and create a “tribe” of people who care about the health of their bodies, their food system and the earth as a whole. You get to be a part of something that could positively affect the health of thousands...conceivably, millions of people and get some really sweet swag to boot. Sounds like a win, win situation to me. 


You Can Be Confident That This Project Will Come To Fruition

I am an award-winning author who has already written & published 6 books. I know exactly how this process works and how to get it done right. Creating a high-quality product with professional photography and editing is my goal, and your help will make all the difference.

Read Excerpts From The Upcoming Book

"Eating like a hunter gatherer doesn’t mean taking down the nearest Mastodon and roasting it over an open fire while burping and farting, (I have to admit that sounds like our last camping trip and it was a hell of a lot of fun) but eating like our ancestors can be both tasty and healthy. Our ancestors ate what was in season; they searched out fruits, vegetables, wild grains and leafy greens that were ripe and juicy. They trapped, fished and hunted animals that had lived their lives eating their natural diet. Almost everything our ancestors ate was local, fresh, vibrant, alive, and literally bursting with nutrients. Today that’s not the case. So much of what most of us eat..." Read more 

Other Ways You Can Help

If giving money isn't your thing, that’s cool. There are other ways you can help. Please add your voice to our social media platform by hitting the share buttons below. Social media is incredibly important and we truly appreciate your support.

Follow us on twitter: https://twitter.com/kentburden. 

Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/kent.burden.3 or better yet, tell a friend... or even 100 friends! You can use the Indiegogo share tools to get the word out. We want you!  Join the Modern Day Hunter Gatherer tribe today!

lower your exposure to harmful chemicals that can affect your health and even
make you fat.How to do all of this one step at a time.What We Need  Let's face it,
creating a high quality health and wellness book is expensive. We are new to
crowd funding and have set a modest goal of $2,000 but what we really need is at least $6000 to pay for things like:

A
full professional copy editing of the book


A
professionally printed paperback book


Top
quality cover art


Professional
photography of food, recipes and exercises 


Fitness
models to show readers how to do the exercises like an expert


Marketing

What You Get
Because we want to
bring as many people into the tribe as possible, we have set up several levels
of rewards so that anyone can afford to belong. Perks include personal thanks
on our social media platform, pre-release book copies, other books published by
the author, thanks in the book's acknowledgment page, Modern Day Hunter
Gatherer T- shirts and pint glasses, personalized fitness programs and wellness
coaching sessions.My 25 years of health and wellness experience and passion for helping people is what I bring to this very special project. If you have the resources for the Shaman or Warrior package I will gladly bring those same years of experience and passion to you personally, just as I have for such A-list stars like Julia Roberts, Reese Witherspoon, Drew Barrymore, Clint Black, and Alanis Morissette.  
Whether we reach our
goal or not, your donations will help us to create the best book possible and
get it into the hands of as many people as we can.
Note: For packages that
require shipping, if you live outside the continental USA please add $10.00.Why Crowd Funding?The
real question is why not. Crowd funding allows me to reach out to like-minded
individuals and create a “tribe” of people who care about the health of their
bodies, their food system and the earth as a whole. You get to be a part of something
that could positively affect the health of thousands...conceivably, millions of people and get some really sweet
swag to boot. Sounds like a win, win situation to me. You Can Be Confident That This Project Will Come To FruitionI am an award-winning
author who has already written & published 6 books. I know exactly how this process works and how to get it done right. Creating a high-quality product with professional photography and editing is my goal, and your help will make all the difference.Read Excerpts From The Upcoming Book"Eating like a hunter gatherer doesn’t mean taking down the nearest Mastodon and roasting
it over an open fire while burping and farting, (I have to admit that sounds
like our last camping trip and it was a hell of a lot of fun) but eating like
our ancestors can be both tasty and healthy. Our ancestors ate what was in
season; they searched out fruits, vegetables, wild grains and leafy greens that were ripe
and juicy. They trapped, fished and hunted animals that had lived their lives
eating their natural diet. Almost everything our ancestors ate was local,
fresh, vibrant, alive, and literally bursting with nutrients. Today that’s not the case. So much of what most of us eat..." Read more Other Ways You Can HelpIf giving money
isn't your thing, that’s cool. There are other ways you can help. Please add your
voice to our social media platform by hitting the share buttons below. Social media is incredibly important and we truly appreciate your support.Follow us on twitter: https://twitter.com/kentburden. Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/kent.burden.3 or better yet, tell a friend... or even
100 friends! You can use the Indiegogo share tools to get the word out. We want you!  Join the Modern Day Hunter Gatherer tribe today!

story:
London hosts the 2014 Worldcon, Loncon 3. I want to attend dreadfully, as a freelance copy editor, and as a reader. 

Magic Carpet Ride is my travel fund to attend Worldcon and visit London. That long weekend in London would be perfect.

Would you help me with this dream, please? 


When I was a kid, I dreamed of editing books like the ones I loved to read.

Now I copyedit science fiction and fantasy novels. I want to help readers get the book the author meant to write, and I'm good at what I do.  

Certainly, many of my editors and my authors have been kind enough to tell me so.  8)

Big cons like Worldcon are the best places for me to meet clients, and sometimes meeting them is what gets me that job.

I want to see my UK authors and editors, and meet as many overseas publishers as I can. 

Most authors pay their bills with day jobs; editing IS my day job. And I don't earn a living wage. Not yet. 

Getting more work is the key to changing that.


I have promised friends that a trip to London would mean pictures. I am rubbish at taking pictures – unlike Bea. I want to do Worldcon with her. 

She is my best friend and co-conspirator. Bea's in South Africa, so we haven’t met in person. Unless we can meet at Worldcon. 

Sharing adventures with friends is always better. 

We met because we're both BBC Sherlock fangirls... who love Shakespeare... who are sf/f fans. Kindred spirits.

Bea is always there for me.

It tells you something about the world that it’d work out best for us to meet each other in a completely different country, doesn’t it?


My London trip will cost £2170 or $3723.47.  Not including the fees for Indiegogo and PayPal, plus taxes...

So I need to earn $781.50 to cover all that as well.  


The pictures will be set up for all to see when we're back. 

Any help is much appreciated. Please post all the SNS:  Google+ and Facebook, Twitter, tumblr, blogs, and even email if you would. Thanks so much for reading!


Addendum:  

I made a rough draft many weeks ago for my expenses. It included: my RT flight; passport; food; upgrade to an attending membership; hotel (or hostel).

Bea is more organized; SHE made spreadsheets. 8)


Pictures lent to me by my friend, David Tallerman.  Thanks, Dave!

story:
"The Outpost is a reminder of the power of imagination to shift perspectives."  — The Guardian


The Outpost is a Beirut-based magazine about possibilities in the Arab world. We are a ‘magazine of possibilities’ when the narrative of where we live is a daily declaration of impossibility. In Lebanon, you’re told it’s impossible to think. In Egypt, you’re told it’s impossible to speak. In Palestine, you’re told it’s impossible to live. In Tunisia, you’re told it’s impossible to win. In Saudi Arabia, you’re told it’s impossible to grow. In Syria, you’re told it’s impossible to survive.



We started The Outpost magazine in 2012, participating in a growing fertile terrain for change. An Outpost is a remote elevated platform positioned at some distance from a colony, used especially as a guard against surprise attack. It is a tool for foresight. With The Outpost, we look past trends in creating a platform of positive change. We are inspired by the World Makers that are constructing a new sustainable and sovereign Arab world.

In our first year in print, throughout four issues, we discovered an immense amount of activity pushing our Arab world forward. Through the three sections that comprise each issue: What’s Happening, What’s Not Happening & What Could Happen*, we uncovered narratives of change, highlighted situations that need to be changed and imagined scenarios of possible change. In parallel, our network was growing. Our proactive Arab readers have picked up the flag of The Outpost as one of the different flags of this revolution. Our growing international audience is appreciating these new voices of the Arab world. We are part of this proud, shameless and pioneering Arab youth that are changing their world and rebuilding a new Arab world that is fit for their dreams.

*We've uploaded the three sections of Issue 02 on issuu to give new readers a better idea about the narratives we publish.



Tear Down This Wall! is a call for action that we launched in an attempt to trigger thought about the walls that stand between the Arab youth and their possibilities.


The Impact

Nominated for Best New Magazine (2012) and Best Magazine Design (2012, 2013) at the Magpile Magazine Awards

Awarded two Gold medals by the Society for News Design - Middle East


“The Outpost is my new favorite magazine. It is, overall, an impressive package—interesting and relevant reportage, beautiful design and graphics, with a mission to make change in a volatile, emerging region. Even if you aren't much interested in changing the Arab world, this magazine will make you think about where you personally stand and, through its stories and reports, make you think about what is possible in your life.”

        — Dan Rowden, Founder, Magpile


“The Outpost feels like a successor to the Economist.” 

         — John O'Reilly, The Guardian


"You rekindled a dream I had, and made me believe again in the future, I felt connected and somehow it wasn't just us, but everyone you were writing about felt exactly the same. In every single interview I have had, they asked me what made you start Rowayat... The answer is simple .... The Outpost."

           — Sherine el-Banhawy, Founder of Rowayat, a new literary                       publication from Egypt


"It's a great thing you're doing, it's a revolution what you're writing ... Where will [the young] see the space for them to grow, if they don't want the old ways anymore? I think and hope they'll find it in you. When I sat and read the magazine I knew this was a great thing you were doing, and it's not about the paper and the design for me though they are the best you've picked. The thing that gets me is the words, the man walking away from the border on page thirty after not having enough cigarettes to get through killed me, and the sex story at the back warmed me, I sat there in a coffee shop and your pages breathed..."

           — Adnan Sarwar, winner of the Bodley Head/Financial Times Essay Prize

“Two-thumbs up!” 

          — Tyler Brûlé, Editor in Chief, Monocle


Below is a really awesome video review we received from Steve Watson, the man behind The Stack.


Why do we need funding & what will we do with it?

We are not part of the existing commercial model, so it’s hard to secure our funds. We also do not want to compromise to fit the mainstream. We, along with our fellow World Makers, want to build a more responsible mainstream, for that matter.

It’s possible, and that time will come, but now as we plunge into our second year publishing independently, we need your help. It took us only a year to position ourselves as a trustworthy, generous platform. Your donation will be an investment in our second year. We need 53,000 US Dollars in order to:

  • Create new narratives and develop our editorial and visual content for year 2
  • Print 4 new issues in 2014
  • Hire key team members to help sustain our growth (fundraising manager, distribution & marketing coordinator, and an editorial assistant)
  • Explore new platforms on which we can publish our current and new narratives


World Makers come in all shapes and sizes. Tailor your contribution!

We've identified three groups of World Makers that can help make our campaign successful. Each has different rewards relevant to how each World Maker fits within the universe of The Outpost.

1.  Excited Readers: If you’re a reader who really likes our narratives and would like to explore more of them, your donation can go a long way. We have a host of narrative-rich options waiting for you!

2.  Young Creators: If you’re an Arab creator, thinker or entrepreneur producing work that is positively impacting the Arab world, your support will land you a spot in our upcoming World Making Factorium* series. Think of it as your portal to the world, and the world’s directory to the best young Arab world makers – you!

3.  Progressive Brands: If you’re a brand that wants to associate itself with the young and inspiring change makers of the Arab world, The Outpost is your gateway to their world*. The Outpost is a top-selling magazine in 35 countries around the world. Our issues are being picked up by an eclectic and inspiring group of Arab and Western readers. Also, by putting on your socially-conscious hat and backing our campaign, your support will have a double impact!

* For more info about the World Making Factorium, or if you have questions about the brand partnerships, please send us an email: info@the-outpost.com


Youmna Naufal, Head of Future News English, interviews our Editor in Chief, Ibrahim Nehme:


Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute, it doesn’t mean you cannot help! You can help us by spreading the word about our campaign and sharing it with your friends and social networks.

Help us move forward in imagining and implementing ‘What Could Happen’ in an unorthodox, creative new world. Join us in imagining the possibility of making everything better. 


THANK YOU!

story:
Greetings Communities of Cascadia and Beyond!

My name is Brian McCracken. I am a spoken word artist, educator, and organizer based out of Olympia, WA. If you know me or know my work, you might be aware that I am a member of Old Growth Poetry Collective, which I founded in 2011, which hosts regular poetry open-mics, poetry slams and poetry "play shops" here in Olympia. We also just wrapped up our Cascadia Cross-Pollination Tour, performing in Eugene, Portland, Seattle and Bellingham and making connections with performance poetry communities there. This past summer, I won a place on the Seattle Poetry Slam Nationals Team and competed with my team at the National Poetry Slam in Oakland, where we made semi-finals and were ranked #8 in the nation.

These two recent events have struck a new chord of desire in me to expand my work in the world of performance poetry and start a small business doing performance poetry education and performing services, such as graphic design, for other poets in the community. I have begun classes with Enterprise for Equity, a micro-loan and business training program for low-income folks here in Olympia to get some of those business skills. I already have two contracts in the works for teaching performance poetry, and will be approaching more organizations after the holidays. I'd like to dedicate myself full time to starting this business, and for that I need you.

During this time I will also be working on my manuscript for my first poetry book, If A Caterpillar Flaps Its Wings, and submitting poems to journals and periodicals. And start getting my work more published in the print world in general.

I'm super amped about this whole journey! All the work I've been doing in the Pacific Northwest with performance poetry has been leading to this point, and I'm excited and nervous at the undertaking, but I know this is what I need to do right now!


What I Need & What You Get

I'm asking for $2,380 from my communities in Olympia and beyond. After the IndieGoGo cut, and a portion of the proceeds going to the person helping produce a fabulous video for this campaign (currently in production) that will leave me with about $2,000. $350 of this will go towards tuition for Enterprise for Equity. About $250 will go into submission fees for various places I will be submitting poetry, including the manuscript once it is done. The remaining $1400 will go into living expenses (poets gotta eat too), and start-up capital for my small business and overhead expenses as I identify them.
What do you get? Well... swag!
  • $10: Old Growth Poetry Collective Patch
  • $25: My chapbook Dotted Lines: A Roadside Manifesto for Word Bleeders
  • $50: The patch and my chapbook, plus a copy of the OGPC Cross-Pollination Tour anthology chapbook.
  • $100: All of the above, plus an OGPC T-Shirt
  • $250: Your name or your organizations's name in the acknowledgement section of my next publication
  • $500: A personal performance by me for you or your organization

How Far Can This Go?

Performance poetry has been a catalytic force in my life. If you have been to a poetry slam or seen some of the amazing poets who are shaping this movement, you know this in your heart, like I do. I want to dedicate more of my time to spreading this craft. I want to bring it to schools, to mental health agencies, to political rallies, and everywhere else. I want to contribute to young people finding their voices and their confidence. I believe spoken word has the power to do all these things.
During my time with Old Growth Poetry Collective, we have built a performance poetry community in Olympia that is growing and thriving. We are currently working on getting our venue registered to send a team to national events, and there is nothing stopping us. The opportunities and momentum only continue to grow.

Roadblocks and Ladders

There is of course risk in this project. Starting a small business is tough enough, let alone in the arts. This is not guaranteed in any way, but no matter how things turn out I will have spent 2 months honing my craft with a lot of discipline and focus. I know that this CAN succeed though. For the past three years of OGPC I have also served as a program director for a youth program in Shelton & Olympia, and have learned a lot about contracting for working with youth and agencies that serve them. I have supporters in this field am already making headway on two contracts for 2015. The work has already begun!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not able to donate right now I can still use your support! Make some noise about this campaign! Performance poetry has a long way to go in the South Puget Sound Region, and it takes communities to get the good news out. There are sharing tools within this campaign that you can use to spread the word about my campaign.

Thanks so much for your time,

Brian McCracken

story:
Book Now On Sale!

The book is now for sale on Leanpub! You can also read the book for free on the Github repo.

 

Stretch Goals

  1. UNLOCKED!!! $10,000: I will record (after the book ships) and publicly release a series of ~5 minutes videos, one per main book chapter (expected 10 chapters for now).

    These chapter highlight videos will illustrate/explain some example or part of that chapter in detail. All backers will get early access to these videos before they're finished and ready for the general public.
  2. UNLOCKED!!! $16,400: I will give every backer a PDF (ebook) copy of each of the six titles in my YDKJS book series.

The Book

This book explores the core principles of functional programming (FP) that can be applied to JavaScript. But what makes this book different is that we approach these principles without drowning in all the heavy mathematical notation and terminology.

At the time of campaign launch, the book writing is more than 6 chapters draft-complete; at about 78 pages, I estimate it's over 50% done. If you'd like to see whether the book will be useful, judge for yourself: go read what's there so far.

Let's face it: unless you're already a member of the FP cool kids club (I'm not!), a statement like, "a monad is just a monoid in the category of endofunctors", just doesn't mean anything useful to us.

That's not to say the terms are meaningless. Once you graduate from Functional-Light, you'll maybe/hopefully want to study FP more formally, and you'll certainly receive plenty of exposure to what they mean and why.

But behind all that noise, there's a wealth of powerful concepts that all programmers can and should be using to bring their code up from merely working to readable and maintainable. I call this perspective "Functional-Light JavaScript".

I want you to be able to apply some of these important fundamentals of FP to your JavaScript now, because I believe it will help you write better, more reasonable code.

By the way, "Light" doesn't mean easy, beginner, or intro; it means limited in scope. In the spirit of my prior YDKJS books, we'll be diving quite deeply into this rather narrow list of topics:

  • Function Inputs/Outputs
  • Composition
  • Pure Functions (No Side Effects)
  • Value Immutability
  • List Operations
  • Recursion
  • Async Functional Programming... and more!

In The Open

One of the most important details that distinguishes this book writing and publishing from many others is that I'm doing it entirely in the open.

Not only can you read every word of the book online, you can do so while I write them. That means you get the material as soon as it's written, no delays. It also means you get to learn along with me, as you see words and code snippets not just written the first time, but revised and clarified and improved. The issue thread and commit history will permanently tell the story of how I learned FP and shared it with others; hopefully that will help others learn even more richly.

And the openness doesn't stop there. The whole process of preparing the book for publishing is going to be managed in the open. My strategic editor, tech editor, copy editor, etc -- all of them will be working in the open directly on the book material. That means we also learn better what exactly it takes to get a book finished. I hope more developers are inspired to write once they see what the process was like for me.

But I'm even going one step further: radical openness, if you will. I will be posting information (as appropriate) on the economics behind the book. You'll see how it plays out and what the dollars look like, not just of this campaign but of all the sales of the book.

Why Me?

Why am I writing this book? Because I want to finally learn practical functional programming. All the times I've tried to do that through existing resources, I got lost and mixed up with notation and terms, and I had no idea where to turn next. This book represents my unfolding learning-journey into FP, and I invite everyone to come along with me.

Many people know that I'm a full-time JavaScript teacher; I travel all over the world teaching developers of all sorts how to understand JavaScript more deeply. I'm also a published author (specifically of the "You Don't Know JS" book series). Some reasons why I'm the person to write this book:

  • 7 published books
  • 19+ yrs software development experience
  • 4 yrs full-time teaching experience
  • 250+ days in corporate training classrooms
  • 170,000+ hrs watched of my on-demand video training courses
  • 100+ conference talks
  • 10th most visited Github repo (YDKJS books) with over 42k stars

The Campaign

In the past, I worked with a traditional publisher to handle the publishing of my books. This time, however, I'm self publishing. This of course brings in a whole slew of complications that I've not had to deal with, and costs a fair bit of upfront money before I ever see the first $1 sold.

Because I am forming this content into a book instead of just a bunch of informal blog posts, I feel you the reader deserve a top-quality end result. That means I need to hire strategic editor(s), technical editor(s), copy editor(s), and even artist(s).

I'm running this campaign to ask you to help me cover these up front costs, as well as my time to write the book as quickly as I can. I have to split my time with paid teaching, but these funds will in part help me carve out time to finish the book ASAP.

What You Get

I'm asking for your help to support my process. As you'll see in the rewards, many levels include you getting a free copy of the ebook. This book will be in a professionally edited, typeset format. As I said, the content in its raw form will remain in the open and free to read (markdown format). But you'll get the best reading experience from the published book, and backers of this campaign will be the first to get them!

Rewards here will include digital ebooks (not print), because I'm going to keep costs and time down and not do physical rewards. I expect and hope there will be print versions of the books available for sale. All backers that get an ebook copy will get an exclusive deep discount on paper copies if/when they are eventually available.

I'm also offering some higher-level rewards if you'd like to combine the book with some of my teaching or consulting. These prices are as much as 70% lower than my normal billing rates, so you'll definitely want to take advantage of them!

The Impact

Based on sales and traffic numbers on the YDKJS repo, I estimate I've reached as many as 100k JS developers. Those books have been translated into at least 5 other languages, and sold in more than 30 countries. I expect that most of the audience of YDKJS will eventually be readers of this book, and hopefully perhaps even more.

Helping me write/publish this book means a truly world-wide audience will be impacted positively by your generosity and support.

Risks & Challenges

The most obvious risks are that I've never self-published before, so wading through those details is going to be a decent undertaking. I'm obsessive about the quality of the end product, so it's entirely possible these hiccups will delay final publishing beyond what I'd like.

My goal is to have the writing of the book done and publishing under way by the end of the year. I think this is a reasonable goal, since the book is already (at time of campaign launch) more than 50% draft written.

I'm going to keep rewards to digital form only, so as to avoid any risks of cost or time delays for physical rewards.

Other Ways You Can Help

I would love and be deeply honored if you could give even $1 to support this campaign.

But if you're looking for other ways to help, I would greatly appreciate you spreading the word about this campaign, on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Snapchat, or any other channel you prefer. You could even share it on Google+, if that's still a thing people use. :)

You can also help by reading the book content as it rolls out. Your eyeballs will help spot places where my explanations need improving. I would love your suggestions on improving the text. Join us over on the Github repo!
story_txt:
Book Now On Sale!
The book is now for sale on Leanpub! You can also read the book for free on the Github repo.
 
Stretch Goals


UNLOCKED!!! $10,000: I will record (after the book ships) and publicly release a series of ~5 minutes videos, one per main book chapter (expected 10 chapters for now).These chapter highlight videos will illustrate/explain some example or part of that chapter in detail. All backers will get early access to these videos before they're finished and ready for the general public.

story:
Who I Am

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • I am Jacob Siegel. 
  • My Slam Poetry is the focus of my life and what I want to do for the rest of it. 
  • I previously created a Youtube Channel to present my works 
  • However, as I had no access to good production materials or people it didn't turn out well. I would like Your help to make my next endeavor better.

What I Need

My current roadblock is money. 

I don't have enough to get a professional to film my poetry. While I am going to need at least $1000 between production costs but added a slight increase in my goal just in case.

story:
email Daniel and Katie - timertoppy@gmail.com for any questions

Timer Toppy began it's journey nearly 5 years ago when the inventors, Katie and Daniel, had their first child. Dealing with so many new tasks, emotions, and experiences Katie and Daniel found something that needed to be improved. Feeding your new born is a very vital part of life and it seems that the task is constant. Between pumping milk, labeling bottles, storing milk, mixing formula, warming milk, and feeding your little angel it seems there's no time for anything else. Timer Toppy is the story of a family working together to solve a problem by bringing a safe, easy to use, quality product to your home.

     Katie found that using sticky notes was aggravating when labeling the bottles. The notes almost always fell off and having to do math at 3am just wasn't cutting it anymore. Timer Toppy was originally built directly into the bottle top of the breast milk storage bottles. You press the button and the timer starts counting up. When you need to use the milk it's easy to see which is the oldest, but still good for consumption. We quickly realized that the timer could be used for many more things and so we reached out to the good people at Hoegger Supply. We sat with them and discussed the idea and how the timer could be useful for their customers. They thought the idea was GREAT! They were constantly losing track of how long their goat milk was in the fridge. 

     Timer Toppy went through a few more modifications and now we're finally ready to get them on the market. We have a manufacture ready and Hoegger has signed on as a distributor and will handle fulfillment to ensure quick and accurate shipping once we reach our funding goal. Now we need YOU!! Tell us what you think of the idea. Do you LOVE it? Share with your friends on social media and if you think this is product that can make your life just a little bit easier we'd love to have your support at any level. If you just want to help out, that's cool too we'll love you just the same!

What We Need & What You Get

Here's the Deal

  • We need to raise $18,000 to get our first production run out the door.  With your help we can get the factory molds and first run of real Timers out and on the market.
  • Select a perk from the options and you'll receive the items in the description along with your timers in Early 2016!

The Impact

  • This has been a long road for us to get to where we are today and with your Support whether monetary or just a good luck we know we can get TimerToppy into the hands of people that will truly love the product.  It's a simple design and it makes life easier, so what are you waiting for ~ share or contribute, you won't be disappointed!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Get the word out and help us tell those who need this product that we're here to help
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Tell us what you think of the idea - leave us a comment here or post to our facebook page and we'll copy it over to this page for our supports to see
  • Thanks for reading through our campaign and taking at least a small interest in who we are and where we're going!

story:
Fic-tion

Hi my name is Luis, I am a graduate student at MIT and I am launching Fic-tion, a web and mobile app to read e-books for free. I have a passion for reading and like to explore new authors. I find that reading is a way to explore new worlds using your mind as a painter of real experiences and emotions. A book is a guide for your imagination.

I also believe in rewarding the authors that allowed me to live through these experiences and moments that I would have never thought of myself. 

So I am launching a platform to distribute and read free books, and that also allows for the authors to be compensated for their contributions to your enjoyment.

I am also adding a social network element and that is to allow you to share good books with those you care about. They are free so it is easier to recommend someone to read a book!

How Fic-tion works

We will create a platform where you can browse and read books from new or well-known authors for free. 

There are two kinds of books on my catalog and e-reader.

  • Unlocked. All of these books are available to read by anyone at any time.
  • Locked. These books can be read if you buy them or if you join our book club. However, these books will also run a crowdfunding campaign so that they can be released into the wild and be accessible to read by anyone for free.

The Impact

By launching our platform you will be helping authors receive more exposure and drive traffic to their works and you will be able to share these books with any of your friends and family. 

Most authors barely make a few dollars per book copy, and this is if they even charge for their books. A lot of authors publish their books for free in Amazon so that they can get on the top lists.

If we launch this platform, authors will not have to worry about the risk that they face if they were to publish on their own, and they will rely on the quality of their work.

All book sellers such as Amazon only give 65-70% of the book sale revenue to the content providers, whether they are publishers or independent authors. Since I will also sell the locked e-books I will pledge to give the content providers 80% or all proceeds! If you like an unlocked book you don't have to buy it, but you can also give a donation or tip to the author for giving you hours of entertainment. You tip cab drivers, why not authors!

The Pledge

Books will run their campaigns and release their content for however much they want to receive. People will pledge $1 or more to contribute to releasing the book to everyone once the goal is met. For example, an author wants a minimum of $25,000 for their book. He or she will collect pledges until this amount is received, and everyone gets to enjoy the book.

  • New authors are encouraged to unlock their books at zero pledges to get a following and get their content spread through social media.
  • Authors with a following guarantee that they will receive a minimum amount for their books and that other people might explore their content and increase their user base.
  • Everybody gets to enjoy free books and be fair to the authors.

Risks & Challenges

We need funding to launch a prototype and convince publishers to work with us. The approximate cost is $5,000. However, we would also welcome additional donations so we can start creating the mobile app. The full platform will be close to $50,000 and we will give equity to anyone who donates more than $10,000 up to five individuals.

  • I am working with MIT engineers and developers to get the best platform technology out there.
  • We also have extensive social media analytic data tools that allow us to create the most efficient campaigns for authors.
Our biggest challenge is to get the most popular authors on our platform, and this is why crowdfunding works for them. They enter a platform with a wide audience and also guarantee a minimum revenue for their content. Pledging $1 is not much for a reader, but for popular authors this will add up.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are an author or a publisher and would like to see my revenue projections please contact me. The business model is a little more detailed and I've projected that I can get authors a much higher share the retail e-book copy price.

story:
¿Qué?

La muerte del cerezo es una profunda novela interior, un crisol de historias, en un alarde de eso que algunos vienen llamando vocación de estilo.

Nagano murió cruzando las vías del tren, desde entonces habla a través de un gato que se quedó a vivir en el paso a nivel después de aquel día. Su hermana, Sukue, escapa del dolor carteándose con un desconocido a kilómetros de distancia. El vecino de al lado, que vive obsesionado con la anciana de los paseos nocturnos, está esperando la oportunidad de su vida para coger el último tren a casa. Y entretanto, un hombre afianzado a sus recuerdos como método de supervivencia, planea sus momentos finales antes de suicidarse. Este es un libro escrito con retazos de momentos porque al fin y al cabo así es como está confeccionada la vida y así es como nos unimos a la de los demás, entrelazando nuestros caminos. Una novela acerca de cómo el amor, la autocompasión y el perdón pueden ir llenando todos nuestros vacíos.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de publicar obras poco convencionales pero de indudable calidad, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para promocionar cada título cuando esta todavía se encuentra en proceso de edición.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy se nos presenta Rocío R. Ródenas.

Llegué al mundo el 5 de enero de 1992. Valencia me vio nacer y aquí crecí arropada por su clima mediterráneo. Papá es un gran escritor, mamá una ávida lectora y yo tuve la picardía de elegir ambos dones para llevarlos conmigo. De los cuentos para dormir que memorizaba de pequeña pasé a mis primeros relatos cortos apenas pude sostener un lápiz. Y fue una buena profesora de Historia quien descubrió mi pasión y me propuso para un certamen de literatura en el cual fui premiada. Y ahí empezó todo. En 2011 terminé de escribir y publiqué mi primera novela, Amor y hacer el amor en Londres y la Psicología se cruzó en mi vida. Me centré en mis estudios y terminé la carrera que resultó ser mi vocación, me dediqué a formarme, a hacer voluntariados, impartir charlas en pro de la salud mental… Acabé mis dos másteres y encontré el trabajo del que me enamoré y sigo enamorada. Un amor que vivieron también mis escritos, puesto que se han nutrido de la Psicología para enriquecer su trasfondo y ayudar además a que puedan cumplir una labor de conciencia social. Ahora que tengo encaminada mi profesión, me centré en mi segunda novela, La muerte del cerezo, en cuyo fondo se refleja el paso del tiempo desde mi primera novela y todo lo que he aprendido en estos años. Ahora dedico mis días al amor, la familia, mi trabajo y seguir avanzando como escritora.

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«Cuando alguien hacía sonar la campanita en el marco de la puerta ella dejaba cuidadosamente lo que estaba haciendo y se dirigía hacia la entrada, excusándose primero con el señor Tobashi por tener que ausentarse esos instantes. Una vez se encontraba con el interesado, la librería parecía convertirse en un alojamiento y ella en su anfitriona. Acompañaba a su nuevo huésped por la pequeña superficie de la librería mostrándole las miles de estancias donde podía poner a descansar su agotada alma. Ella llegaba a acariciar el interior de quienes entraban, rozaba lo más profundo de cada uno y según lo que percibía le ofrecía una cosa u otra. A los que precisaban media pensión les recomendaba una novela ligera, breve, que pudieran devorar rápidamente para poder seguir con su viaje. Los que venían de más lejos, aquellos que en verdad necesitaban encontrar un lugar para guarecerse, se dejaban seducir por tomos más profundos. Títulos que escondían una nota de esperanza en sus palabras, novelas que compartían tiempos de sosiego. A todos los trataba por igual, les ofrecía su hospitalidad y durante los intercambios de opiniones les conducía hacia la estufa de gas para que entrasen en calor. Chiyoko atendía a sus clientes desde la más profunda comprensión, escuchando pacientemente lo que venían buscando. No importaba si empleaban treinta segundos o siete minutos para hacerse entender, ella atendía, leía entre líneas, revisaba sus equipajes y los llevaba hasta la mejor estancia. Cuando la campanita volvía a resonar, señal de que ya se marchaban, siempre lo hacían abrazados a una bolsa de papel que contenía uno de los libros de segunda mano.
          —¿Cómo lo hace?
          Preguntó él cuando la tarde se había convertido ya en noche.
          —Solo ha habido un cliente hasta el momento al que no he podido convencer de llevarse algo que no buscaba.
          —¿Quién fue? —quiso saber el señor Tobashi; sorprendido de que hubiese alguien dispuesto a no dejarse llevar por Chiyoko.
          —Usted».

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 960€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Aviso para navegantes: La opción BACK IT es únicamente para realizar donaciones a la edición, por lo que no habrá comunicaciones posteriores en busca de datos de envío... cualquiera de las opciones válidas de reserva exige cumplimentar formulario para poder servir el pedido.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona a la autora, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Rocío R. Ródenas vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

Política de Privacidad
story_txt:
¿Qué?
La muerte del cerezo es una profunda novela interior, un crisol de historias, en un alarde de eso que algunos vienen llamando vocación de estilo.
Nagano murió cruzando las vías del tren, desde entonces habla a través de un gato que se quedó a vivir en el paso a nivel después de aquel día. Su hermana, Sukue, escapa del dolor carteándose con un desconocido a kilómetros de distancia. El vecino de al lado, que vive obsesionado con la anciana de los paseos nocturnos, está esperando la oportunidad de su vida para coger el último tren a casa. Y entretanto, un hombre afianzado a sus recuerdos como método de supervivencia, planea sus momentos finales antes de suicidarse. Este es un libro escrito con retazos de momentos porque al fin y al cabo así es como está confeccionada la vida y así es como nos unimos a la de los demás, entrelazando nuestros caminos. Una novela acerca de cómo el amor, la autocompasión y el perdón pueden ir llenando todos nuestros vacíos.
¿Quiénes?
Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de publicar obras poco convencionales pero de indudable calidad, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para promocionar cada título cuando esta todavía se encuentra en proceso de edición.
De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.
Hoy se nos presenta Rocío R. Ródenas.
Llegué al mundo el 5 de enero de 1992. Valencia me vio nacer y aquí crecí arropada por su clima mediterráneo. Papá es un gran escritor, mamá una ávida lectora y yo tuve la picardía de elegir ambos dones para llevarlos conmigo. story:
How Did This Happen?

I don't know! I truly never thought I'd be doing this work, let alone teaching it, let alone writing a BOOK about it, but here I am and I'm so grateful for the opportunity to share the tools and awareness that has changed my life and helped my clients and students change their lives.

Here's What the Deal Is

The manuscript is complete. It's been through re-working, rewriting, and three rounds of edits. It's been proofread. It's been laid out and formatted with the illustrations. My editor and I are currently reviewing the printed galley proof to make sure it's all good to go. After making a few minor adjustments it will be sent to the publisher. This is where you come in!

  • Getting the first 100 copies printed, ebook conversion, distribution to major outlets, plus online print-on-demand service will cost $1300. (Actually, it will be a bit more, but I like the number 13.)
  • If you're willing to help chip in, I'm willing to give you awesome discounted services! Check out the perks. I'm also open to creating custom service packages and gift certificates.
  • If I reach the goal of raising all $1300 here, I will print more copies, if not, I will get the money some other way. I WILL publish this book no matter what, so if you buy a book perk, you will receive it AND at a discounted price at that!

This Book Is A Gift

It's been a gift of healing for me and it's also a gift of healing for the world. There is a ton of love and magic in every part. It is my intent that the energy it holds will anchor the frequency of love anywhere it is. I am actively working with the trees to honor what they are contributing, too, so that it can be a healing for the realms of nature as well as of humans.

When you contribute, you get healing for yourself and are supporting a mission of healing the insanity of the world, one small change at a time.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't support with a financial contribution at this time, you can still help by sending good vibes, visualizing this happening with total ease, sharing this with friends who might be interested, posting about it, or sending me a love note of encouragement.

It all really does help and it all means the world to me.

Thank you for reading and supporting this cause. I love and appreciate you.

Infinite Gratitude,

Tatiana

story:
The biggest motivation in creating this outrageous story was the notion that we could change the dreaded "bedtime routine" into an event filled with laughter and education. An experience where both the parent and child could learn interesting facts while simultaneously being entertained by a lovable feline with a passion for art. Instilling a passion for fine arts at a young age encourages children to take a step back from technologies and indulge in the world around them; appreciate museums, architecture, draw a picture, or explore the unknown. This story encourages children to question the possibilities of true events and lets their minds wander.

Support artists supporting reading! Listen to the songs, partake in the activity book, watch Mr. E's dance video, and share in a lasting experience that is much more than a standard book. The character of Mr. E is inspired by the personality of a cat named Numuel-E-Nuts, owned by Alec's uncle, while his likeness is based on Jill's cat, Grim-Reaper. Alec is keeping his uncle's memory alive and following his uncle's aspirations to one day have a story about cat-shenanigans. Jill is fulfilling her grandparent's request to keep drawing and pursuing the arts. 

 

 

 

Mr. E's Catastrophes is an adventure-packed dive into history. Mr. E is a time-traveling cat who inadvertently contributes to some of the most famous works of art and unsolved mysteries. Children will be introduced to The Great Sphinx of Giza, da Vinci's Mona Lisa,  Gaudí's Casa Milà, The Nazca lines, along with some fairly remarkable individuals. The story is a mix between an Oliver Jeffers's book and Bill & Ted's Excellent Adventure! 

 

 

 

 

 

We hope to inspire families to engage in conversations about art & history. Convey the richness of traveling, the urge to explore, and laughs ignited by the colorful illustrations. As with any project, there are associated costs that we hope to offset through this campaign, such as 3 ISBN's, printing costs, software costs, site fees, advertising in the future, etc.) 

The funds we raise from this campaign will go towards:    
                           

 



Custom canvas book bags will be included for the first 12 backers selecting a perk over $66 . 

 

The Great Wave of Mr. E Art Print - 8 X 6

 

Coloring Book Samples/ Custom Painting Templates

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

The more folks who are in the know,  the better the chance of reaching our goal! So please share on social media, there are direct links above to help spread the word. If you love the project OR happen to be friends without kids, you can still contribute by selecting the pink BACK IT button near the top-right of the page.

THANK YOU ALL!

Follow along on social platforms:

  • www.wonderlakebooks.com
  • www.instagram.com/mr.escatastrophes
  • www.facebook.com/mr.escatastrophes

story:
Story of My Book

Strawberries Under Skin is a collection of poems that explores the intersection of love, loss, and healing. A poignant read, this book reveals what it means to be a young girl on a journey towards growth and self-discovery through some of the most critical transitions in her life.

My name is Niharika Shah and I am the author of Strawberries Under Skin. I wrote this book because I wanted my readers to discover the courage to be vulnerable in the face of love and grief. I want this book to be a reminder to all readers that they are not alone in this journey of being broken down and putting themselves back together.


My hope is that, in reading this book, you will feel liberated. Having grown up in a typical middle-class Indian family, I realize that women are often stigmatized for being “too emotional” or “too soft,” and it is my lifelong dream to become one of the leading female authors of my country and drive change. I hope that this book inspires you to be true to your emotions and invites you to be unapologetically yourselves.

In this book, you’ll join me in exploring the depth of language and writing styles through poems like:

  • “paper boat hats” which explores the intimacy between two people as they question the purpose and limits of their relationship.
  • “aubade for the wrong (kind of) love” which encapsulates all the different forms in which ‘love’ has appeared to the speaker, and all the ways it has failed her.
  • “castles are also called ruins” which manipulates white space to replicate internal disintegration.

You will love this book if you are seeking refuge from anxiety or turbulent relationships, if you describe yourself as soft, with a ‘love conquers all’ kind of attitude, or if you are drawn to contemporary poetry.

Strawberries Under Skin speaks to young adults who want to grapple with emotional trauma and self-love through the healthy expression of art.

The Book Structure

This book is written in 3 parts or chapters dedicated to three different entities or notions.

  • Chapter 1: To You is a tribute to the you of this book, an entity that the speaker has loved and lost. It explores the themes of love, romance and heartbreak.
  • Chapter 2: To Me is a tribute to the speaker or author herself — the me. For instance, in both “epilogue” and “you’ve loved before,” the speaker writes to and about herself, about growing out of a love that was confining and engaging with her choices.
  • Chapter 3: To Change is, as the title says, dedicated to the natural process of change, which includes change in the definitions of love, change in the mind and body and change in interpersonal relationships.

What I Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer.

 

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author

Niharika Shah is an undergraduate student at Emory University pursuing a double major in Economics and English & Creative Writing.

An art-enthusiast, she enjoys reading Ocean Vuong, Lucille Clifton and Lang Leav, and composes her own piano music. Having moved several cities across the world, Niharika shares her stories through writing. She has conducted several Open Mics and creative writing workshops. At these events, she imparts knowledge from her personal and professional writing experience to budding writers. Alongside her goal of publishing this year, she looks forward to joining Omniscience, a Data Analytics company in the heart of Silicon Valley, this summer.

Niharika wrote Strawberries Under Skin to remind young people that it is okay to feel and to be vulnerable sometimes. This book is an embodiment of everything Niharika is passionate about: literature, kindness, and the drive for change. 

She is a hopeless romantic (though she tends to hide this from her family) and is drawn to soulful music and romance-drama series that she binges before bed every night. She comes from a family of animal lovers and is a proud sibling to two adorable Shih Tzus.

For more information, you can connect with Niharika at niharikashahpoetry@gmail.com and on
Twitter (https://twitter.com/Niharik37798045), Instagram(https://www.instagram.com/niharikashahpoetry/) and LinkedIn (https://www.linkedin.com/in/niharika-shah-22b60...). 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #StrawberriesUnderSkin and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Niharika Shah

“aubade for the wrong (kind of) love” which encapsulates all the different forms in which ‘love’ has appeared to the speaker, and all the ways it has failed her.
“castles are also called ruins” which manipulates white space to replicate internal disintegration.

You will love this book if you are seeking refuge from anxiety or turbulent relationships, if you describe yourself as soft, with a ‘love conquers all’ kind of attitude, or if you are drawn to contemporary poetry.Strawberries Under Skin speaks to young adults who want to grapple with emotional trauma and self-love through the healthy expression of art.
The Book Structure
This book is written in 3 parts or chapters dedicated to three different entities or notions.


Chapter 1: To You is a tribute to the you of this book, an entity that the speaker has loved and lost. It explores the themes of love, romance and heartbreak.

Chapter 2: To Me is a tribute to the speaker or author herself — the me. For instance, in both “epilogue” and “you’ve loved before,” the speaker writes to and about herself, about growing out of a love that was confining and engaging with her choices.

Chapter 3: To Change is, as the title says, dedicated to the natural process of change, which includes change in the definitions of love, change in the mind and body and change in interpersonal relationships.


What I Need & What You Get
This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.
The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer.

 
When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
And much more!


 
About the Author
Niharika Shah is an undergraduate student at Emory University pursuing a double major in Economics and English & Creative Writing.
An art-enthusiast, she enjoys reading Ocean Vuong, Lucille Clifton and Lang Leav, and composes her own piano music. Having moved several cities across the world, Niharika shares her stories through writing. She has conducted several Open Mics and creative writing workshops. At these events, she imparts knowledge from her personal and professional writing experience to budding writers. Alongside her goal of publishing this year, she looks forward to joining Omniscience, a Data Analytics company in the heart of Silicon Valley, this summer.Niharika wrote Strawberries Under Skin to remind young people that it is okay to feel and to be vulnerable sometimes. This book is an embodiment of everything Niharika is passionate about: literature, kindness, and the drive for change. She is a hopeless romantic (though she tends to hide this from her family) and is drawn to soulful music and romance-drama series that she binges before bed every night. She comes from a family of animal lovers and is a proud sibling to two adorable Shih Tzus.For more information, you can connect with Niharika at niharikashahpoetry@gmail.com and onTwitter (https://twitter.com/Niharik37798045), Instagram(https://www.instagram.com/niharikashahpoetry/) and LinkedIn (https://www.linkedin.com/in/niharika-shah-22b60...). 
International Preorders
For international preorders, please send me a private message.

Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #StrawberriesUnderSkin and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!Thanks again,Niharika Shah

story:
About TWO

 

 

TWO Edition is a magazine made for Creatives by Creatives; it’s the future of storytelling in fashion, design, art, culture, music & travel. TWO also provides a platform for Creatives and their work to be showcased and also an opportunity to collaborate on exclusive projects with the magazine. It’s an all-around Creative magazine for readers who are keen to discover new talents, artistic outlooks and much more. What will set us apart is our unwavering conviction in endorsing independent creatives, our support for the sustainability of fashion and design culture, and an insightful, honest opinion and profile of the industry and its
people.

 

The online edition of the magazine will feature fashion editorials that are visually and contextually provocative as well as in-depth profiles of designers, photographers, visual artists, writers and musicians on both a local and international scale. Two aspires to incite dialogues between and across diverse genres and bring to light a never-before-seen side of the creative
industry.

 

All in all, Two is a lifestyle; it is our philosophy on how we should live, revealing to our readers the best of the best in this evergrowing, ever-shifting paradigm.

 

TWO EDITION issues will have an online presence accompanied with a limited edition print runs. The printed version will be available for purchase from the TwoEdition.com website. The end product of the collaborative project between TWO and selected Creatives will also be available online.

 

Any advertising or submission inquiries
please contact info@twoedition.com
www.twoedition.com
www.facebook.com/2edition
www.twitter.com/two_edition

 

The duo behind TWO

 

Olivia and Rodney are, as the French say: comme deux gouttes d’eau (like Two water drops). As visual artists ourselves, we are opinionated and always bursting with new ideas, but above all, as we are sure that this goes for everyone in design, we are appreciative of the collaborative aspect of creating a body of work. Et voila, Two, in short, became The collaborative platform for creative minds.

 

Creative Directors:
Rodney Ye: rodney@twoedition.com
+61402663242 (Sydney)
Olivia Sari-Goerlach: olivia@twoedition.com
+6590210771 (Singapore)


What We Need & What You Get

 

A breakdown of costs of what’s needed to get us rolling:

·        $3500 for domain name and website building(design & maintenance)

·        $2000 for photo shoot funding

·        $3000 for publishing of limited edition prints

·        $1500 for Office & business start up


Check out the perks of what you can get when you help fund TWO :)


Other Ways You Can Help

You can help us by spreading the word of this Indie GoGo Campaign via social media such as Twitter, Facebook, Google +,etc.

Contributions can be made via Paypal with the following details:


Paypal 

Email: fund@twoedition.com

 

Any inquiries regarding TWO or this funding,

please contact info@twoedition.com

 

Thanks!

- Rodney & Olivia
