story:
What is the Montreal Zen Poetry Festival Collection?

Every two years the International MONTREAL ZEN POETRY FESTIVAL brings world-renowned poets, translators, Zen monks and scholars to Montreal to celebrate and share the expression of Zen in poetry. An important part of each festival is the gathering together of invitees' work in a slim volume with a limited numbered edition of 400 (300 for 2007), beautifully designed by Linda Gustafson, of Counterpunch, and edited by Meg Taylor. In 2007, the publication words have no meaning, masterfully printed at Coach House Press, brought together poets and translators David Budbill, Steve Sanfield, Red Pine, Joanne Kyger, Sonja Arntzen, and Leonard Cohen. We are currently hard at work assembling the words of our 2009 line-up for our second collection, forget the words! These pages will feature the work of Shin Yu Pai, Chase Twichell, Peter Levitt, Seido Ray Ronci, David Hinton, Dennis Maloney, and Stephen Addiss.


Why Should You Support the Montreal Zen Poetry Festival Collection?

The MONTREAL ZEN POETRY FESTIVAL brings together international talent for a niche gathering unlike any other. The festival collection is an artistic means of sharing the world of Zen poetry.

We have raised $500 through two grassroots events and we need to raise $1900 more to cover printing costs for the 2009 collection by February 18, 2011. About half of our 400 copies are for purchase and the other half are gifted to our donors and invitees; the income from the purchase of the volume goes towards funding the current festival.

The festival is organized by seven poets/playwrights/actors who practice at Enpuku-ji, and is entirely volunteer-run. 


The Festival and Enpuku-ji Zen Centre

The Zen Centre, founded in 1995 and previously known as Centre Zen de la Main, is an urban residential Zen temple in the Plateau neighbourhood of Montreal. The festival is part of the centre’s “Zen Expression” programme that introduces the practice and cultural traditions of Zen Buddhism to the community-at-large.

The collections are dedicated to Kyozan Joshu Sasaki Roshi, oldest living and actively teaching Zen Master at 103.

story:
Changing Lives - One Meal at a Time.

If you like to cook, or just love to eat, this is the recipe collection you’ve been waiting for. Since 2003 Lifestyle Magazine has been collecting and publishing culinary creations from the best chefs of California's Central Valley. From mouthwatering appetizers to scrumptious desserts, every month the chefs deliver nothing short of total deliciousness.

Many of our readers have ripped out pages, made photocopies, or created space on their bookshelves to keep the collection of recipes near at hand. Now, you can have some of the most favored Lifestyle recipes of the last 10 years and support the Visalia Rescue Mission at the same time.

For every book sold, Lifestyle Magazine will donate 50 percent of the net proceeds to the Visalia Rescue Mission. It’s the perfect solution for a hard-to-find gift for friends, colleagues or neighbors that will leave a lasting impact on our community.

The Impact.

On average, the Visalia Rescue Mission serves 500 meals per day – 183,000 meals per year. Often, the meal is a simple bowl of nourishing soup. By purchasing this book, you can help the Visalia Rescue Mission serve a lot of meals, to a lot of hungry people in our community.

On top of the meals served, the Visalia Rescue Mission also sleeps an average of  200 men, women and children in their shelters each night. But the mission is not just a soup kitchen or shelter, the organization also provides valuable recovery programs for those struggling with addiction and counseling and job-placement training for those looking for a fresh start.

Lifestyle Magazine is proud to support the Visalia Rescue Mission and help them provide food, shelter and clothing to the homeless, hopeless and brokenhearted. Often something as simple as a hot meal is the first step in changing a person’s life.

What We Need & What You Get.

Please consider purchasing this Recipe Collection where your donation will directly support the transformation of a community and individual lives:

  • For every book sold, Lifestyle Magazine will donate 50 percent of the net proceeds to the Visalia Rescue Mission.
  • With your $25 donation, you will receive a copy of Lifestyle Magazine's Recipe Collection - a book of one-of-a-kind recipes from our area's most highly regarded chefs...let's get cooking!


Other Ways You Can Help.

We understand that not everyone is able to contribute financially, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help!

  • If you are passionate about helping those in need, help us spread the word about our campaign via social media sites like Facebook and Twitter. Share our campaign with your family, friends and coworkers.


Thank You.

Thank you for partnering with Lifestyle Magazine, and for your generous purchase of this Recipe Collection benefiting the Visalia Rescue Mission.

story:
"Canada is a country of small towns and big dreams" Brian Mulroney

Well folks, we are entering the last day of the campaign, and I wanted to do a big thank you to everyone who visited the site, sent emails and supported me and this project.  

This has been an amazing experience...from learning how to create a video, to finding a way to put the idea in to words, to all the writing and re-writing (and all the emotional ups and downs that went with it! )

The support from everyone has been amazing.  And although we may not meet our financial goal, we have met a lot of other goals along the way...wa-hoo!  

So a HUGE thank you to everyone. I am a very lucky person indeed!

Thank you, thank you, thank you!!!

 At the beginning of this campaign, I focused on telling you about myself...a small town girl, trying to brush the cobwebs off a long held dream.  (if you missed it, please visit the blog: http://bluewelkin.wordpress.com).

Now I would like to tell you a little more about the book project.  My goal is to produce a book of snapshots and first person accounts of what life is like in small town Canada.  Some of the questions that I am exploring are:  why do people stay in small towns? How do they earn their living? If their towns rely on resource based economies, how do they balance economic growth with concerns for the environment?  If more and more people are leaving small towns (which Statistics Canada tells us is the case), then what is happening to the social systems of these small towns? What innovative ideas are these communities putting in place to keep their towns alive?

And while I am sure there are many academic papers written about the changing Canadian landscape, I am really interested in what ordinary Canadians have to say.  I want to capture people's own words...to have their memories, emotions, their voices, echoing off the page.  Along with their words, the book will incorporate photos of the places and people interviewed. Photos bring us immediately into the moment, and give a rich context to the story...what's that saying..."a picture's worth a thousand words"?  

Through this campaign, I have been introduced to many people willing to share their homes and their experiences with me.  The stories include senior citizens who's towns no longer have a doctor or a bus system.  Towns that have had their agricultural land rezoned to make way for housing.  Families coming up with innovative ways to keep the family farm running...farms that have been in the family for several generations!  And "Buy Local" campaigns that literally keep a neighbours business, and their family, in the community.

Ordinary Canadians want to tell their stories.  They want to share their ideas, dreams and passions.  And while this book probably won't change the world, it will definitely add to our understanding of what our fellow Canadians are experiencing.  

Please help me, help them, to share their wisdom. 


What the funds will be used for:

camping fees $ 600

tolls and ferries  $700.00

crowd funding fees $300

Costs associated with providing Perks to campaign contributors  $200

Book production (using Blurb) to do a limited edition run of the book $1200


Thank you.

Diane

story:
EL NOMBRE DE TODOS LOS PATROCINADORES SE PONDRA EN AGRADECIMIENTO EN LA LUNA TRASERA. DESDE 1€

Buscamos patrocinadores para la preparacion de nuestro coche a cambio de rotulacion del vehiculo con tu marca en un evento del motor de calado internacional. Leete nuestro dossier!:

24 Horas de Braga.

El evento.

Las 24 Horas de Braga son un evento automovilístico para aficionados que se celebrará en el circuito Vasco Sameiro en Braga, Portugal el próximo febrero de 2014.




El evento sirve como continuación de las 24 Horas de Guadix que se celebraron en el circuito de Guadix (Granada) el pasado Enero de 2013 y que obtuvo una amplia repercusión, tanto en redes sociales como en foros, así como en revistas especializadas del sector del automovilismo.


Consiste en una carrera de resistencia 24 horas con coches anteriores de 1994, en el que la organización hace primar la seguridad (arco de seguridad, backet y arnes son obligatorios) así como la economía, para hacerlo accesible a los aficionados y que no se convierta en coto de equipos profesionales.


El respeto mutuo y el compañerismo, que fueron la base del evento de 2013, se reforzará y convertirán de nuevo en los cimientos sobre los que se fundamentara el evento de 2014.


El evento se ha convertido en los foros del motor como la prueba más esperada del año que, lejos de ser una prueba costosa, se convierte en el sueño al alcance de todos los aficionados del motor que se han imaginado corriendo en Le Mans y que ahora ven cómo su sueño ha pasado a ser una realidad tangible con un presupuesto bajo


Ahora es posible. Ahora es el momento.


El equipo.

Capitan Hook Endurance Team (CHET)


El equipo para este año está formado, al igual que el año pasado, por 5 personas de diferentes partes del país, predominando la parte andaluza. Grandes aficionados al motor, que de una u otra manera han hecho sus pinitos en algún circuito Español de manera amateur y personal, muchas veces con su propio coche, por el puro placer de pilotar de manera segura en un lugar apropiado y preparado a tal efecto.



Al conocer el evento de las 24 Horas de Guadix, se decidió formar el equipo y comenzar todos los preparativos, comenzando por la compra de un coche que cumpliese las condiciones del evento, y continuando por su posterior preparación para afrontar la prueba.

¿Qué ofrecemos?


En el evento participan equipos de todos los puntos de España. Madrileños, catalanes, gallegos, asturianos… podríamos seguir enumerandolos y tendríamos que hacer incluso inclusiones en el extranjero, ya que tendremos también equipos alemanes, ingleses o argentinos.


El seguimiento del evento está garantizado, pues las comunidades más importantes de habla hispana están representadas por equipos o con la aportación de miembros de sus equipos, que a su vez estarán contando sus historias en sus comunidades.


Foros, facebook, twitter y demás redes sociales se harán eco del evento, tanto durante las preparaciones de los equipos como durante la carrera o la post carrera, que posiblemente acabará extendiéndose en el tiempo hasta la siguiente edición.


Asimismo se harán eco del evento importantes revistas del sector a nivel nacional, como son Autopista, Motor Clasico… etc, ya que periodistas de dichas publicaciones formaran parte de algunos equipos y aseguraron una importante repercusión a nivel nacional e internacional en la prensa escrita.


Diversos canales televisivos se han interesado en el evento y se esta tratando de llegar a un acuerdo para obtener la máxima repercusión mediática del evento.


Target y alcance.


-Participantes del evento: 150 pilotos.


-Asistentes al evento: 500 personas.


-Publico alcanzable en redes sociales: Incontable.


-Repercusión en internet: Hilos específicos en ALEXA, Forocoches (el foro más grande del mundo de habla hispana), Forocompeticion, Meneame, Foros internacionales, así como repercusión en twitter con hilos específicos*


-Repercusión en medios escritos: Asegurados a día de hoy: Autopista (130.000 lectores semanales). Motor Clásico (27.000 lectores al mes) y mas publicaciones con las que aún no se ha cerrado acuerdo.


-Retransmisión On-Line: Se realizará retransmisión on-line por parte de los miembros de forocompeticion.com.


-Target: Varones de 25-35 con vehiculo propio.

Si no pudieses colaborar con nosotros economicamente, ofrecenos una propuesta. Estamos abiertos a proposiciones!
story_txt: EL NOMBRE DE TODOS LOS PATROCINADORES SE PONDRA EN AGRADECIMIENTO EN LA LUNA TRASERA. DESDE 1€Buscamos patrocinadores para la preparacion de nuestro coche a cambio de rotulacion del vehiculo con tu marca en un evento del motor de calado internacional. Leete nuestro dossier!:24 Horas de Braga.El evento.Las 24 Horas de Braga son un evento automovilístico para aficionados que se celebrará en el circuito Vasco Sameiro en Braga, Portugal el próximo febrero de 2014. El evento sirve como continuación de las 24 Horas de Guadix que se celebraron en el circuito de Guadix (Granada) el pasado Enero de 2013 y que obtuvo una amplia repercusión, tanto en redes sociales como en foros, así como en revistas especializadas del sector del automovilismo. Consiste en una carrera de resistencia 24 horas con coches anteriores de 1994, en el que la organización hace primar la seguridad (arco de seguridad, backet y arnes son obligatorios) así como la economía, para hacerlo accesible a los aficionados y que no se convierta en coto de equipos profesionales. El respeto mutuo y el compañerismo, que fueron la base del evento de 2013, se reforzará y convertirán de nuevo en los cimientos sobre los que se fundamentara el evento de 2014. El evento se ha convertido en los foros del motor como la prueba más esperada del año que, lejos de ser una prueba costosa, se convierte en el sueño al alcance de todos los aficionados del motor que se han imaginado corriendo en Le Mans y que ahora ven cómo su sueño ha pasado a ser una realidad tangible con un presupuesto bajoAhora es posible. Ahora es el momento. El equipo.Capitan Hook Endurance Team (CHET)El equipo para este año está formado, al igual que el año pasado, por 5 personas de diferentes partes del país, predominando la parte andaluza. Grandes aficionados al motor, que de una u otra manera han hecho sus pinitos en algún circuito Español de manera amateur y personal, muchas veces con su propio coche, por el puro placer de pilotar de manera segura en un lugar apropiado y preparado a tal efecto. Al conocer el evento de las 24 Horas de Guadix, se decidió formar el equipo y comenzar todos los preparativos, comenzando por la compra de un coche que cumpliese las condiciones del evento, y continuando por su posterior preparación para afrontar la prueba.¿Qué ofrecemos?En el evento participan equipos de todos los puntos de España. Madrileños, catalanes, gallegos, asturianos… podríamos seguir enumerandolos y tendríamos que hacer incluso inclusiones en el extranjero, ya que tendremos también equipos alemanes, ingleses o argentinos.El seguimiento del evento está garantizado, pues las comunidades más importantes de habla hispana están representadas por equipos o con la aportación de miembros de sus equipos, que a su vez estarán contando sus historias en sus comunidades.Foros, facebook, twitter y demás redes sociales se harán eco del evento, tanto durante las preparaciones de los equipos como durante la carrera o la post carrera, que posiblemente acabará extendiéndose en el tiempo hasta la siguiente edición. Asimismo se harán eco del evento importantes revistas del sector a nivel nacional, como son Autopista, Motor Clasico… etc, ya que periodistas de dichas publicaciones formaran parte de algunos equipos y aseguraron una importante repercusión a nivel nacional e internacional en la prensa escrita. Diversos canales televisivos se han interesado en el evento y se esta tratando de llegar a un acuerdo para obtener la máxima repercusión mediática del evento. Target y alcance.-Participantes del evento: 150 pilotos.-Asistentes al evento: 500 personas.-Publico alcanzable en redes sociales: Incontable.-Repercusión en internet: Hilos específicos en ALEXA, Forocoches (el foro más grande del mundo de habla hispana), Forocompeticion, Meneame, Foros internacionales, así como repercusión en twitter con hilos específicos*-Repercusión en medios escritos: Asegurados a día de hoy: Autopista (130.000 lectores semanales). Motor Clásico (27.000 lectores al mes) y mas publicaciones con las que aún no se ha cerrado acuerdo. -Retransmisión On-Line: Se realizará retransmisión on-line por parte de los miembros de forocompeticion.com.-Target: Varones de 25-35 con vehiculo propio. Si no pudieses colaborar con nosotros economicamente, ofrecenos una propuesta. Estamos abiertos a proposiciones!

story:
Short Summary

Poupichou Press is an indie publishing label created by indie author Shane Griffin. Its aim is two fold.

First to allow an avenue to Shane's works to be available to everyone through epublishing thanks to the wonderful epublishing web page Smashwords. 

Its second longer term goal is to allow an avenue for young writers of science fiction and fantasy to get a leg up.

Poupichou Press keeps all of its short works free and only charges minimal amount for novel and novella length works like Apocalyptica - Rogue Memories .

To help raise our profile in the epublishing world we need professional book covers for our new exciting series; Necrofairies. Necrofaires is a very cool new series which mixes fantasy and sci fi together in a dark world.

Necrofairies Summarised

Neen is a fairy living in a harsh polluted city. She has learned to adapt and survive. She is a talented thief and not shy with a gun. When her regular partner in crime, an assassin called Sliver, lands a job with a massive payout she accepts fearless of the risks. Find out exactly what Sliver has dragged her into and whether she will survive to enjoy her pay.

 

Since Shane is a starving indie author and keeps the cost low/free he does not make enough to pay a professional artist and has survived thus far on generosity of artist Jack Sananikone .

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

Its simple Poupichou Press would like to raise $750 USD in order to pay their professional artist for the covers of the three Necrofairies ebooks. One has already been published using a free cover, Necrofairies 2 is currently in creation and requires a cover. Necrofairies 3 is planned for late 2014 and will also require a cover.

What do you get - free copies of Necrofairies 2 and for those who donate a little more a 50% discount on the novel Apocalytpica - Rogue Memories as well. 

The Impact

Its also simple. Please help us reward someone for supporting us. You know starving author helps starving artist :). There will be more works from Poupichou Press and we would love to continue to strengthen the partnership with Jack and his work.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you don't want to donate funds please still check out all Shane's works on Smashwords, Sony, Apple or Barnes and Noble ebook stores.

story:
Short Summary

This book came out of being an educator for over thirty years, teaching cross-cultural communication, running a music studio for unique learners, and making everything I did to include the family and children with special needs. Over the years, I have shared this story in order to teach the children manners in a fun way. The children loved it so much that I had some writers and even some of the children work on it. It took on a life of it's own, becoming a deeper story about family systems and how to bring out the best in someone by learning to appreciate, consider and respect differences. The manners served as a bridge to feel comfortable anywhere you go.

As the story unfolds, the girls meet in "Finishing" and "Unfinishing" school, respectively. Amalia, the perfectly behaved princess, gets to let it all hang out with Cornelia, the friendly Monster princess, at her home. They roller skate down the marble hallways on a mysterious concoction, otherwise known as toothpaste, that slows them down just enough! While at Amalia's, Cornelia gets to appreciate the benefits of "fancy" manners, including not worrying whether she is sitting on squished grapes (typically occurring after food fights at her castle).

Here is an excerpt from the book:

In the evening, the King and Queen tucked them into their beds and kissed them goodnight. “Sweet dreams,” they said.
“You mean like chocolate and bubble gum dreams?” asked Corny. It was the first time anyone had ever said that to her, so she was trying to figure out what it meant.

“Well, why not?” answered the King and Queen, amused again. They tiptoed out quietly and turned off the lights.

“That kiss felt smushy, but it was kinda nice." "Why were they tiptoeing out the door?” Corny asked. 

“Just to be polite,” answered Amalia.

“Oh.” mused Corny. She couldn’t quite understand the rules and little rituals, but she did feel a safe, warm feeling when she fell asleep.

Both girls develop a tight friendship, which bridges their differences and allows them to want to consider each others feelings. Amalia learns to think outside of the box as Cornelia can do. Cornelia begins to enjoy the tender rituals learned from Amalia that get her through her day more smoothly. These themes will be further developed in the sequels that follow.

The story will be fully Illustrated by a wonderful local artist, Vicky Yuh. Vicky will be at the garden party as well as will provide you with prints and sign them there personally for those of you who contribute on a plus and plus-plus levels.

The book's messages and it's humor is appropriate for ages 5-10, perfect for parents to read to the younger ones and laugh together. Who knows, one or the other may start a conversation about more ways to be considerate to others!

This book is the first of three in the series as the story humorously continues to convey messages about manners, tolerance and ultimately, friendship to the enjoyment of children of ALL ages.

What We Need & What You Get

Our plan is to start out by self-publishing, so the money would go to illustrating, binding and promoting the book. We will be sending it out to publishers once it is tested locally, so there is a chance we will meet our goal of the book(s) becoming known across the United States and ideally, in other countries.

For those of you who are able to contribute at the highest level, you will be able to attend a party in my English garden, where we will grill luscious food, hear the musical version performed live, and sing-a-long with me, the arranger and perhaps the illustrator, Vicky, who will be brave enough to try another art form and join us! For the other 'funders,' you will get a lovely, fully colored picture book, signed with gratitude from the writer and illustrator.

If my goal is exceeded, we will use that money to record and produce a CD which includes original musical compositions as well as a narrated version of the story.  It will also cover the costs of illustrating and marketing the two planned sequels.

The Impact

We live in a world that is so open and fluid that children often don't know how to behave. Parents question how to raise a self-directed, confident child that still is welcome at anyone's dinner table and home. Often, sadly, children end up learning unhealthy coping mechanisms: they either pull back and avoid trying new things out of being overwhelmed, or bully others by acting out to exert some sense of control over their unstable environment.

At the deepest level, we are aiming to help children and families to build their communication skills, tolerance and ideally affection for those who they will meet who are very different.  We hope that this awareness will foster self-esteem from the success of their communication skills and respectful behavior.

Manners and authenticity, being true to whomever you are based on your family or outside culture, enable people to grow up feeling lovable and capable. They can form the basis for a successful personal and professional life, and as my friend Roberta wisely said,

"Children, you might not be here, if on my first date with your father, he hadn't had good manners. "

The Team

Chaia May

Chaia teaches 60+ inclusion classes a week of private and group music, including piano, guitar, voice, composition and introduction to music. She composes and performs music for children, has produced 4 CD's and a DVD. Chaia has also written and self published 12 books in Early Childhood Education, and she has lectured across the country on Sensory Integration in the Classroom.

This is her first illustrated book for children. Her second one "Cachoo It!" is also in progress, teaching children to reframe negative thoughts into positive ones as they strive towards mastery, in this case, using examples from playing the piano.


Vicky Yuh

Vicky is a California born artist who had her first lucid dreaming experience at a young age, and has been exploring the worlds conjured since then. She grew up inspired by cartoon shows and films from studios such as Disney and Ghibli.

After receiving a Fine Arts degree from Carnegie Mellon University, she decided to pursue her love for storytelling media. Vicky is currently based in San Francisco, working as an illustrator on the pilot episode of an animated series called “True Tail.” In her spare time, she draws comics, cranks out short stories, and tries to pet every cat and dog she encounters.

story:
SOLD

DO YOU CARE? 

"Mariam survives a slight head injury after being gang raped and beaten by her trafficker in Kenya. After a few days of  living hidden in an unknown location with limited food and water, she vaguely remembers boarding a plane to China, but the voices in the other room are not speaking Chinese. There is laughter, the smell of cheap food and the stench of semen." 

Millions of people are sold into slavery.  Each year there is increasing evidence that African women are among those who are trafficked into the sex trafficking industry.

Why hasn't main stream media reported the news? Why do countless articles in our newspapers and magazines forsake the stories of African women being trafficked into Asia?  Do African Women count, within the dialogue of human slavery?!

Allow, me to be your news source.  A fresh voice where the only concern  is truth.  SOLD,  is a novel that explores the dimensions of sex trafficking within the region of Asia and how it effects and attracts African women, specifically.  There is surprising proof that shows  African women are trafficked yearly to regions across Asia, generally for prostitution. 

Unlike non- fiction books which offer statistic and the exclusion of African women, my book  non- fiction format,  aims to inform and improve the dialogue on trafficking, making it vital for all those who turn each page of this book, to incorporate African women within the discussion of sex trafficking. 

  • As a former Progressive Radio host and producer, I became more involved with Women's issues.   Creating a one month Women's forum to discuss on live radio women's struggles and triumphs locally and internationally. 
  • I recognize the dearth of reporting as it concerns women and vowed to make a change.  I am also a poet and a writer.  I have taken the last three years of my life to reside abroad in Asia, from America, to understand my subject and more importantly the culture that the trafficking is taking place in. 
  • Your  contribution is vital for the completion of the research necessary to finish my book.
  • I participated in a live google chat earlier this year to speak out on Human Trafficking  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ObPZK2yWPNM

What I Need & What You Get

  • My campaign is requesting crowd-funding support to assist in bringing this story to the public.  It is critical to understand the world of trafficking, so we can all make a greater impact on stopping this crime on humanity. 
  • I intend to use the funds from the crowd- funding campaign to assist in my research.  
  • Your funds will be used for the following: 
  • A.  Continue to volunteer with organizations who assist trafficked women in Asia and those organizations who can assist me in gaining more information on international trafficking (laws and how they apply locally and internationally and more importantly the consequences for foreign trafficked victims). 
  • B.  In finding and using an editor.
  • C.  Publishing cost.  
  • D.  Manufacturing cost. 
PERKS:
  • Contributions are necessary,  so I have created perks to take you along my journey!
  • Special Thank you!  $2.00 receive a thank you card via email.
  • Sticker.  $8.00 receive a sticker with my logo SOLD that you can place in your office or at home and help bring awareness.
  •  One of a kind bookmarks.   That's right, bookmarks developed especially for this campaign.  $13.00  
  • T-shirt.  Wear a fashionable T- shirt with the logo sold over a map detailing the hot spots around the globe with trafficking issues.  Be a symbol of change! $40.00. 
  • Bag.  Be a statement!  Use the bag that is being created specially for this campaign.  Creative art work printed on fabric will give you style that is meaning full (size- 16X13) $50.00
  • Scarf-  Wrap yourself up in this wonderful scarf being created only for this campaign.  Home made, in modern style, not mass produced.  $90.00
  • Sticker & Bookmark $25.00
  • Bookmark & T-shirt  $55.00
  • T-shirt & Bag $95.00
  • Scarf & Bag $140.00

All prices include shipping.  


    The Impact

    All women across the globe can be affected by the explosion in sex trafficking.   Due to a dearth in education, limited resources, poverty and gender inequality, many women become subject to this evil.  Also, victims of sex trafficking can experience repeated violence from her trafficker and her clients.  

    Your contribution will play a pivotal role in helping me complete my research.
    There are very few organizations who are monitoring the migration of African women into Asia, as it pertains to sex trafficking.  The subject is overlooked and rarely talked about.  Many international organizations focus on the  needs of the locals and neglect the foreign women who maybe in desperate need to flee their situation.   With your contribution, you begin to walk this journey with me and uncover the truth that is beneath the iceberg.

    Lastly, no continent is exempt from the horrors of this offense.  Trafficking can be invisible if we do not know the signs.  Sometimes, our own cultural norms may cause us to look at these events with bias eyes and hold contempt, but the truth is 80% of trafficking is for sexual trade and only 20% for labor.   Its annual revenue is $32, billion, with about $1.2 billion being produced in certain South East Asian countries alone.   Women and girls are at higher risk of being trafficked and human trafficking is now the second largest violation against human rights worldwide. 

    Of these percentages which are of African women?  Many organization focus solely on Africans being used for labor exploitation, but this is not true.  Let's put an end to the ignorance surrounding sex trafficking.  Find out the facts, support my research.  

    Let's include all women in the fight for freedom!


    Other Ways You Can Help

    • If you cannot make a financial contribution please consider forwarding this campaign to friends, colleagues or family members who can.
    • Use the indiegogo share tools!
    • Get involved!  Join an organization become apart of the change the world needs; and  always ask how many foreign women have been trafficked into your country, state, province, village or city?
    • And that's all.  
    Also view: 

    Streamed live on May 12, 2014

    https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ObPZK2yWPNM

    Women gather on this live google hangout to discuss human trafficking.   Women of various professions offer insights, struggles and hope on a topic that is gripping the globe.

Your contribution will play a pivotal role in helping me complete my research. There are very few organizations who are monitoring the migration of African women into Asia, as it pertains to sex trafficking.  The subject is overlooked and rarely talked about.  Many international organizations focus on the  needs of the locals and neglect the foreign women who maybe in desperate need to flee their situation.   With your contribution, you begin to walk this journey with me and uncover the truth that is beneath the iceberg. 
Lastly, no continent is exempt from the horrors of this offense.  Trafficking can be invisible if we do not know the signs.  Sometimes, our own cultural norms may cause us to look at these events with bias eyes and hold contempt, but the truth is 80% of trafficking is for sexual trade and only 20% for labor.   Its annual revenue is $32, billion, with about $1.2 billion being produced in certain South East Asian countries alone.   Women and girls are at higher risk of being trafficked and human trafficking is now the second largest violation against human rights worldwide.  
Of these percentages which are of African women?  Many organization focus solely on Africans being used for labor exploitation, but this is not true.  Let's put an end to the ignorance surrounding sex trafficking.  Find out the facts, support my research.  
Let's include all women in the fight for freedom!
  
Other Ways You Can Help 
If you cannot make a financial contribution please consider forwarding this campaign to friends, colleagues or family members who can.
Use the indiegogo share tools! 
 Get involved!  Join an organization become apart of the change the world needs; and  always ask how many foreign women have been trafficked into your country, state, province, village or city?

And that's all.   
Also view: 


Streamed live on May 12, 2014



https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ObPZK2yWPNM
Women gather on this live google hangout to discuss human trafficking.   Women of various professions offer insights, struggles and hope on a topic that is gripping the globe.

story:
(Segue Traduzione Italiana)

**UPDATE**

It is with sadness to report that A.C. lost his battle to lung cancer on Friday morning October 12, 2012.  The campaign will continue as his family still resides in the home.  Thanks to all who have donated thus far. 

Introduction & Back Story

A.C. is a retired working class Italian who resides in the province of Rome.  He is married with two adult sons.  His wife is a retired custodial worker.  A.C. receives a pension but his wife does not.  A.C.'s wife worked for 15 years for the same company when a law was passed requiring one to work 17 years before becoming eligible to receive a pension.  Unfortunately, she was let go two years shy of reaching 17 years.  My friend is the elder of the two sons.  He does not currently have a stable job.  He has had random jobs but has not been able to find stable work for years.  His brother does have a stable job in public health. 

In June of 2012, A.C. was diagnosed with lung cancer which was later found to be malignant, but that is not the reason for this campaign.  In the 1970s, A.C. made poor judgment when he decided to have a home built in a particular region for him, his wife and their two sons.  The mistake made more than 30 years ago has resulted in the family being in jeopardy of losing their home of 22 years.  The home is not in compliance with a couple of building regulations that were passed retroactively.  One law was passed in 1985 and the other law was passed in 2004.  Construction for the home started in 1977, completed in 1982 and the family inhabited the home in 1990. 

Because the home was in violation of construction regulations, the family had to apply for a type of pardon.  They needed 3 separate entities to approve the pardon.  Only 2, the Common and the Province, approved.  The Superintendent of Architecture and Landscape denied the petition because of the retroactive laws, yet other families living in the same region were not denied.  A.C.'s family now needs to find a lawyer to re-appeal, but do not have the money to afford adequate legal representation.  This is the reason for the campaign. 

The house situation is the latest in a series of challenges and trials the family has had to face.  With only one member of the family having a steady job and the family now having to pay for cancer treatment, my friend would greatly appreciate any amount of help.  The contributions would help increase the possibility of a successful appeal, to alleviate stress and would allow the family to focus more on the health and medical care of A.C.  A.C. and his family are law abiding and tax paying citizens who have lived their lives doing the right thing but seem to be given one bad break after another.  The contributions would also help my friend have more faith in humanity.  He was hesistant to allow me to attempt to help him in this way and is doubtful that people would care to help.  I want to show him that there are people in the world who do care.

What We Need

My friend is asking for $13,000 ($12,500 for estimated legal fees and $500 for campaign fees).  If donations greatly exceed the goal amount, my friend will explore purchasing a new home to ensure that the family will not have to deal with this problem again.  If donations do not meet the goal amount, donations will still be used towards securing legal representation and paying campaign fees.

Thanks for your consideration and for your help!

(Below are the petition denied letter and additional pictures of the house and surrounding area.) 

                      

                    

      

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Introduzione e Storia

AC è un ex operaio italiano che risiede nella provincia di Roma. E' sposato con due figli adulti. Sua moglie è una casalinga. A.C. percepisce una pensione, ma la moglie non lo fa. La moglie di AC ha lavorato per 15 anni per la stessa azienda, quando fu approvata una legge che richiedeva di lavorare 17 anni prima di acquisire il diritto a ricevere una pensione. Purtroppo, ha dovuto lasciare il lavoro due anni prima di raggiungere 17 anni perdendo in questo modo la pensione che  aspettava  lei di diritto. Il mio amico è il maggiore dei due figli. Egli non dispone attualmente di un lavoro stabile. Ha lavorato provvisoriamente finora ma non è stato in grado di trovare un lavoro stabile per anni. Suo fratello ha un lavoro stabile in materia di salute pubblica. 

ad AC è stato diagnosticato un cancro al polmone che successivamente è risultato essere maligno, ma non è il motivo di questa campagna. Nel 1977, CA ha scarsa capacità di giudizio quando ha deciso di costruire una casa propria in una regione particolare per lui, sua moglie e i loro due figli. L'errore fatto più di 30 anni fa, ha portato alla famiglia il pericolo di perdere la loro casa dove sono vissuti per 22 anni. La casa non è in conformità con un paio di regolamenti edilizi che sono stati passati con effetto retroattivo. Una legge è stata approvata nel 1985 e l'altra legge è stata approvata nel 2004. Costruzione per la casa iniziata nel 1977, completata nel 1982 e la famiglia abitata la casa nel 1990. 

Dato che la casa era in violazione delle norme di costruzione, la famiglia ha dovuto applicare un condono. Avevano bisogno di 3 entità distinte per approvare l'indulto. Solo il Comune e la Provincia lo hanno approvato. la sopraintendenza dei beni architettonici e paesaggistici ha rifiutato la petizione a causa delle leggi retroattive, ma ad altre famiglie che vivono nello stesso luogo non sono stati negati. La famiglia AC ha ora bisogno di trovare un avvocato per fare ricorso, ma non hanno i soldi per permettersi un'adeguata rappresentanza legale. Questa è la ragione per la campagna. 

La situazione casa è l'ultimo di una serie di sfide e prove la famiglia ha dovuto affrontare. Con un solo membro della famiglia che ha un lavoro stabile la famiglia oggi deve affrontare le spese per la cura del cancro di A.C., il mio amico apprezza molto qualsiasi quantità di aiuto. I soldi acqusiti contribuiranno ad aumentare la possibilità di un successo del ricorso, per alleviare lo stress e consentirebbe alla famiglia di concentrarsi maggiormente sulla assistenza sanitaria e medica di A.C.  A.C. e la sua famiglia sono cittadini rispettosi della legge e hanno sempre pagato tutte le tasse, hanno vissuto la loro vita facendo sempre le cose giuste senza mai andare contro la legge ma sembrano avere avuto sempre una grande sfortuna in molte cose. 

Quello Di Cui Abbiamo Bisogno

Il mio amico sta chiedendo 13.000$ (12.500$ stimati per le spese legali e 500$ per spese di campagna). Se le donazioni superano di gran lunga il valore prefissato. il mio amico proverà l'acquisto di una nuova casa per assicurarsi che la sua famiglia non debba nuovamente fare i conti con questo problema. Se le donazioni non soddisfano l'importo prefissato, le donazioni saranno ancora utilizzate per la sicurezza della rappresentanza legale e il pagamento delle tasse della campagna.

Grazie per la vostra attenzione e per il vostro aiuto!

(Sopra sono la lettera petizione negata e altre immagini della casa e la zona circostante.)

story:
Short Summary

My name is Sam Medina. I lived in New Jersey and Texas before moving to Toronto, Ontario, where I now work as a freelance artist, after having spent over a decade in the business world as a financial and business consultant.

As a writer (and artist), I have won awards for my webcomic series Jake the Evil Hare, which tells the story of an evil rabbit gone horribly good. This series has consistently ranked among the top 6% on the major webcomic ranking sites. My fantasy webcomic, Darkfell, as likewise been praised by critics and peers, and has hit the top 100 (top 0.5%) on TheWebComicList.com several times. It was, actually, where Dragonslayer was born- it started as a short story I was writing to create a history for one of the major characters.

Dragonslayer is more than just my first fantasy novel. It is part of a much larger story, The Fetters of Wizardry, a somewhat dark fantasy epic which contains a sci-fi twist. It explores an ancient conflict between magic and technology and deals with the consequences of trying to manipulate history. One of my friends referred to it as 'Lord of the Rings meets Foundation.'

What I aim to accomplish with this book (and I admit I'm swinging for the fences here) is to both produce a work of fine literature and lay the foundation for fantasy series so vivid, so thoroughly crafted that multiple authors will one day write novels of their own based in it... Somewhere between the visceral realism and literary majesty of H.P. Lovecraft and the expansiveness of Forgotten Realms is where I'd like to get to with the series, and you can help to make it happen!

What We Need & What You Get

To make this publishing venture a success, I'm going to need $9000 in start-up money. The bulk of these funds will be used for professional editing (about $2000) and the printing of 1000 copies (About $6,000). Fortunately I will be illustrating the book itself, and so that expense, at least, is eliminated.

I also have to pay for set-up costs of an online store, for various small formatting issues involved with ebook production, for stationery and postage to mail out copies of the book, and for the production and mailing of promotional materials to market the book once it’s been produced.

The Impact

Dragonslayer will begin a new era in fantasy literature, in which magic and science come together and one world's history becomes the focal point for a conflict which spans millenia and many worlds.

  • This will be the first of a series of at seven books, part of a story that has been growing in the back of my mind since 1994. A series of personal tragedies kept me from making headway into this tale up until recently, and I consider this the 'Great Work' of my life.
  • I believe it will set a new standard for fantasy literature, and it will be a very satisfying read for a wide variety of people.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Get the word out via Facebook, Twitter, and other social networks
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Israel Shield was started 2 -years ago with the goal of defending Israel and with it's quick success, it's time to take things to the next level! 

The Israel Shield Blog has reached 60,000 monthly hits and it's time t make it official! 

WHAT IS THE NEXT STEP

  • The Israel Shield Site
    $2000
  • The ILShield site will offer important news updates and special editorials by top authors, politicians and Israeli activists as well as serve as a source for all Israel Advocates.
  • The ILShield site will offer Israeli made products to counter all BDS and other Israeli boycotts 
  • We are working with several organizations to bring Israel advocacy under one umbrella and be more effective in protecting Israel online
  • Our IDF partnership project will allow you to be part of an amazing opportunity and support IDF soldiers with special seasonal gear as well as help support special project for the families of active soldiers. 

More Projects Planned

  • We will be offering Israel advocacy courses as well as live debates and interviews with celebrities and well known Israeli politicians
  • We are working together with several organizations to bring you the best and most relevant videos from Israel. 
  • With the success we have had so far, these new projects will make a huge difference when protecting Israel.  
GIVATI $100                                                   GOLANI $150
  
Iron Dome/ Ariforce $170                         Paratroopers $200

story:
UPDATE:

Meet Kritie and her new BMW. The negotiations system I have developed produces ultimate results: she saved whopping $7,500!


Hi Indiegogo, hi everyone!

What’s the problem with buying a car?

All of us had an experience of buying a car. It's not one of the most pleasant ones. Every time you drive out of showroom, there is a silent whisper of a devil in your ear:

"Somehow or the other, I got ripped off."

Well, not any more. 

Why is it important to women?

Throughout the book writing process, I discovered some interesting and new information. Women have trouble buying a car; they often go to dealerships and get manipulated by salesman.

When I was first approached by my co-worker, I was in a bit of a shock: "Luka, I am looking to buy a car and I feel like they are trying to screw me over in the dealerships. Would you mind going with me?"

I replied: "Of course I am going to help you."

A couple of weeks ago on March 18, 2014, Hilary and I went to several different dealerships in pursuit of a right car for her. After initial negotiations and test drive, it was time for some hard work.

I have developed a razor-sharp negotiations system that produces extremely effective results. The numbers are unbeatable: I did negotiations on Hilary's behalf and saved her $4,000! Congratulations Hilary! You are my first satisfied customer!


Even though the book hasn't been published yet, it already generates a substantial buzz in the community! I have been invited to speak on the topic by Ms. Nikole Riley, Events Director at National Association of Women and Small Business Owners! Ms. Riley recognized women's issue in car dealerships and suggested that I should organize educational seminars on the topic. I will be a speaker at 2 separate events, one in June, and the other one in July of this year.

One of the best perks women can use through this project is the Peace of Mind Perk. I will accompany you during the visit to car dealerships and negotiate that price on your behalf. That will save you thousands of dollars and believe me, you will be very, very impressed. You can order the perk on the right hand side of the screen.

Let me show you how I did it.


The true beauty of this eBook is in the fact that it will give you an opportunity to save some cold-hard cash on your next car purchase, regardless of your background or your bank account balance.

Key highlights:

  • Timing, timing, timing. When is the best time to buy a car?
  • How to Get Into the Right Mindset Before Visiting Dealerships
  • How to Know When to Walk
  • How to Negotiate and Bring the Price Down
  • Includes NEW 1-Minute Step-by-Step Guide for Negotiating Lower Car Price
  • Clean, To-The-Point, Bullet Type Content
  • Easy to Read and Affordable
  • Foreword by Ph.D.


A secret worth $10,000: FREE chapter from the book!

  • In real estate, there are 3 rules: location, location, location.
  • With buying a car, it's timing, timing, timing.
  • A bit of planning can save you a ton of money when it comes to buying throughout the year.
  • Therefore, the right timing will do a half of job for you.
  • When is the best time to buy a car?
  • Wait until the end of month. (Dealerships will be trying to reach bonuses.)
  • Wait until the end of year. (Dealerships will be trying to reach bonuses.)
  • September and October are usually months when new models start rolling out.
  • Savings in these months can be extraordinary.
  • December is a very good month as well.
  • The worst time to buy might be spring. (Everybody is buying a car in spring and summer.)
  • For better savings, aim to buy a car at the end of the day.
  • One hour before dealership closes is the best time to buy a car. Salespeople want to go home. Finance and insurance personnel want to go to their families. Detailing department employees want to go as well. It will be an easy buy, and they will lower the price very quickly.
  • Buy when it’s very hot or very cold, as people tend to stay home and there is no one to buy in the dealership.
  • This is a part of chapter #6 and it's connected and interrelated with previous chapters. For better understanding you need to read the rest of the book.

Ok, show me more!



eBook format

When I first sat on a journey to write a book, I decided to write a traditional, hard cover book. I wanted to describe my experience in every single detail, but my vision eventually changed after doing some additional research and talking to several entrepreneurs.

This was their advice: "Listen Luka, nobody is going to read a 100 page book on how to save money when buying a car. What you need to do instead is have a short and straight to the point type of book. 12 pages, eBook, bullet type of content, very visual."

The challenge was to fit all that content into such a small book, so the final product is this:

  • 18 Pages
  • Clean, To-The-Point, Bullet Type Content
  • eBook Format
  • Visually Attractive

Let's talk about what is in the eBook.

What is in it for you?

  1. When you learn how to save money, you will have the opportunity to make your other dreams come true.
  2. One of the many keys to saving money when buying a car is to shop around.
  3. The eBook will deliver a down-to-earth, step-by-step guide you need to have before heading to dealerships.
  4. In addition, before heading to car dealerships, you need to do your homework.
  5. You may think, “What the hell? I need to do homework?”
  6. Let me put the issue in a nut shell: the more time you spend on doing the homework, the more money you will save.
  7. I will teach you how to do it properly and become an expert.
  8. With $5,000 I saved on my purchase, I could easily book a trip to Bahamas, vacation in Mexico, a romantic vacation at Bora Bora or go on a spectacular trip to Europe.
  9. So what would you like? Buy a car and go on a vacation, or just buy a car?
  10. The problem with the dealership experience, in essence, is following: it is designed to confuse you and wear you down.
  11. Why? Isn’t it supposed to be fun, enjoyable, and done in no time?
  12. In a perfect scenario, that would be the way. In a real world? Well, no…
  13. Why do dealerships do this?
  14. Because when you are ready to buy, you will be so tired that you will settle for any price that they offer you. It's a wild west out there.
  15. What should you do?
  16. Evaluate everything that the salesperson is telling you.
  17. Be critical and inspect the car you are looking to purchase.
  18. Be attentive and look for details.
  19. Ask as many questions as possible.
  20. Price-wise, the salesperson will most likely focus on the MSRP or monthly payment.
  21. Don’t fall for that game.
  22. CAUTION: Do not let discussion focus on monthly payment, as it gives dealership a lot of space for manipulation.
  23. You don’t want to overpay.
  24. FOCUS on the price of vehicle. Period.
  25. You should set the ground rules.
  26. Politely explain that you know which model and options you want.
  27. You have calculated what you are ready to pay.
  28. You will buy on the spot if they can give you price you want.
  29. Don’t disclose the price that other dealerships offered you.
  30. Be friendly but confident.
  31. Be well-informed but not argumentative.
  32. If they ask for a trade-in, let them know that you first want to discuss and agree on the price of a new vehicle.
  33. Explain that you don’t want to waste time, both theirs and yours, in lengthy negotiations.
  34. Let them know that you visited other dealerships and gathered offers.
  35. Remind them that you are ready to buy if they can meet your price. Otherwise, you’ll have to “think it over.”
  36. Go to at least five different dealerships because at each and every one of them, you will learn something new, something that the previous one didn’t tell you about.
  37. Stick to the plan.
  38. Modify your strategy if necessary.
  39. Never sign anything they offer you. Sign only when you are confident this is the deal for you.

With these few pointers, we are barely scratching the surface of problems you will encounter in dealerships. They also paint a picture of the mindset you need to have in order to get that price down.

Who am I?

My name is Luka Boric and I am a media research professional. I have graduated from one of the top graduate schools in USA, Rochester Institute of Technology, NY. Bla, bla, bla, booooring!

Let's talk about me

Before we get into the project itself, let me tell you a bit about myself in a creative and entertaining way. Who am I?

I am Luka. No, not that Luka! You were thinking of Dr. Luka Kovac from ER series. No, not him. Oh, you are thinking about other Luka, Luka Modric - that player from Real Madrid! No, not him either. But we all have 2 things in common: our name is Luka and we come from Croatia.

This Luka loves entrepreneurship because it enables you to have a meaningful impact on the world, but is also gives you the true power to change people’s lives. The corporate world is just not my thing. I like to work and create new opportunities for people around me. I think we should talk.

I get excited about small things: like making a tasty lunch, smiling to a stranger or reading John Grisham’s book. One of the most exciting things I have seen is green ketchup!

What do I like?

You can call me a serial hobbyist. There are so many interesting and creative things you can do in this world. I love music. I have been playing piano for 23 years and I am thrilled by the amount of fun and creativity you can have with it! You can be creative with pretty much anything you do. Writing a book is a creative process. Creativity is beautiful because it moves people; it makes their life empowered, interesting, and optimistic.

That’s the reason why I do creative projects and why there is such passion for entrepreneurship. Through this type of work I have met many extraordinary, smart, and inspirational, yet mysterious individuals. And I am still blown away.

I like spending time with interesting people who love to share their experiences and ideas. You are probably one of those individuals. I love to travel. I love parties, EDM festivals, movie nights, Internet, wing suit jumping, and many other things. There are million things I want to do, try, and practice. Though, I am always lacking one thing: time. There is just not enough time in the week to do everything I like. There is even not enough time in a month, or a year. But, I am trying.

I also love cars and as well as entrepreneurship. These 2 passions actually inspired me to write an eBook which will help people save money when buying a car.

On one hand, I am a tough and skilled negotiator. On the other, I used to work as a salesman so I used that knowledge when I was buying my car to counter dealership’s standard tips and tricks they pull on people. The final result was plain to see: magnificent, keep-it-in-your pocket savings of over $5,000 which equal to 20% of the car value. Now, there is an eBook about it and you can do the same.



What I Need & What You Get

Are you thinking about writing a book? Are you debating if it is cheaper to produce an eBook? Whichever road you take (you may ask me for advice on what's the best for your project) you will encounter various expenses that have never crossed your mind.

I am pretty sure most people think: “You are publishing an eBook, that doesn’t cost anything!” Let me tell you, that is not the case.

Even I was surprised by the fact that there are so many costs associated with publishing an eBook. The publishing costs for this eBook will be between $1,200 and $1,400. Here is the itemized breakdown of costs:

  • Professional cover design (very expensive)
  • Editing (reasonably expensive)
  • Professional formatting (quite expensive)
  • Legal consultations (quite expensive)
  • Tax consultations (quite expensive)
  • Music licensing (very expensive)
  • Video production (very expensive)
  • Indiegogo fee
  • Payment processing
  • Taxes

The goal of the Indiegogo campaign is to raise $1,800. It’s not a lot considering the high costs, but it would be inspiring to see that number go way above the goal.  The money will be used to raise awareness of "getting ripped-off" problem and connect people with solutions to it.

What's going to happen if campaign doesn't reach the funding goal? If I don’t reach the funding goal, you will still get your copy of the eBook! Collected funds will go to cover the existing costs of publishing a book, but I also might buy myself a beer.

Ok, let’s talk about what you get! I have created a list of exciting perks that you can enjoy!

  • Basic Support Perk - you love the project and want to help it, even with a $1. High five! Very naaajs!
  • I Want the Book Perk! Get your copy of the eBook – it’s very cheap – $5. You will also receive a thank you shout out on Facebook!
  • "I am supporter" Perk! Get your copy of the eBook + Facebook shout out and find out how to publish a traditional book vs. eBook + how to approach your idea for the book + ask me anything about book or the car buying process + discover behind-the-scenes events for my book or… Just say hi to me in 20min Skype chat and show your support! Your choice!
  • Passing It Forward Perk! You believe in this project, but you also believe in crowdfunding model as a way to impact the world and give opportunity to others!
    You get everything as in "I am supporter" Perk + we are agreeing that 10% of the funds raised through this perk will be used to support other Indiegogo projects. BONUS: your name will be written at the end of the book under “Exceptional Contributors” category (aka EC category).
  • Hire me as your personal expert in car pursuit – Peace of Mind Perk. Can’t get easier than that! I will personally accompany you during the visits to dealerships, help you in every step of the process and finally bring that price down for you. You just pick the car you like. Atlanta, GA area only. 4 hours of visits in 1 day. Your physical address is within a 50 mile radius of Midtown area. FREE initial phone consultations. Need to schedule an appointment. You also get your copy of the eBook and your name will be written at the end of the book under “Exceptional Contributors” category.
  • Hire me as your personal expert in car pursuit – Peace of Mind USA Perk (Limited Edition). Can’t get easier than that and I am coming to your town! I will personally go with you to the dealerships, help you in every step of the process and finally bring that price down for you. You just pick the car you like. USA territory only except Hawaii, Alaska, Puerto Rico, Guam, and Virgin Islands. 4 hours of visits in 1 day. FREE initial phone consultations. Need to schedule an appointment. You also get your copy of the eBook and your name will be written at the end of the book under “Exceptional Contributors” category! (limited edition - just 5 available)

The Impact

In this very moment, there are more people on Facebook than there were on planet Earth 150 years ago. Sharing information is one the most important aspects of our daily lives. We see each other. We hear each other. We share what we love and it reminds us what we all have in common. This sharing is changing the way the world works and improves our lives in many different ways. This flow of information is creating a better life and new opportunities for all of us.

You have just found out about this project. If you keep this information for yourself, you disrupt the flow. Nobody else can benefit from it. If you share it, the flow continues. It leaves you in a happy and empowered state. It creates a difference in someone else’s life.

I am very passionate about this project. I have been working on it for some 700 hours over the past 5 months. That's on average 4 and a half hours every day. I have been living it, I have been breathing it, and now when it is published, there is even more work to do. If you want to write a book, let me warn you: this is not for quitters.

This is the biggest project of my life because it influences everyone! We all buy cars. One of the most intriguing aspects of any creative project is the impact it will have on this world. In the beginning, you tend to see the project as a personal achievement and something that is important to you. As you develop it and learn new things, the vision changes and becomes greater on many different levels than you originally thought of. Finally, very soon you realize the project is so much bigger than you because of the positive impact it will have on other people’s lives and their friends and families. We can never benefit from withholding information from others.

That’s the reason why video for the book started with an inspiring quote:

“You are not here merely to make a living. You are here to enable the world to live more amply, with greater vision and with a finer spirit of hope and achievement.”

̴ Woodrow Wilson

What’s the book going to do for you?

„Hacking a Car Purchase: How I Bought a Brand New Car and Saved $5,000“ will repay itself at least 50 times on your next car purchase. Over the course of a lifetime, your savings may reach an outstanding $100,000!!! By reading 1 book!

Finally, let’s talk about the book price. The book is priced to reach mass market so that anyone and everyone can benefit from it. It's cheap, as cheap as it can be. The average price of an eBook on Indiegogo is $20. „Hacking a Car Purchase“? Only $5.

Buy. Share. Inspire a friend.

UPDATE:Meet Kritie and her new BMW. The negotiations system I have developed produces ultimate results: she saved whopping $7,500!Hi Indiegogo, hi everyone!What’s the problem with buying a car?
All of us had an experience
of buying a car. It's not one of the most pleasant ones. Every time you drive
out of showroom, there is a silent whisper of a devil in your ear:
"Somehow or the other,
I got ripped off."
Well, not any more. Why is it important to women?Throughout the book writing process, I discovered some interesting and new information. Women have trouble buying a car; they often go to dealerships and get manipulated by salesman.When I was first approached by my co-worker, I was in a bit of a shock: "Luka, I am looking to buy a car and I feel like they are trying to screw me over in the dealerships. Would you mind going with me?"I replied: "Of course I am going to help you."A couple of weeks ago on March 18, 2014, Hilary and I went to several different dealerships in pursuit of a right car for her. After initial negotiations and test drive, it was time for some hard work.I have developed a razor-sharp negotiations system that produces extremely effective results. The numbers are unbeatable: I did negotiations on Hilary's behalf and saved her $4,000! Congratulations Hilary! You are my first satisfied customer!Even though the book hasn't been published yet, it already generates a substantial buzz in the community! I have been invited to speak on the topic by Ms. Nikole Riley, Events Director at National Association of Women and Small Business Owners! Ms. Riley recognized women's issue in car dealerships and suggested that I should organize educational seminars on the topic. I will be a speaker at 2 separate events, one in June, and the other one in July of this year.One of the best perks women can use through this project is the Peace of Mind Perk. I will accompany you during the visit to car dealerships and negotiate that price on your behalf. That will save you thousands of dollars and believe me, you will be very, very impressed. bit of planning can save you a ton of money when it comes to buying throughout
the year.

When is the best time to buy a car?

Wait
until the end of month. (Dealerships will be trying to reach bonuses.)
Wait until the end of year. (Dealerships
will be trying to reach bonuses.)

September and October are
usually months when new models start rolling out.

Savings in these months can be
extraordinary.
December is a very good month as
well.
The worst time to buy might be
spring. (Everybody is buying a car in spring and summer.)


For better savings, aim to buy a car at the end of the day.
One hour before dealership
closes is the best time to buy a car. Salespeople want to go home. Finance and
insurance personnel want to go to their families. Detailing department
employees want to go as well. It will be an easy buy, and they will lower the
price very quickly.
Buy when it’s very hot or very
cold, as people tend to stay home and there is no one to buy in the dealership.

story:
Summary

I moved to Williston, North Dakota, the heart of America’s current oil boom, in May of 2013 and spent the better part of a year working in the oil field as a swamper for a rig moving company.

I hired on to one of the hardest jobs on the planet, met and befriended men from all over the country desperately trying to build better lives for themselves in an unforgiving tundra, in a small town with an economy like capitalism on steroids.

I wrote over 500 pages while I was there. I recorded over 9 hours of interviews with 7 different people. 

From weeks spent sleeping in a truck to months spent crashing on a mattress on the floor of a room shared with five other men looking for work, from gun deals in garages to the hookers in the bars, from ex-cons on work sites to the tough locals trying to make good in a home they barely recognize, I lived and worked with them for ten hard months. Now I want to share their stories and mine. Because I also experienced the quieter moments: true beauty in an unforgiving landscape, the sun dogs, that calm feeling ice fishing can give you and the wealth of kindness shown to me as an out-of-towner.   

What the Money Goes Toward

I am traveling back to North Dakota with a professional photographer and documentarian to obtain the rest of the interviews I need for the book. Once I have the interviews, they will be transcribed by a professional transcription service which is costly. The integrity of the book hinges on the integrity of these transcriptions. It is not something that I can do myself or ask friends to do for me. The research also has expenses attached to it. Accessing court documents and public records requires a lot of man hours as well as various fees. I am going to hire a copy editor and a content editor when the work is drafted to make certain that the proposal I write is as airtight of a presentation as possible. Also, capitalizing on this campaign will buy me a small window of time in which I can seclude myself and focus exclusively on the work.

Other Ways You Can Help

I want to tell this story. Telling this story in small gatherings and groups and answering questions about what life is like in a boom town, who I met, what I saw and what I think it all means, is an integral part of my process of writing this book.  If you have the ability to host a small gathering, preferably people who don't already know me well, who would consider donating and who would be interested in discussing the book with me, I am very open to that. 

I'd also appreciate any help spreading the word about this campaign on the internet or through phone calls and conversations. 

Why I Am Writing This Book

I think this is one of the most important stories in America right now.  While a great deal has been written and debated (often inaccurately) about the environmental or socio-political impact of new drilling technologies on a global scale, there is very little that has taken into account the lives of people who do the day to day jobs that keep oil flowing in America. I want to tell the stories of these lives. 

I believe that the boom town is, in fact, a microcosm for an economic model that is becoming more and more prevalent in our time. It is completely unsustainable, it is scary and it also holds beautiful, hopeful promise for thousands of people.

By writing about the modern oil boom, I hope to write an expansive human portrait of workers that also addresses some of our country's bigger, more thorny issues.  

Why I Think I Am the Person To Write This Book

The oil boom in North Dakota has received coverage from the New York Times, the LA Times, NPR, National Geographic and Men's Journal to name a few. While many of these articles have been informative and well written, very little has been written that goes below the surface of the boom or delves deeply and honestly into the day to day lives of the people experiencing it.

I am not writing about the boom as a New Yorker who flew to North Dakota for a week, noticed the roads were bad and flew home. I'm writing about the boom as a 38 year old unskilled laborer who uprooted himself in the hope of building a better life for himself in the oil field. I came away with a completely eye opening experience that has fundamentally changed the way I view the economy, oil production and what it means to work hard.

I am no stranger to in-depth research, interviews or long term writing projects. I spent years working on my play Woody Guthrie Dreams. That project involved digging through thousands of Woody’s unpublished pages at the Guthrie Archive as well as interviewing and speaking to many of Guthrie's family members and friends such as Pete Seeger, Nora Guthrie and Ramblin’ Jack Elliott.  I consider that play in many ways to be a precursor to this current project which I believe can have an even greater, more immediate impact.

A Brief Biography of My Work

Michael Patrick Flanagan Smith is a playwright, actor and musician. His plays, including BOX, Trust the Government and Ain’t No Sin have been produced at various venues in Baltimore and New York City.  He acted in From the Desk of Sarah Seely's How To Disappear Completely... and So, Mr. Person How Did You Do It?  at Joyce Soho Dance Workshop. Smith's play Woody Guthrie Dreams was performed at the Creative Alliance in Baltimore and at Theater for the New City in New York in 2011. In California, Smith worked with science fiction author and futurist Robert Anton Wilson, updating his play Wilhelm Reich in Hell and directing a production for Son of Semele Ensemble, LA’s premier Avant Garde theater troupe. As a musician, Smith has released two records with a third due in Fall 2014. He has shared the stage with many musicians including Wye Oak, Deer Tick & Ramblin’ Jack Elliott. Smith has also worked as a construction worker, stage hand, bartender, waiter, receptionist, book store clerk, warehouse worker and oil field hand. He is at work on his first book.
story_txt:
Summary
I moved to Williston, North Dakota,
the heart of America’s current oil boom, in May of 2013 and spent the better
part of a year working in the oil field as a swamper for a rig moving company.
I hired on to one of the hardest
jobs on the planet, met and befriended men from all over the country
desperately trying to build better lives for themselves in an unforgiving
tundra, in a small town with an economy like capitalism on steroids.
I wrote over 500 pages while I was
there. I recorded over 9 hours of interviews with 7 different people. 
From weeks spent sleeping in a truck
to months spent crashing on a mattress on the floor of a room shared with five
other men looking for work, from gun deals in garages to the hookers in the bars, from ex-cons on
work sites to the tough locals trying to make good in a home they barely recognize, I lived and worked with them for ten hard months. Now I want to share their stories and mine. Because I also experienced the quieter moments: true beauty in an unforgiving landscape, the sun dogs, that calm feeling ice fishing can give you and the wealth of kindness shown to me as an out-of-towner.   
What the Money Goes Toward
I am traveling back to North Dakota
with a professional photographer and documentarian to obtain the rest of the interviews I need for the book. Once I have the interviews, they will be
transcribed by a professional transcription service which is costly. The
integrity of the book hinges on the integrity of these transcriptions. It is
not something that I can do myself or ask friends to do for me. The research
also has expenses attached to it. Accessing court documents and public records
requires a lot of man hours as well as various fees. I am going to hire a
copy editor and a content editor when the work is drafted to make certain that
the proposal I write is as airtight of a presentation as possible. Also,
capitalizing on this campaign will buy me a small window of time in which I can
seclude myself and focus exclusively on the work.Other Ways You Can HelpI want to tell this story. story:
Short Summary

For my 30th Birthday, I'd like to ask your help in paying it forward to the Hurston/Wright Foundation. I took my first writing workshop with Hurston/Wright with brilliant writer-teachers: Tyehimba Jess, Patrice Gaines, and A. Van Jordan. 

So, I'm asking 30 of my family, friends, and colleagues to donate a minimum of $30 to this worthy institution that's been around for 24 years. 

What We Need & What You Get

My goal is to raise a minimum of $900 (30 people donating $30 each.) Of course, We are grateful for every contribution whether its a $30, $50 or $100 donation. The proceeds from this campaign will provide general operating funds to help Hurston/Wright pay non-program related expenses such as:

  • The salary for our part-time virtual assistant.
  • Paying our rent, telephone bills, web host service, Submittable account, etc. 
  • The cost to rent facilities to run our summer workshops for teenagers and adults in Washington, D.C.

The Impact

As an organization that's been around almost a quarter of a century, our reach is both global and local. The Hurston/Wright Foundation is the only organization of its kind to honor black writers from a jury of its peers. 

  • We give High School writers an opportunity to develop their literary voices through our annual summer workshops.
  • We showcase college writers and professional writers of all genres annually at our Legacy Awards Gala in the Fall. 
  • We help writers navigate the publishing industry

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to make a financial contribution, you can still help by helping to spread the word on your social media channels, also by emailing your networks and attaching a link to this campaign. 

You can also offer to volunteer to work on a project for the Hurston/Wright Foundation. We are largely staffed by volunteers, so we'd be grateful for someone to lend their professional talent and time on behalf of the Foundation. You can make such inquiries at info@hurstonwright.org

Thank you!

story:
My Mission

WIN - WIN

Help me GIFT up to a 1,000 FREE Copies of 

"6 Minutes Wrestling With Life".

Every dollar that is raised in this campaign will be reinvested to provide a FREE signed copy of "6 Minutes Wrestling With Life" to a young athlete on Long Island.

Help me put this book in the hands of the young athletes that who can benefit by its message. 

You can make a donation of any amount and specify which team or organization that you want to receive the GIFTED Books.

Background Information

My name is John A. Passaro.

I am a father of four children and the author of "6 Minutes Wrestling With Life"

In 2009 my oldest child Jessica, lost oxygen to her brain for 6 minutes, she was put into a medically induced coma, and me and wife spent 151 days at her bedside aiding her recovery.

"6 Minutes Wrestling With Life" is about my families journey through the depths of despair to euphoric highs in life.

I have a dual goal of caring for and curing Jess while living and loving life. 

My mission is to have more good than bad come from this event.

I believe that "6 Minutes Wrestling With Life"  is a book that can change a persons perspective on life.

And by doing so, much good will come from that.

"6 Minutes Wrestling With Life" is a book about fighting and never giving up.

It is about unconditional love, having the ability to keep going on when you are mentally and physically exhausted.

It is about family and sport and having the ability to keep moving forward.

My campaign is to have more good than bad come from my families tragedy.

I believe that the human spirit, when called upon, can perform miracles.

That when we have belief, confidence and an enthusiasm for life, even during its most trying times, that great things will happen.

My mission now is to get this book in the hands of the people who can benefit from it.

We all know someone in our lives who is currently going through a hard time, whether because of a family illness, death or due to a loss of a dream.

Everyone can use a little inspiration, a little belief and faith.

This campaign will keep rerunning until the overall goal of raising $5,000 is reached.

I am also providing Perks to be able to get this book into your family and friends hands at an extremely discounted rate.

The Impact

Please read the book reviews to see the impact that this book has made on the people's lives who have read it.

Here are some reviews of the book.

Imagine if 1,000 more young adults can read it for FREE.

Imagine being able to get this book to your family and friends at a greatly discounted rate while providing the proceeds to fund a campaign for 1,000 books to be given away.

There are 2 Ways That You Can Help

1. The first way is to contribute to this campaign. Any contribution amount is greatly appreciated. 

2. The second way, which is just as important, is to post this campaign on your social media account so your family and friends can see it.
