story:
A BOOK.

If you’re uncomfortable about how you feel - struggled with a number of exercise and weight programs and are still far away from the happiness you desire, become part of a simple attitude that is changing the way people live. Think The Wholelife Workout!

We live in a new world full of smartphones and smart computers that connect us to everything, making it almost impossible for the average person to be proactive with their personal health and well being. The Wholelife Workout is a practical usable program designed for anyone in this 21st century.

Some things never change - like how the human body is basically the same as the antecedent before us. Learn to customize your lifestyle without changing your life. Reconnect with yourself and get back to the basics that have been with us forever. Wholelife it, and use the time you’ve been given to live! By a simple change in your awareness of time and the things you do everyday, you will improve your health. – Improve your mind, body and soul.

If you think you don’t have the time to take care of yourself, The Wholelife Workout keeps you alert – helps you understand how to stay active, while living for the moment with compromises. LIFE IS ALL OF IT! It’s easy to exercise when you discover this simple secret. Did you know the average person spends nearly 19% of their life watching television, an average of 142 hours a month! Don’t worry, you can still enjoy your favorite programs, but with life saving movement. Wholelifer’s make these wonderful compromises during their day to achieve an all around healthy way of living.

Customize your habits with necessary compromises to create happiness. Maybe you had too much to eat last night… Most people know this by the way they feel, but are unaware of the action that needs to follow. Understanding cause and effect creates awareness that makes for control and responsible living. You wouldn’t put a gun to your head and pull the trigger because most of us understand the effect.

The author has developed a brilliant way to stay in shape by focusing on your unique life. One important goal is to build The Wholelife Workout into a household name – a name that will help improve the way all of us enjoy life. By helping the author deliver this wonderful work to the world, it will improve our chances of a new world filled with happiness, health, and responsibility… You will be the first to be involved in this message, this life-changing attitude – The workout doesn’t stop in the gym.

How does it work?

 By learning the simple break down of a day, and how you live in each of these five categories, it will open your heart to a new journey – a life filled with understanding. The Wholelife Workout is exactly what it means and sounds like; it’s about your entire life - not just part of it! Your life is the workout!

The author has creating The Wholelife Workout for a changing world, a world full of information, impressive ideas, and beautiful people who come in every shape, size, and color…. Be a Wholelifer!

Positive living isn’t expensive, but doing repair can be. When you become a Wholelifer, you live better because of the information you profit from.

The Wholelife Workout availability at this time…

We have been on this program for an entire life. A second-generation example, the words can be available to help others live with absolute confidence! Thousands of hours and as much money have produced this wonderful secret thus far. The Book you see in the video can be completed quickly, along with an audio version, plus an eBook and PDF version, if we meet our goal.

 

 

The Book is spiral bound with the information on 8.5 X 11.0 X .255 inches 20lbs paper. Reading level is ages 18 and up. There are 73 pages not inclusive of the front clear cover and vinyl back. The language at this time is English. Will be available at www.thewholelifeworkout.com

 

The Audio Version consists of three (3) CD’s and has a running time of 249 minutes 39 seconds. The packaging is a DVD case with an insert, all shrink-wrapped. This version will be available on line at www.thewholelifeworkout.com along with a MP3 version. The MP3 format has a file size of 71mb. This version has an unlimited simultaneous device usage that is compatible with all MP3 players.

The E-Pub format Version is 8.77mb, with an unlimited simultaneous device usage. It will also be available at www.thewholelifeworkout.com.  Devices: Barnes & Noble NOOK, Apple iPad, Bookeen Cybook Opus, Sony Reader Touch Edition, Bookworm Online ePub eBook Reader, Apple iPhone and iPod Touch, Adobe Digital Editions, Kobo eReader, Sony Reader Pocket Edition (PRS350), Elonex 5″ Colour eBook Reader, iRiver Touch eReader (with WiFi), Sony Reader Daily Edition, BeBook One, BeBook Mini, BeBook Neo 

The PDF format is 7.32mb, with an unlimited simultaneous device usage, and will be for sale at www.thewholelifeworkout.com

With your support, we can help change the way people enjoy life, exercise, and eat worldwide.  We can be in production within two (2) months after our goal is met. Your contribution will help fund:

- Completion of the book, editing, formatting, illustration work, copyrights and more...

- Creation of PDF, eBook, and other digital versions that will be bought, downloaded,and viewed online.

- Recording of the source material, The Wholelife Workout, into an Audio Version; editing and engineering of product, adding sound effects, and packaging of book. Creating product format for sell, CD's and digital downloads (MP3).

- Simple Production, finish our web-site design and base architecture

- Universal Public Awareness, T-shirts, Jerseys, Caps, and Merchandising…

- Production for Seminars


The goal we have set is based on production cost and everything it takes to produce this wonderful book. In this competitive and ever changing market, this campaign will help improve The Wholelife Workout's chances for success. We anticipate an appreciation for what we have to offer, because in the end it is this book, and what we leave behind that matters most. If we could, we would create this for free, but that's not how the business world works, Thank you...

Who’s The Wholelife Workout?

The Wholelife Workout was created and written by L. Sudbury www.LSudbury.com - author of Montyne’s Inferno www.montynesinferno.com - and son of the late American artist Montyne.

The professional team consists of Mariah Stegner, secretary and product manager. Sterling Evans of Ion Tech Center, technical support and production.

Perks


Montyne www.montyne.com - one of America’s hidden treasures - fills each Book with his illustrations. These wonderful reproduced works of art, by the author’s father, are extraordinary, rare, and desired by many collectors around the world. As a bonus, we will be giving Prints by this artist to supporters, as Montyne is the inspiration behind this book. Audio Versions will be available. The author, L. Sudbury www.Lsudbury.com, narrates the Audio Version. The performance will be educational, while at the same time entertaining. You can be the first to become a Wholelifer.

                                                      

Bad habits are like the tick of time. Over a lifetime they can be expensive by adding up. How much is a life full of responsibility and compromises worth? The cost is priceless! For $25, you can help us deliver this information and become a Wholelifer.

FAQ

Q. How is this program different from others that promise results? A.  By bringing the program to everyone and not everyone to the program “the gym” you create a system of living that becomes all-inclusive - forever.  LIFE IS ALL OF IT!

Q. What does someone need to start? A. The desire, and if there is no desire or a lack of it, the information in the W/W will change a person’s perspective.

Q. Does this system of living, exercise, and eating have support? A. Yes, and information is abundant. A beautiful web-site for information and questions is available.

Q. After the cost of the Book or any of the other versions, is it expensive? A. No. Most people are surprised at how much money is wasted on food because of habit or they think they have to go to the gym to stay in shape.

Q. When will I see results? A. Once the simple truth is understood, a life can change… This is a lifetime commitment.  How many times have you truly wanted something and went for it? Making a commitment to yourself and staying with it guaranties a productive life.

Q. Where did this idea come from? A. The author was raised by the system that is in this Bookl. His father - The Great Montyne, and beautiful mother China lived a life of temperance, self-control, and excitement, while enjoying the parts of life that destroy most people.

Q. What is the most important message in the program? A. No one is perfect; in times of fun and over doing it, it is important that we counteract our actions – “How?” you may ask. That is why we need to make this program available….

- Recording of the source material, The Wholelife Workout, into an Audio Version; editing and engineering of product, adding sound effects, and packaging of book. Creating product format for sell, CD's and digital downloads (MP3).
- Simple Production, finish our web-site design and base architecture 
- Universal Public Awareness, T-shirts, Jerseys, Caps, and Merchandising…
- Production for Seminars
The goal we have set is based on production cost and everything it takes to produce this wonderful book. In this competitive and ever changing market, this campaign will help improve The Wholelife Workout's chances for success. We anticipate an appreciation for what we have to offer, because in the end it is this book, and what we leave behind that matters most. If we could, we would create this for free, but that's not how the business world works, Thank you...
Who’s The Wholelife Workout?
The Wholelife Workout was created and written by L. Sudbury www.LSudbury.com - author of Montyne’s Inferno www.montynesinferno.com - and son of the late American artist Montyne.
The professional team consists of Mariah Stegner, secretary and product manager. Sterling Evans of Ion Tech Center, technical support and production.
Perks


Montyne www.montyne.com - one of America’s hidden treasures - fills each Book with his illustrations. These wonderful reproduced works of art, by the author’s father, are extraordinary, rare, and desired by many collectors around the world. As a bonus, we will be giving Prints by this artist to supporters, as Montyne is the inspiration behind this book. Audio Versions will be available. The author, L. Sudbury www.Lsudbury.com, narrates the Audio Version. The performance will be educational, while at the same time entertaining. You can be the first to become a Wholelifer.
                                                      

Bad habits are like the tick of time. Over a lifetime they can be expensive by adding up. How much is a life full of responsibility and compromises worth? The cost is priceless! For $25, you can help us deliver this information and become a Wholelifer.
FAQ
Q. How is this program different from others that promise results? A.  By bringing the program to everyone and not everyone to the program “the gym” you create a system of living that becomes all-inclusive - forever.  LIFE IS ALL OF IT!
Q. What does someone need to start? A. The desire, and if there is no desire or a lack of it, the information in the W/W will change a person’s perspective.
Q. Does this system of living, exercise, and eating have support? A. Yes, and information is abundant. A beautiful web-site for information and questions is available.
Q. After the cost of the Book or any of the other versions, is it expensive? A. No. Most people are surprised at how much money is wasted on food because of habit or they think they have to go to the gym to stay in shape.
Q. When will I see results? A. Once the simple truth is understood, a life can change… This is a lifetime commitment.  How many times have you truly wanted something and went for it? Making a commitment to yourself and staying with it guaranties a productive life.
Q. Where did this idea come from? A. The author was raised by the system that is in this Bookl. His father - The Great Montyne, and beautiful mother China lived a life of temperance, self-control, and excitement, while enjoying the parts of life that destroy most people.
Q. What is the most important message in the program? A. No one is perfect; in times of fun and over doing it, it is important that we counteract our actions – “How?” you may ask. That is why we need to make this program available….

story:
„DKZA“ - DIE KUNST ZU ALTERN

Ein mitreißendes Plädoyer für die Lust zu leben.

Hans Keller macht aus Stiftsfrauen Shootingstars...

 

Was wir brauchen & Was man bekommt

DIE KUNST ZU ALTERN (DKZA) ist ein außergewöhnliches Kunstprojekt des Frankfurter Fotografen Hans Keller, der Make-up-Artistin Regine Hoffmann und der Projektmanagerin Nadja Dragovic.
 
DKZA möchte den aktuellen Teil der Lebensgeschichte älterer Frauen fotografisch
dokumentieren und dabei die Ästhetik des Alters darstellen: ein mitreißendes Plädoyer für die Lust zu leben.

Umsetzung:
Casting und Foto-Shooting von Stiftsfrauen des St. Katharinen- und Weißfrauenstifts,
Frankfurt am Main mit anschließender Fotoausstellung im September 2013
 
Wirkung:
Fotos von Frauen mit einer Lebensspanne von 60 bis 101 Jahren zeigen, dass Alter etwas Wundervolles sein kann. In unserer Zeit, in der Alter nur „alt“, aber nicht mehr „weise und erfahren“ und schon gar nicht lebenslustig bedeutet, liefern die Fotos von Hans Keller ganz besondere Erkenntnismomente.

Casting:
Bereits das Live-Casting hat alle Erwartungen übertroffen: In kürzester Zeit hatten sich über 100 Damen angemeldet, die auch alle vom DKZA Team empfangen wurden.
Das Casting wurde mit der Jury, bestehend aus Fotograf, Make-up Artistin, Projektmanagerin und einer Fachfrau aus dem sozialen Umfeld durchgeführt.

Für die Stiftsfrauen ist das Casting ein kleiner Feiertag. „So viel Interesse an meiner Person, das gefällt mir“, sagt eine Teilnehmerin mit entwaffnender Ehrlichkeit. Gefällt das nicht jedem ?!

Foto-Shooting :
Das Shooting findet im Februar und März 2013 im Franfurter OnlightStudio des Fotografen Hans Keller statt.

Ausstellung:
Im Mai 2013 werden die finalen Bilder in der Galerie der Frankfurter Sparkasse 1822,
Neue Mainzer Str. 49, 60255 Frankfurt am Main, der breiten Öffentlichkeit präsentiert. Des weiteren sind eine Wanderausstellung und fortlaufende Projekte geplant...

Sponsoring:
Sponsoren sind herzlich eingeladen, das Kunstprojekt für ihre Kommunikations- bzw.
Marketingziele in Form von Geld-, Sach- und Dienstleistungen zu nutzen.


Ihre Unterstützung macht uns folgendes möglich:

  • Die Ausstellung der ca. 60 großformatigen Fotografien
  • Postkartenedition / Buchdokumentation
  • Flyer, Plakate, Programmhefte...


Was wir benötigen:

  • Ihre finanzielle Unterstützung um dieses Projekt zu realisieren.
  • Ihre Mithilfe bei der Verbreitung und Bekanntmachung unseres Projektes.

Auch wenn Sie es sich nicht leisten können, unser Projekt finanziell zu unterstützen,
können Sie uns durch die Verbreitung unserer Spendenaktion unter die Arme greifen.
Leiten Sie diesen Spendenaufruf über Ihre Netzwerke weiter, auch damit erhöhen Sie
unsere Chancen auf Erfolg!

Facebook 'like'

 

 

Warum geben Sie:

Damit wir mit diesem Projekt etwas zurückgeben können!
Die Geschichten unserer Protagonistinnen sind die Geschichten von uns allen!

Sie ermöglichen Hans Keller und seinem Team den Traum wahr werden zu lassen, diese einzigartigen Geschichten zu erzählen und damit einem gesellschaftspolitischem Thema Raum zur Diskussion zu verschaffen.

Jede Spende bringt uns unserem Ziel ein Stück näher.

Sollten wir höhere Spendeneingänge erreichen als wir für das Projekt benötigen,
fließen diese an die bedürftigen Stiftsdamen zurück um auch Ihnen die Möglichkeit zu geben, Ihre Träume wahr werden zu lassen.

Infomappe-DKZA.PDF

 

Team:

Fotograf: Hans Keller, www.hanskeller.com
Hair & Make-up: Regine Hoffmann
Projektmanagement: Nadja C. Dragovic, moodwillig Produktion, www.moodwillig.com

Styling am Set: Erika von Landwüst (Stiftsfrau)
Grafik Design: Katrin Wendt
Sponsoren Akquise: Martina Stark
Kulturmanagement: Piroska Szönye
Öffentlichkeitsarbeit: Jörg Lüdecke, St.Katharinen und Weissfrauenstift

story:
Book Summary

Some dreams shouldn’t come true.

Seventeen-year-old, Meg Daly, seeks a new beginning in the seaside town of Port Paxton. But when terrifying visions begin to plague her, and a parasitic phantom bent on killing witches invades her dreams, Meg realizes she’s entangled in something far beyond her comprehension. With the help of an unlikely new friend, Meg discovers she’s a Divine Witch destined to eradicate the phantom.

But can Meg harness her powers with crystals and overcome self-doubt before the phantom kills her and her new friends?

About the Book

This debut young adult contemporary fantasy novel follows a girl dealing with grief and guilt who must learn to open her heart again and believe in herself.

It may appeal to fans of Keeper by Kim Chance, Charmed, and The Magicians.

Author Info

Hey, I’m J.J.! Thank you so much for supporting my endeavor. A little bit about me, I received a BA in English with an emphasis on creative writing from Western Michigan University. In 2010, Oxford University Press published a book I co-authored (Aniridia & WAGR Syndrome: A Guide for Patients and Families). When I’m not writing, I love to read, listen to music, watch Authortube videos, attend NKOTB concerts with my friends, spend time with my family, and volunteer for Aniridia Foundation International (AFI) as the editor of the AFI's news edition, the Eye On Aniridia. 

For book updates and insider info, follow me online:

View my website or to subscribe to my newsletter click:  Here

Follow me on Instagram Here

Why I’m Pre-Selling My Book This Way

After querying with no luck, the traditional publishing industry slowing down even more due to COVID, and publishers not acquiring as many YA (young adult) novels, I've decided to self-publish my novel. With self-publishing, it can be difficult to get your first book off the ground. Here's why I've decided to pre-sell my book in a crowdfunding campaign:

There are costs that occur when you self-publish books, and while I can cut corners as much as possible, creating a professional clean book is ultimately an investment.

With pre-selling my book this way, I'm setting my book up for much bigger success than just posting it to Amazon and crossing my fingers. My goal with this campaign is to get my book out and into the hands of readers (aka - you!) right away. 

By sharing my book in this way, I also get to create a lot of cool stuff to go along with it (such as handcrafted crystal bookmarks, character art cards, etc). These additional perks probably wouldn't come to fruition until much later in my publishing journey without a campaign like this. Not only will this campaign push me to create all these fun perks in the first place, but it also helps me to create the buzz necessary to launch a book in a fun and exciting way. By creating this book merchandise, I can also do things like giveaways on my social media.

If I don't reach my goal amount, the funds I do raise here will go strictly to editing and cover design.

What Your Contributions Help Me Do

With your contributions, I'll be able to self-publish my debut novel by being able to pay for the following costs:

  • Pay for a developmental editor and a copy editor (Cost: $1,700)
  • Pay for LLC logo, ebook cover & paperback cover, book art, and character art that will go on all my book merchandise (Estimated Cost: $437)
  • Due to my low vision, I may need to hire someone to format my ebook and paperback book. (Estimated Cost: $350)
  • Purchase supplies to make unique crystal bookmarks for you. The bookmarks will have the crystals that are part of the magic system in my novel. (Estimated Cost: $120)
  • Pay for the printing of all paperback books, book merchandise, and to pay for shipping to get these perks to you.

Risks & Challenges

In this section, I want to share with you the risk and challenges that I may face with publishing and launching and what that means for you as an individual contributing to this campaign:

I want my book edited and ready for publication at least by December 2021.

The challenge with this is that if I can't get enough funds to pay for the editing, then I will have to delay the publication date.

The good news is I’ve already secured my cover designer who is also creating art for merchandise and character art.

I've also already secured my developmental editor and copy editor. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that not everyone can contribute financially, but there are other ways that you can help! The things listed below will help more than you can ever imagine...

  • Share with your friends and followers on all your social accounts. The more people that see this campaign, the closer I'll get to reaching my goal. You can easily share the campaign by clicking on the share tools at the top of this page.
  • Leave a review when you do read my book. If you decide to wait until my book is published to pick up your own copy, please help me out by leaving a review on Amazon or Goodreads. These reviews help me out by letting other readers know that you enjoyed my book, plus it makes my book easier to find when people search on Amazon and other sites.

Thank you so, so much!

story:
¿Qué?

Humanos es una novela de ciencia ficción que aborda el inminente fin de la especie humana y, a la par, la esperanza de su continuidad a través de un importante descubrimiento.

El hallazgo de un enorme objeto enterrado bajo un pequeño pueblo de la sierra de Madrid, desencadena una serie de sucesos que cambiarán la historia de la humanidad. Pocos años después del descubrimiento, la ciencia y la tecnología dan un enorme salto cualitativo y eso propicia el enfrentamiento entre los que, hasta ahora, controlaban los sectores productivos básicos y los que habían apostado por la nueva ciencia y la nueva manera de entender la vida.

Como ha venido ocurriendo durante casi todo el siglo anterior, existen dos claras tendencias políticas que, con este nuevo escenario se radicalizarán aún más. Eso lleva a graves enfrentamientos y, después, a su separación. Una nueva idea cala hondo en el hombre. Todo lo que vemos es Dios, lo que no vemos también es Dios, los animales y las plantas, la Tierra y los infinitos astros que pueblan el Universo. Nosotros somos Dios….

El hombre, por fin descubrirá el sentido de la vida, a través de la ciencia y la meditación.

Cada paso que daba, le acercaba a ser más Dios.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy se nos presenta Germán G. Cobián.

Soy el segundo de los cuatro hijos que tuvieron mis padres, aunque ahora solo vivimos los dos mayores.  Como era habitual en aquella época, tuve que comenzar a trabajar a los quince años, compatibilizando el tener que llevar dinero a casa con los estudios. Esa situación duró cinco años, hasta que decidí dar un vuelco a mi vida, dejando los estudios y cambiando de trabajo. En esa época, conocía a Maribel, con quien me casaría varios años después y con quien tendría a mis dos hijos. En esa época fue cuando comencé a interesarme por temas relacionados con el arte, teatro, poesía, música. En estas y en otras facetas artísticas, participé en mayor o menor medida. Fui miembro de una banda de Rock, de un grupo de teatro, monté un taller de artesanía, estudié fotografía y estuve unos cinco años fotografiándolo todo, sobre todo a mi hijo recién nacido y pasando miles de horas en el laboratorio fotográfico que puse en casa.

Cuatro años después de que naciera Eduardo, nació Violeta y sin yo sospecharlo, aquello hizo que mi vida diera otro giro. Hasta ese momento, para mí, el trabajo solo era algo secundario, necesario, pero secundario. Con la nueva situación, eso cambió. Poco a poco, fui abandonando mis actividades e inquietudes artísticas y, sin habérmelo propuesto, me integré plenamente en el mundo del trabajo. Con el tiempo, esta nueva  actitud dio sus frutos profesionales y económicos y, lentamente, fui progresando. Esa situación se mantuvo durante años, hasta que decidí dejar de trabajar para otros y, junto con unos amigos, montamos una empresa que tuvimos que cerrar al cabo de un tiempo. Volví a trabajar por cuenta ajena, ocupando puestos de cierta relevancia, pero ya estaba infectado por ese virus que te hace muy difícil poder volver a trabajar para otros.

En el año 2006 monté una empresa que, después, supondría mi ruina.

El caso es que en el año 2012, mientras mi mujer y mis hijos se iban de casa temprano a sus quehaceres, yo me quedaba recogiendo y pensando en que hacer para ocupar el tiempo. Entonces, me pareció buena idea comenzar a escribir y, como supongo que les ocurre a los que están en una situación parecida a la mía, comencé a escribir una especie de biografía que titulé Recuerdos y Reflexiones. Fue entonces cuando me volví a infectar de otro virus, esta vez, del virus que hace que no puedas dejar de escribir y de pensar en que escribir.

Durante los dos años siguientes, escribí casi veinte novelas que solo ha leído Maribel, mi mujer. Cuando comencé a escribir, sin ser consciente de ello en ese momento, descubrí un medio para mitigar mi amargura.

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 840€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como una ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Humanos que saldría pocas semanas después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Germán G. Cobián vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

¿Quiénes?
Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.
De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.
Hoy se nos presenta Germán G. Cobián.
Soy el segundo de los cuatro hijos que tuvieron mis padres, aunque ahora solo vivimos los dos mayores.  Como era habitual en aquella época, tuve que comenzar a trabajar a los quince años, compatibilizando el tener que llevar dinero a casa con los estudios. Esa situación duró cinco años, hasta que decidí dar un vuelco a mi vida, dejando los estudios y cambiando de trabajo. En esa época, conocía a Maribel, con quien me casaría varios años después y con quien tendría a mis dos hijos. En esa época fue cuando comencé a interesarme por temas relacionados con el arte, teatro, poesía, música. En estas y en otras facetas artísticas, participé en mayor o menor medida. Fui miembro de una banda de Rock, de un grupo de teatro, monté un taller de artesanía, estudié fotografía y estuve unos cinco años fotografiándolo todo, sobre todo a mi hijo recién nacido y pasando miles de horas en el laboratorio fotográfico que puse en casa.
Cuatro años después de que naciera Eduardo, nació Violeta y sin yo sospecharlo, aquello hizo que mi vida diera otro giro. Hasta ese momento, para mí, el trabajo solo era algo secundario, necesario, pero secundario. Con la nueva situación, eso cambió. Poco a poco, fui abandonando mis actividades e inquietudes artísticas y, sin habérmelo propuesto, me integré plenamente en el mundo del trabajo. Con el tiempo, esta nueva  actitud dio sus frutos profesionales y económicos y, lentamente, fui progresando. Esa situación se mantuvo durante años, hasta que decidí dejar de trabajar para otros y, junto con unos amigos, montamos una empresa que tuvimos que cerrar al cabo de un tiempo. Volví a trabajar por cuenta ajena, ocupando puestos de cierta relevancia, pero ya estaba infectado por ese virus que te hace muy difícil poder volver a trabajar para otros.
En el año 2006 monté una empresa que, después, supondría mi ruina.
El caso es que en el año 2012, mientras mi mujer y mis hijos se iban de casa temprano a sus quehaceres, yo me quedaba recogiendo y pensando en que hacer para ocupar el tiempo. Entonces, me pareció buena idea comenzar a escribir y, como supongo que les ocurre a los que están en una situación parecida a la mía, comencé a escribir una especie de biografía que titulé Recuerdos y Reflexiones. Fue entonces cuando me volví a infectar de otro virus, esta vez, del virus que hace que no puedas dejar de escribir y de pensar en que escribir.
Durante los dos años siguientes, escribí casi veinte novelas que solo ha leído Maribel, mi mujer. Cuando comencé a escribir, sin ser consciente de ello en ese momento, descubrí un medio para mitigar mi amargura.
¿Cómo?
Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 840€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como una ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Humanos que saldría pocas semanas después a la venta.
Además...
Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Germán G. Cobián vea publicada su obra.Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
Short Summary

My Criminal Cure is a novel I'm writing about my husband Adam who was diagnosed with terminal Stage 4 Merkel Cell Carcinoma in the lymph nodes. He found relief during his struggle and his treatment from the use of medicinal marijuana. This is his story, about the neglect from doctors, his legal battles, and how he survived it all.
 
I'm hoping this book will help someone like Adam. His case received no media coverage, no one knew a man days after his final chemotherapy treatment was arrested for growing marijuana, the only thing that gave him any relief during his treatment and help pause the continued growth of his cancer. He was arrested for a drug, legal to someone with his health condition that no doctor was willing to support.
 
Merkel Cell Carcinoma is an extremely rare and aggressive form of skin cancer. Due to Adam's doctors being uneducated and unaware of Merkel Cell Carcinoma, his condition was neglected and very quickly escalated to Stage 4.
 
In September 2010, when Adam was diagnosed. He was given a prognosis of 3 months to live, to the point where they highly suggested he start planning for his death during every oncology appointment. He did not die, he did not stop fighting and he is still alive today continuing his struggle. When diagnosed their major concern was that one of the largest tumors was constricting a major artery in his leg risking a pulmonary embolism at any moment.
 
What We Need & What You Get

This book is going to be self-published. I figured that was the best way to get the word out about his case. For anyone that would be interested in hearing about it, available to anyone who would benefit from it. My goal is to have this book published in paperback and e-book format. I'm not writing this book with the hope  to make an abundance of money, however self-publishing has it's own fees tied to it.
 
I'm grateful and thankful for my friends. A lot of people have willingly donated their time and effort into editing and illustration for me so it's a cost I don't have to worry about.
 
However, some money is needed to help make this book the best it can be. I'm looking for a bare minimum of $500. This contribution will help cover manuscripts for editing, minimal fees associated with self publishing, and the cost of buying a hard copies of the book once it's completed.
 
If I exceed my $500, I will be giving back to the people who contributed their time to help make this book possible and put forth some money into advertising.
 
If we reach $30,000, (after books costs and fees) we are able to re-pay loans associated with his legal battle.

The Impact

Through everything, Adam maintained a positive attitude. He stayed positive when he had no other references, or anyone else to turn to. I want this book to be something someone like him can turn to. I want it to create an awareness of his experiences. I want it to be able to help someone.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you're unable to make a contribution, that's okay too. Share this page with your friends and loved ones.

story:
The Guild Literary Complex, Third World Press, and The American Writers Museum present the first annual BROOKSDAY!

BROOKSDAY is a marathon reading of the works of Gwendolyn Brooks on her Birthday. 

Help us honor the generosity and artistic legacy of one of Chicago’s most beloved literary figures. Teens, children, actors, and teachers join notable literary, cultural, civic, and political leaders from Chicago and beyond on stage at the Chicago Cultural Center on June 7 in celebration of the Pulitzer Prize winning Gwendolyn Brooks. 

BROOKSDAY 2013 will be the first step toward creating an annual event that will grow into a city-wide festival by 2017, Brooks's 100th birthday. We are creating an event that will commemorate Gwendolyn Brooks's artistic achievement, her legendary generosity toward other poets, her influence as a pathbreaking cultural figure in Chicago and the nation, and her deserved stature as the iconic poet of modern Chicago!

Gwendolyn Brooks was the first African American poet to hold the position of Consultant in Poetry to the Library of Congress (the same position that is now called Poet Laureate). Her many books include A Street In Bronzeville (1945), Annie Allen (for which she won the Pulitzer Prize in 1949), In the Mecca (1968), Blacks (1987) and a novel, Maud Martha (1953). She was the Poet Laureate of Illinois from 1968 until her death in 2000. We hope to create not only an event but also a consciousness in Chicago and the nation of a poet of extraordinary talent and an exceptional person as well, a woman of immense accomplishment both professional and personal. With your generous support we will gather at the Chicago Cultural Center on June 7 2013 to celebrate all that is Gwendolyn Brooks.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Wassim (that's Weh-seem) and I'm an independent writer from Peoria, Illinois. I am getting ready to self-publish my second collection of short stories, Mouth of God, Light of Infinity, in April. The stories in the book deal with life and mortality, in addition to other themes. It is nearing completion, with a tentative release date of April 16th, 2013.

I put out my first collection, I Know What I Know Now, in early 2011 and did relatively well given the very limited budget I had to work with. I am trying to put out the highest quality book I can while reaching a larger audience. 

I'm turning to Indiegogo because, as a graduate student paying for school, money is very tight for me. I believe the partnership with Indiegogo and its users will help my team and I release the best book we can.

The book will be available physically and in ebook form (PDF, MOBI and EPUB), with plans to release it through Amazon and Apple's digital bookstores. I will also be reaching out to local bookstores and businesses. 

I'll be making updates as needed to fill you folks in on the progress of the book, any potential delays, etc.

Story samples are available for download through my website: http://troubleonmymind.com/

That artwork you see above? That's by my friend Joshua Kovarik, and it is the regular edition cover. You can view more of his work at: http://jkovarik.weebly.com

 

What We Need

I need a total of $2000 to help cover the following:

  • Printing physical copies of the book and reprinting copies of my first book
  • Paying my editor, artists and other great people who helped make this project a reality
  • Submitting my book for a Kirkus Indie Express review
  • Various advertising costs
  • Travel costs
  • The Indiegogo fee

 

The Impact

The release of this book is important in more ways than one. It will add to Peoria's growing literary scene as well as serve as inspiration to young and aspiring writers. It will also be an important step in my journey to become the best damn writer I can be. And the only way I can grow as a writer is if my work reaches many people and I'm able to hear their opinions and feedback.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't pitch in? Help get the word out anyway! Share the page on Facebook and Twitter, email it to your friends and family! This campaign would not be possible without your help and input, and any and every contribution is greatly appreciated.

 

Meet My Crew

Joe Ballard (editor) is a 2011 graduate of Illinois State University, where he studied Publishing. He currently works as an editor for alternative music website Mind Equals Blown. Joe's page and articles can be found at http://mindequalsblown.net/joe-ballard/

Seth Kasky (website and book design) is studying Visual Communication at Northern Illinois University. He can be reached at https://twitter.com/sethkasky

Joshua Kovarik (regular edition cover artist) is an artist from Portland, Oregon. He is a 2011 graduate of the Oregon College of Art & Craft, where he also works as an assistant preperator at the Hoffman Gallery. His work can be found at http://jkovarik.weebly.com/index.html

Dakota Kuhlman (deluxe edition cover artist) graduated from Bradley University with a degree in Theatre Arts. He currently works as a freelance artist in the Peoria area.

story:
Short Summary

I have edited several anthologies of Native writers such as Genocide of the Mind and Eating Fire, Tasting Blood: Breaking the Great Silence of the American Indian Holocaust. I am going to publish this new anthology through my little independent press rENEGADE pLANETS pUBLISHING.

This anthology gives credence that Indigenous peoples have put into practice (for millenniums) what most physicists and scientists have considered only as theories. Exploring Quantum physics in relation to Indigenous peoples' understanding of the spiritual universe, these essays and poems include personal experiences, traditional stories, fictional and nonfiction ponderings, beliefs, and explorations.

 

I plan to market this book to various schools and universities so that it can be used to bring truth and honor to the Indigenous peoples of this land.

 

By contributing to this project, contributors will be assisting in bridiging the gap between races and help to promote the deserved credit to the many Native writers whose work is included.The funds raised will be used to publish the first short run of this ground breaking anthology.

 

 

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it’s important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it’s going. Be transparent and specific—people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

After several slams, open mics, and sick rhymes, USC has spoken (word.) The student body has selected five poets to represent them at CUPSI (College Union Poetry Slam Invitational.) 

They are

Afton Montgomery (Senior, Creative Writing & Environmental Science)

Alex Luu (Sophomore, Art & Animation)

Ariel Sobel (Junior, Screenwriting & Film Production)

Rachel R. Caroll (Junior, Creative Writing)

Susan Lin (Sophomore, Gender Studies)

After months of writing, rehearsing, and feeling all the feels, with our amazing Coach KiNG - we're ready to represent our school at nationals for the first time ever.

What We Need 

This year CUPSI is at the University of Texas in Austin. 
Which is far away from USC. Like really-oh-we-need-to get on a plane-far! Because tickets are expensive, we're reaching out to you to support us on this journey to share our poetry across the country.
To fly all of us to a from Austin, we need $1500. 

The Impact

For the first time, USC will join the poetry scene on a national level. 

This is an opportunity for our voices to be heard as individuals and a student body, and cultivate our spoken word community back in LA.

We are not just artists, but advocates - we hope to touch on social injustices such as child abuse, sexism, racism, homophobia, and the stigma against mental illness (just to start.) 

Also, we got jokes. Lots of 'em. 

Risks & Challenges

We promise to wear seat belts. The only thing that will bleed is our inky hearts.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, please share this cause with anyone in your community interested in poetry, social justice, and youth voices. 

From your high school teacher to aunt who reads to her cats, spread this link like the plague.

story:
Aidez le Coq Français à devenir le roi de la savane

Les équipes de France de hockey subaquatique chaussent leurs palmes direction les Championnats du Monde, qui se dérouleront à Stellenbosch (en Afrique du Sud), fin mars 2016. 

Pour cette aventure, la FFESSM (Fédération Française d'Etudes et de Sports Sous Marins) finance une partie des frais prévus, mais ne peut supporter entièrement le coût. Pour que les joueurs et les joueuses puissent réaliser leurs rêves et atteindre leur objectif, nous avons besoin de vous ! Aidez-les à se consacrer à leur préparation sportive et avoir ainsi les meilleures chances de réussite pour, qui sait, remporter une nouvelle fois le titre mondial. Devenez supporter des Equipes de France de hockey subaquatique ! 



Votre soutien est essentiel pour le Hockey subaquatique Français et les équipes de France.

En soutenant les équipes de France de hockey subaquatique , c'est tout le hockey subaquatique français que vous soutenez. Une mobilisation forte et une réussite à Stellenbosch permettront d'apporter une reconnaissance plus importante à ce sport en plein développement en France. 

Votre soutien permettra :

- De financer une partie des billets d'avion pour Stellenbosch 

- De financer les hébergements 

- De faire connaitre le sport et les équipes de France de Hockey Subaquatique :

en achetant les produits éditions limitées des équipes de France,vous devenez supporter des équipes de France et partagez les valeurs de la discipline. 


D'autres façons de nous aider

Peut-être que vous voulez en faire plus pour nous?

  • N'hésitez pas à partager la campagne sur vos réseaux sociaux et au sein de vos club de hockey/plongée/...
  • Vous connaissez des médias qui pourraient nous soutenir ?
  • Des entreprises qui pourraient devenir sponsors ou mécènes ?
Alors n'hésitez pas une minute de plus et envoyez nous un petit coucou ici: jefaisduhockeysubaquatique@gmail.com

On vous remercie et on se retrouve le 4 avril vêtu d'or? Pour vivre les mondiaux comme si vous y étiez, rejoignez-nous sur la page Facebook.

Equipes de France de hockey subaquatique ! 













Votre soutien est essentiel pour le Hockey subaquatique Français et les équipes de France.

En soutenant les équipes de France de hockey subaquatique , c'est tout le hockey subaquatique français que vous soutenez. Une mobilisation forte et une réussite à Stellenbosch permettront d'apporter une reconnaissance plus importante à ce sport en plein développement en France. 
Votre soutien permettra :
- De financer une partie des billets d'avion pour Stellenbosch 
- De financer les hébergements 
- De faire connaitre le sport et les équipes de France de Hockey Subaquatique : 
en achetant les produits éditions
limitées des équipes de France,vous devenez supporter des équipes de France
et partagez les valeurs de la discipline. 







D'autres façons de nous aider
Peut-être que vous voulez en faire plus pour nous?

N'hésitez pas à partager la campagne sur vos réseaux sociaux et au sein de vos club de hockey/plongée/...
Vous connaissez des médias qui pourraient nous soutenir ?
Des entreprises qui pourraient devenir sponsors ou mécènes ?

Alors n'hésitez pas une minute de plus et envoyez nous un petit coucou ici: jefaisduhockeysubaquatique@gmail.com

On vous remercie et on se retrouve le 4 avril vêtu d'or? Pour vivre les mondiaux comme si vous y étiez, rejoignez-nous sur la page Facebook.

story:
Please take a stand so others may not suffer the same fate

I am a ICU RN and Patient Advocate. The information that is being provided is regarding my position when I worked as a critical care RN in Florida. I left that position due to watching patients being neglected and abused. I left with a dozen letters of recommendation and was a great employee. 
 
While I was a staff nurse and periodically charge nurse, I witnessed unnecessary deaths that were covered up by Administration. I was told to keep quiet about the situations if I wanted to keep my job. I was told to falsify documentation about how often I was in a patient's room. My nurse manager actually sat my down in front of a computer when I didn't chart that I had been in a room with a patient every 15 minutes the previous day. She then told me to erase the previous day charting and chart it as she told me too. That patient was restrained and on a ventilator. I had been caring for another patient that had been vomiting blood for eight hours and was trying to save his life. When I finally got a moment to ask for help, she only told me that my charting better reflect that I had been in there every 15 minutes. I had begged for help and she told me to falsify documentation and walked away without offering any assistance.
 
The patient's mother overheard the nurse manager tell me to falsify documentation. This woman stated she would testify to that. Turns out she is a profiler for the FBI. That patient and I kept in touch with each other. He has since written a book about his experience. His book is titled, One In Forty Million by Jerry Johnson. He is a television producer and we are trying to find a way to make this message public. 
 
I kept in touch with several of the families. I took photos of the neglect and abuse. I contacted families regarding how their loved ones really died. I informed them of the neglect and abuse their loved ones suffered. I have contracts with the families to share the photos and their stories. I have ran the information and contracts by legal council. I am informed that I may release the information to the public. The families have urged me to make their stories public. 
 
I have certified e mails that I sent administration and information proving proving my nurse manager had told me nothing would change after I sent her the certified e mail stating that we had watched patients suffer and die due to understaffing. I spent over a year gathering evidence of the abuse, neglect, and Medicare fraud. I have patient's charts, billing records, photos, and other documentation proving the abuse and neglect of what you will see in the video. Families gave me the records and signed legal contracts stating that I may disclose any information needed. The families have encouraged me to make these and other stories public.
 
I had worked with an expert that is a medical fraud instructor contracted with the FBI. We have proven Medicare fraud. She told me that I am the Erin Brokovich of the medical field. 
 
I knew that patients needed to be protected and educated from this type of treatment. I wrote and published Patient Empowerment Guide and Journal (self published) to help guide patients through the hospital process and make health care professionals accountable. It explains everything a patient may encounter in the hospital from lab tests, scans, procedures, oxygenation, mechanical ventilation, blood products, therapies, nutrition, medication schedules, and about 750 medical terms that we use to speak over patient's level of understanding. I also provide a simple check mark and fill in the blank system to record all care provided or not provided. There is also a cancer journal and obstetrics journal. It is written in layman's terms at a middle school level. I also tell you to obtain you medical records as documentation is often falsified. Nurses are required to chart that they provide care of specific care at specific times, even if not performed. This cannot be done when you have several patients to care for.
 
I am currently writing my second book, Swept Under the Rug...Horror Stories from the Other Side of the Bed. The stories are true accounts of the neglect, abuse, and medical fraud I witnessed as an ICU nurse. Some of these patients are in the video. There are many other stories that are not in the video.
 
I am trying to get this story heard to protect patients. I have over 100 photos that reflect the real conditions of patients left in the ICU that have no loved one to stay in the room. The elderly are often neglected as they are often too afraid to say anything or are unable to speak out. I am willing to share the photos. I am trying to get this message out to protect the public. I've asked nurses all over the country and they all state the same conditions. I'm doing what I know to do to stop the needless suffering. I've traveled to CNN in Atlanta, Washington D.C., and contacted Congressman Braley. Congressman Braley once mentioned he wanted me to hold a Congressional hearing and bring patient safety awareness to the nation. That has not happened as of the present time. I spoke with a reporter from the New York Times and they said they had already done a story on this subject but would keep the information in mind. Now I am reaching out to the public in hopes to put an end to this abuse and neglect..and even fraud.
 
The first two photos in the video are of a woman neglected for weeks- she did not have Necrotizing faciitis. She was just neglected. You can see one the lower leg where the catheter ate into her flesh. I have her medical records to prove it. The third through seventh is of a woman that could not speak due no one cleaning her mouth for days- although they charted that they did provide oral care every two hours as required for days. She was not my patient but I cared for her anyway. When I cleaned her mouth which took 30 minutes she then grabbed my arm and said,"Thank you for caring about me." 
 
Other stories include a woman that came in with Pneumonia. She was lovely and had a great sense of humor. Due to Physical Therapy not ambulating this patient, she developed pressure ulcers on her buttocks and left heel. They took this woman's leg off in pieces. First her foot, then up to knee, and finally up to the hip. She died two days after the final amputation..on her birthday. This woman begged me not to let them take her leg. If she had received proper care, she would probably be alive today. 
 
There is a story of woman that had been dead for over nine minutes but her oxygen saturation was reading 100% due to faulty equipment. We performed a code blue only to realize that after reviewing information and realizing the alarm was not functioning.
 
Another family gave me about 100 photos of the abuse their wife and mother experienced. They also provided me with a daily journal of the neglect and suffering. She had numerous decubitis ulcers from laying in her own waste. Since I was there and knew the family and the conditions of understaffing, I know their stories they want me to share with you are true.
 
There are photos of ants on patients medical equipment on their bedside tray, drinking water from a patients false teeth cup, in the patient nutrition room. There are photos of dirty patient commode buckets in the patient nutrition room where we prepared patients food on occasion.
 
Nurses had no choice but to falsify their charting or lose their jobs. Nurses also had to sign a document that was already filled out stating that they received their breaks and lunches (and to the nurse they reported to while away) when in fact they did not receive any breaks at all. When it was given to you to sign most would say that they didn't receive any breaks at all. The charge nurse would say that she knew that but would be in trouble with adminisrtation if they didn't sign. We all cared about each other and didn't want her to get fired so everyone signed. This is not uncommon as hospitals try to put more demands on nurses by giving them more patients. This is to increase their profits. I hope you can point me in the right direction to get their stories heard. Thank you for your time. I believe that one person can be the catalyst that makes positive changes the world. As Mahatma Gandhi quoted: Be the change you want to see in the world. I live my life by this.
 
There is so much more to this story. That is why i am requesting your assistance. If you cannot help fund this project, I ask that you watch the video and help me make it go viral so this type of activity is stopped.
The video is on YouTube under the title: Profit Driven Healthcare in America
 
Realize the life and pain you may be saving may be yours someday.
 
Thank you for helping me lend a voice to those that are not able to speak for themselves.
 
God bless us all.

story:
Raised as a combat slave from birth, all Terin desires from the Arena is his death. His life, however, is worth more than he ever imagined possible.

With the Erelith Empire in control of both the Hand and the Heart of God, there exists but one force able to free the continent from the iron grip of the Emperor: The Eye of God.

The one who possesses the Eye can do anything. Entire Empires were born from its influence only to fall at its loss. But with great power comes a greater price, and unless Terin can find a way to prevent the relics from being reunited, he'll lose more than his life -- his soul will be destroyed.

You can find samples of my writing at the bottom. Don't drink anything while reading The Nightmare on Kiln Street. I've been informed that this short story should be classified as a weapon.

Everything started as a ‘What if…?’ question: What if ancient Rome, the Catholic Church, elements of Victorian Society, and a magical world got together for one wild night and had a child?

The Eye of God is that child.

What You Get (You can check out the pretty pictures below!)

 

$5: E-book(s)

Currently: A Digital Copy of The Eye of God

Added at $1,200: Digital Copies of The Between by Lisa Cohen and Picayune by John DeJordy

Added at $1,400 and $100 intervals until $2,000: A story by the following authors: Bliss Morgan, Brooke Johnson, Rachel Desilets, Charles Barouch, Avery Tingle, Peter Smalley, and Ayoub Khote!

 

$10: Photo-sized Art Prints and Stickers

Currently: All of the above and two photo-sized art prints featuring sumi-e paintings by RJ Blain and one set of Chris Howard stickers and a sticker of the Eye of God's cover art (with text).

Added at $1,300: A sticker of the cover art without text!

Saltwater Witch (And its Art) is by Chris Howard and used with his permission for promotional purposes.

$20: Print of the Cover Art

All of the above and a print of the cover art!

 

$40: Surprise Art Print

All of the above and an art print from one of RJ’s favorite artists.

 

$60: A sketch by RJ Blain

All of the above and a drawing by RJ Blain

 

$100: A Mention in the Dedications

Currently: All of the above and I will thank you in the dedications for your support!

Added at $1,200: Physical copies of Picayune by John DeJordy and Growing up Humming by Mike Spinak

(If you live outside of the US, please add a little extra for shipping. It costs $20 to ship to Australia, for example.)

 

$200: Moleskine Journal

All of the above and a moleskine journal signed by me with a quote written on the front page.

 

$250: Sumi-E Painting

All of the above and a sumi-e painting created by RJ Blain.

 

$300: A Short Story

All of the above and I will write a short story for you. It’ll be cute or humorous. Please message me with something that interests you so I can cater the story to you!

 

$500: Your Story in Calligraphy

All of the above and I will purchase a second moleskine journal for you. This will have your story handwritten in calligraphy.

  


Some important things to note: I'm footing the bill for the physical copies of the book and the shipping. If you're outside of the US, please add a little bit for shipping. (Picayune, for example, costs $20 to ship to Australia!) I've planned the budget for your goodies based off of US shipment fees.

 

Writers helping writers -- new milestones!


More information coming soon, including links to the authors, more about them, and where you can find their stuff. One story by each author will be added when their milestone is reached.

Another Update!!

 


These are two of the sketches I have earmarked for those who contribute $60+. I'm drawing a bunch. If you really one one of them and you've contributed $60+, just drop me a message to reserve a specific sketch.

 

 

Short Story - These are a few examples of my short stories:

The Nightmare on Kiln Street

A Short Story for Heather

A Short Story for Lisa

A Short Story for Brooke

 

 

This is where your contributions are going!

  • Developmental and proofing editor

This person (or people) is the one who catch the plot holes I miss, make certain I write an engaging book, and help me fix all of the little mistakes before the book is published. I am anticipating needing approximately $750 for this phase. I might be able to find cheaper editors, but I want the flexibility to pay someone a fair amount at the same time.

Progress Report: Developmental editor paid and work is in progress.

  • Cover Art

Covers sell books. Having a beautiful cover sells paperback and hardback books. I don’t want people putting stickers on the cover of my book to avoid having to look at its horrors. I’m not an artist. This isn’t something I can do on my own.

I am budgeting between 750-1,200 for the cover art as well as for prints and promotional material relating to the cover.

Progress Report: The cover is finished!!

  • Formatting

Nothing sucks more than spending money on a book that has terrible formatting on an e-reader. It’s an insult to the people buying my book. I anticipate needing $100-$200 for paying for someone to professionally format the novel.

Progress Report: Sign, sealed, paid-for and formatter is waiting for edits to be completed!

  • Promotional Material

Successfully launching a book is more than just slapping it up on Amazon and praying on bended knee. I would like to be able give away print copies of the book, prints of the cover art, potentially have bookmarks made, and other little bits of promotional material as a ‘thank you!’ to readers for supporting me and my novel.

 Progress Report: Chris Howard is helping me sort out having prints made and stickers and other really cool swag that I'll be sharing with him.... and with you folks too!

Progress Report: Funds ear-marked and set aside to cover all of the goodies from the perks.

All art prints, artwork, and stickers will be shipped in tubes and will require flattening. (To flatten, just lay something flat and heavy on top of them!) Books will be ordered from amazon and shipped individually to each consumer.

Moleskines will be shipped in a box or hand delivered if you live in my area.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute, there are plenty of ways that you can still help out! Share this project with your friends and family. Spread the word. Share the love of reading, no matter what genre.

About the Author

I have slaved away as a non-fiction ghost writer for the past ten years while working on fiction on the side. After a recent shift to fiction developmental editing, I've finally gotten the time I need to seriously pursue my first love: Science Fiction and Fantasy writing.

For samples of my writing, please check out the links above. Zero (linked below) is my brand-new web serial, and it is an experiment and challenge to myself. I wanted to see what I could do if I had to post a new scene once a week!

Zero: A Science Fiction Web Serial

story:
Stickers!! - Stretch Goal - $1,300


Stickers! Stickers for all $10+ perks! The stickers will be of the Storm Without End cover. Lucky contributors, at random, will also receive stickers of Chris Howard art and The Eye of God cover. (Limited numbers.)

 

The City of Clocks, A Second RJ Blain Novel -- Stretch Goal - $1,750

Read the first (and unedited) scene of The City of Clocks here!

All perk levels will have a copy of my upcoming novel, The City of Clocks, added. This novel is expected to release in first or second quarter of 2014. Date TBD.

About The City of Clocks:

When the Great Clock didn't ring in the new year, Aerrik knew something was wrong -- very wrong. Everything goes wrong all at once. He's separated from Mya, a fellow escapee from the Duke's usurpation of the Arasoran throne. His clock is broken, and without it, he faces the purge. Someone wants him dead or alive.

Worse still, his past comes back to haunt him. Without Aerrik, however, Arasanor is doomed to fall. But, will the kingdom be thrust into chaos from the Duke's reign, or will the very land itself turn on the struggling island and kill them all? 

The City of Clocks is a fantasy novel.

Note: $30+ perks will also receive a paperback version of the City of Clocks in addition to the digital copy, should this campaign reach the $1,750 stretch goal.

 

Storm Without End

Kalen’s throne is his saddle, his crown is the dirt on his brow, and his right to rule is sealed in the blood that stains his hand. Few know the truth about the one-armed Rift King, and he prefers it that way. When people get too close to him, they either betray him or die. The Rift he rules cares nothing for the weak. More often than not, even the strong fail to survive.

His abduction could easily destroy his home, his people, and start a hopeless and bloody war. There are many who desire his death, and few who hope for his survival. With peace in the Six Kingdoms quickly crumbling, it falls to him to try to stop the conflict that is swiftly taking the entire continent by storm.

But something even more terrifying than the machinations of men has returned to the lands:  The skreed. They haven’t been seen for a thousand years, and even the true power of the Rift King might not be enough to save his people — and the world — from destruction.

The dream of writing an epic...

Epic fantasy has always been the first love of my life. As a woman writing science fiction and fantasy, it isn't easy having a dream of writing a series in a world dominated by male authors. I've had bites on this story from agents and houses on this novel, but one thing has served as a deterrent:

I'm a woman writing in a male-dominated genre, and that makes me a hard sell.

I'm not the type to quit over something like that, so I'm making my stand. By the end of 2013, I want to release Storm Without End in print and as an e-book. I've already acquired the cover art for the novel.

I don't like talking about myself that much -- I like to think of myself as boring, although a little eccentric. Who wouldn't be, writing up tales of imaginary places and people for a living?

When I'm not making forays into fantasy worlds, I work as a developmental editor for fantasy and science fiction novelists.

I'm 30, and I'm proud to say that I'm right where I want to be in my life. I have a husband and four cats, and I get to pursue my love of reading and writing.

Here's my official biography for the curious:

RJ Blain suffers from a Moleskine journal obsession, a pen fixation, and a terrible tendency to pun without warning.

When she isn’t playing pretend, she likes to think she’s a cartographer and a sumi-e painter. In reality, she herds cats and a husband, and obeys the commands of Tsu Dhi, the great warrior fish.

In her spare time, she daydreams about being a spy. Should that fail, her contingency plan involves tying her best of enemies to spinning wheels and quoting James Bond villains until she is satisfied.

My first book, The Eye of God, debuted in late July! Learn more about this book here. With the fantastic help of the indiegogo community, one dream has already come true.

Now, I'm here again, asking for help to make another dream come true: Publishing my epic fantasy series, Requiem for the Rift King. 

The Nitty-Gritty

Publishing a book isn't easy. There is a lot that goes into making a novel happen. I acquired a piece of the puzzle already: The Cover Art.

My cover artist, Chris Howard, has created this beautiful cover for the novel:

Now, I need to get the funds to make the rest of it happen.

Here is a basic breakdown of what's needed:

  • Developmental, Copy, and Proofing Editorial (~$400)
  • Print & E-book Formatting ($300 - by Lisa Cohen)
  • Prints (Photo & Large sized) - (~$70)
  • Copyright Registration Fee - ($65)
  • Unexpected expenses - (~$65)
  • Shipping - (~100)

My shipping expenses are calculated at $7 per signed novel. It's a little less per unsigned novel. This should include the box and the shipping fee for the box. (Getting the estimate was a little difficult, but this is the closest I've come up with.) This is regular, slow mail in a standard box.

The copyright registration fee is for CA registration (where I live.)

I already have ISBNs for the books, as well as cover art, so these fees were not included.

If I make more than the base amount for the novel, the excess funds will go to paying for future book costs, including cover art, future registration fees, and so on.

What do you get?

This is the best part -- the perks!

Please note: Shipping address will be required on all perk levels. If the campaign does well, all perk levels will receive an envelope from me with some goodies in it, including leftover The Eye of God promo materials.

$5.00 - digital copy of the book, a digital copy of the cover art, and (if I can talk Chris Howard into it...) a copy of the wallpaper.

$10.00 - digital copy of the book, digital copy of the cover art, copy of the wallpaper, photo-sized print of the cover art.

$15 - Print copy of the book, digital copy of the book, digital copy of the cover art, wallpaper

$20 - Signed, printed copy of the book, digital copy of the book, digital copy of the cover art, and wallpaper.

$25 - Signed, printed copy of the book, digital copy of the book, digital copy of the cover art, wallpaper, 9x12 (or similar sized) print of the cover art & photo-sized print of the cover art.

$30 - Everything included in the $25 level, plus a digital copy of The Eye of God.

$50 - signed, print copy of Storm without End, signed, print copy of The Eye of God, print of The Eye of God's cover art (9x12 & photo), print of Storm without End's cover art (9x12 & photo), bookmark from The Eye of God, digital copies of both Storm Without End and The Eye of God

$100 - signed, print copy of Storm Without End and The Eye of God, 9x12 prints of both covers, photo-sized print of both covers, a bookmark from The Eye of God, e-book copies of both books, and a custom, hand drawn and inked map of the Storm Without End main continent.

Due to the amount of time it takes to complete a map, the maps will ship by December 15. The other goodies (including books) will be shipped when they're ready, which should be no later than November 15.

The ship date for The City of Clocks, should the campaign reach its stretch goal, will be the date of its release, which is TBD.

The map will be a completed recreation of this. (This is an older version of the original map.)

If you live outside of the US or Canada, there will be an addition charge for shipping -- contact me if you live abroad for an estimate on the real shipping costs. (The shipping fee will be the difference between the costs to ship to a US/CA address and your location. All you need to do is add the difference to your contribution and I'll handle the rest.)

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to help with this campaign, the easiest way is to tell your friends. Spreading the word helps people know this book is coming.

That's half the battle.

Thank you so very much for your support.

The Horrors of the Video...

My editor made me do it. Seriously, if I were good with video, I'd probably be an actress instead of a novelist. It's a miracle I figured out how to make the video happen at all.

Sidenote: I'm really 30, I promise. Just ignore the fact I look a lot younger than 30. Please. Oh please.

The City of Clocks, A Second RJ Blain Novel -- Stretch Goal - $1,750

story:
Does the world really need another song book? Yes!!!

Children in Waldorf schools around the world begin every day with singing. They sing throughout the day in main lesson, foreign language lessons, chorus, and just about every other time during the day. Every day is a symphony of song in a Waldorf school.

The Waldorf schools have a music curriculum wonderfully designed around the child's developing consciousness. It starts in first grade with pentatonic music. In the course of the next eight years, a student will sing farming songs, clapping songs, folk songs, number songs, graces, work songs, echo songs, call and response songs, rounds, songs with ostinato, harmony singing, songs in Latin and other languages, ballads, catches, sea shanties, madrigals, 3- and 4-part songs, and fugal canons. Wow, that's a lot of songs!

Until now, there hasn't been a book that brings the wealth and wonder of all these songs together. That's when I came up with the idea for The Waldorf Book of Songs. With over 300 songs for grades one to eight and arranged by grade, it'll be so easy to find that perfect song, whether you're a teacher, a parent, or a musician keen on tapping into this great collection for children of all ages. 

I've been working on The Waldorf Book of Songs for many years and now it’s time to ask for your help. The collection will be easy to navigate, with songs arranged by grade, and additional chapters for festivals, seasons, graces, and celebrations. They’ve all been chosen with the Waldorf curriculum in mind. You’ll recognize many of them as "Waldorf classics" right away. There really is a song for every age and every occasion.

The Waldorf Book of Songs will have over 300 songs, making it the largest and most complete Waldorf songbook ever published. It will be a treasure for any Waldorf teacher, parent or student, and it's my dream that it will find wide use and enjoyment outside the Waldorf schools as well. Everyone I tell about it seems to want a copy. 

Please help make my dream come true. 

-David Kennedy, Waldorf Today Books

 

 

Three points to consider from conversations with teachers:

1. Comprehensive selection of songs for all ages

Over the past few years I've talked with a lot of teachers and musicians. Many of them said they wanted a Waldorf song book that was comprehensive and covered all the grades from first to eighth. They also wanted more than just a song book. They longed for a book that delved into the pedagogy behind the songs, addressing questions like, "Why introduce round singing in fourth grade?" and "Why is it important to start singing simple minor tunes in third grade?"

2. Crowdsourced content – you can suggest songs

There's such a wealth of knowledge among teachers everywhere. I thought, "Why not open it up to everyone to contribute?" 

Every time I met with a class teacher or a music teacher, I came away with a musical gem. They all had cherished songs that they had gathered over the years. Whether it was a special arrangement of a standard folk song, a Greek song for 5th grade that she discovered on a trip to the Greek Isles, an 8th grade graduation song, or a farming song for 3rd grade, they were all incredible additions. 

Anyone from anywhere in the world will be able to send in their best songs for consideration. We'll have an online crowdsourcing portal open starting in September. There's gold out there, let's bring it together!

3. Audio files – anytime, anywhere

Instead of including CDs with the book, we decided to host all the audio files for The Waldorf Book of Songs online. CDs are fast becoming obsolete. You will be able to hear what the songs sound like. Stream them on our website. You can listen to them anytime, anywhere.

 

 

 

What would a typical chapter look like?

Take a look at the current song list for third grade and you'll see over 35 songs chosen for their natural musicality and suitability for the nine-year-old. The third-grader moves away from mood of the fifth and pentatonic songs to songs which are well-grounded and based on a diatonic scale.

Songs based on a diatonic scale are introduced for the first time in the third grade and help the child find firm ground with melodies that begin and end on a tonic. Simple tunes in a minor key can now be introduced and farming, craft, work and number songs lend a new feeling to music in the classroom.

Click here to see the current Third Grade song list

 

Highlights:

  • Over 300 songs for first through eighth grade, with chapters arranged by grade.
  • Chapters for festivals and yearly celebrations.
  • Songs for graces, transitions, and other times of day.
  • Background notes on many of the songs.
  • Pedagogical guidelines accompany each grade chapter – Mood of the Fifth, Pentatonic Music, Major and Minor in the Third Grade, Round Singing, Harmony and Part Singing, Canons, Ballads, Folk Music, Four-Part Compositions, etc.
  • Anyone can contribute songs for consideration via crowdsourcing.
  • Comprehensive index of song titles, first lines, and composers.
  • Hardcover first edition, printed in the US.

 

 

 

Your contributions will make all this possible

This project really needs your help. Music books are expensive to produce. Hundreds of songs, some of them in as many as five parts, need to be specially formatted in musical notation for print. We also need to produce hundreds of audio files for the book. The website needs to be expanded to accommodate all the audio files for the songs. And we need to print all those books. Your contributions will be used to help us with:

  • Editing the song content
  • Formatting the songs in musical notation for print
  • Recording the audio files
  • Fees to copyright holders for publication rights
  • Update our website to accommodate and host the audio files
  • Interior design of the book
  • Professional indexing by title, first line, and composer.
  • Book cover design
  • Printing costs for the first edition in hardcover

 

 

 

What you'll get for your contribution:

A special, limited edition hardcover copy of The Waldorf Book of Songs.

Your name in the book. We want to thank you big time. That's right, if you help out by supporting our campaign, you'll see your name right there in print with all the other contributors.

You'll know that you made this possible. Smiles.

 

Timeline:

March/April 2017: Indiegogo crowdfunding campaign

June/July 2017: Intitial book formatting

September 2017: Crowdsourcing portal opens. Songs can be submitted for consideration.

January 2018: Song lists for each grade are finalized.

February/March 2018: Songs formatted into musical notation for printing.

April/May 2018: Book is mocked up

May 2018: First proof is back, audio song files are recorded

June/July 2018: Final corrections

August/September 2018: Book is sent to printer, website is updated to host audio song files

October 2018: Books are ready for delivery, website hosts all the audio song files

Track record for success

David Kennedy is the founder and director of Waldorf Today and Waldorf Today Books and has been a Waldorf teacher for almost 30 years. He edits the Waldorf Today weekly newsletter, the world's largest newsletter for Waldorf education  with over 10,000 weekly subscribers.

David edited The Waldorf Book of Poetry, a very popular collection of over 425 poems and verses used in Waldorf schools.

He is also the founder and managing director of Filana Organic Beeswax Crayons, founded in 2014, which has quickly grown to become the world's largest artisanal crayon brand.

Risks & challenges

The risks and challenges are minimal for this project. We've been working on it behind the scenes for years. We already have a core of 225 great songs. And we're not afraid to ask for help if things gets hairy.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please consider the incredible, huge, irreplaceable impact you can have by:

TELLING PEOPLE ABOUT THIS CAMPAIGN. Noise attracts attention! Let your friends, family, and colleagues know about what we're doing. Email, social media, postcards, leave notes for them, knock on their doors, poke your head into their classrooms, smile, and tell them our story. Anything to get the word out.

When you see our posts on Facebook or Twitter over the next 40 days, hit that share button! It's now or never. 

Use the IndieGoGo tools to share too!!  They're good at what they do, and those little Facebook and Twitter and Email buttons are terribly easy to use.

Bueno.  Thank you all so much.  Let's get this party started.
