TELLING PEOPLE ABOUT THIS CAMPAIGN. Noise attracts attention! Let your friends, family, and colleagues know about what we're doing. Email, social media, postcards, leave notes for them, knock on their doors, poke your head into their classrooms, smile, and tell them our story. Anything to get the word out.
When you see our posts on Facebook or Twitter over the next 40 days, hit that share button! It's now or never. 
Use the IndieGoGo tools to share too!!  They're good at what they do, and those little Facebook and Twitter and Email buttons are terribly easy to use.
Bueno.  Thank you all so much.  Let's get this party started.

story:
The story of Coding Palz - Top 20 Amazon Bestseller in Children' Programming.

There are kids story books on science & math , reading & biology , even astronomy. Ever wondered why there aren't coding books for kids? We wondered too - that's why we decided to create a series of story books that teach kids coding. 

We are not talking middle school , high school kids. Coding Palz story books are for Preschoolers , Kindergartners through second graders. No kidding!

We have taken a lot of care in our coding books. Even the characters are named after programming concepts.

Json,Jazz & Ruby the robot are pals who live in Codezilla town. They solve challenges using their coding skills.Their interactions are written in a way that forms the basis of programming. Coding meets Story telling.


Our Plan

We want to create 20 story books with a total of 200 colorful, fun filled , educational pages. Each story book will cover a specific coding concept. We will cover topics like

  • Loops
  • IF condition
  • IF-Then-ELSE condition
  • Font
  • CSS
  • Database
  • Query
  • Events
  • Any Many More!

Why do we need your support

Given the audience we are targeting , illustration is very important.Your contribution will help us pay for Illustration. And of course you will get our lovely books.


Day to day adventures of the Coding Palz

Find how Json & Jazz code Ruby the robot for her dance competition.What code could have caused Ruby to swirl like a tornado!


Checkout how Mr.SHA the spray painting password lock secures Json's treasure box.

Our dream is to kid-i-fy coding. Coding is going to be literacy for the future generation. We want to provide affordable coding education to all kids. Your contribution will help us realize this dream.

Sometimes the coding experiment results in silly outcomes. Oops! Why is Json covered in a mountain of cookie packets. Could it be a rogue loop statement.

The Coding pals never give up. They are curious, they are fun to hangout with. Things may go wrong , but they always find a solution.

A porcupine with marshmallows? Now , that's a sweet solution.


What credibility do we have?

We have the first four stories on Amazon.

http://www.amazon.com/Coding-Kids-computer-Childrens-programming-ebook/dp/B00RAGLUH4

We have received rave reviews. We also rank within top 20 in Children Programming books category. We need your help to get the remaining 16 books out in the market.


Our Accolades
Our Volume 1 book bundle with 4 books was Number 1 in Children' Programming books genre a month after release when we ran a free promotion.

4 months later, the paid ranking is consistently within top 30 in Children' programming genre.


Featured In

Corporate Sponsors


Is this just yet another children' book?

No. Coding Palz books are way more than the run of the mill kids books. It is a creative book that combines coding with story telling. It is the only book in the market that teaches coding through stories to kids as young as 4.

It's not a bed time story book

It's not a use and throw story book

It's a book that will potentially get your child interested in coding. We want to see one of our little coders become the brain behind the next big App.

Coding Palz Team.

Saleena Alauddin ( Creative Head ) , Ayesha Hameed  ( Author ) & Md Ibrahim ( Director)

The story started when Ayesha , a former Microsoft Developer , made up coding stories for her daughter. When Saleena & Ibrahim heard the stories , they suggested getting it out as books.

Ayesha notes that "I have been drawn into coding. I love to code, I love to publish my apps, I love to dream & create.

My passion for coding landed me as a Software Developer in Microsoft Hyderabad, where i worked on the Operating System code. My journey as programmer took me places & here i am trying to kid-i-fy coding. 

 My dream is to get kids started on a fun filled coding journey without costing a ton of money."

FAQ

Do I need to know coding to read this book to my children?

-NO. The concepts have been simplified.If you dont have prior coding experience , you will pick up some coding concepts as well.

Will kids understand coding?

- YES! How many times have you heard of a 14 year old coming up with a killer app? Many many times right. Coding requires analytical ability , critical things & love for learning. 4-8 year olds are like sponges. They can absorb this.

Why story book? Why not App?

- Reading stories is a bonding moment for parent & the child. Children love stories. Parents love it when their children are learning. Bingo - Coding Palz books. 

We did not reach out to a Publisher to back us. 

Will YOU back us?

Your contribution is really appreciated.
Make "Coding Palz" happen.
Be a part of the coding journey - Contribute NOW

story:
What is This?

This is a campaign to fund my new book The Demon Star.  This is an epic fantasy adventure set in a world emerging from a dark age and about to face the greatest threat their civilization could imagine.

Above the kingdoms that lie on the shores of the sea of Vilmara, a new star has risen into the night.  A red star portending evil and death, an omen star.  After a long sojourn in the East, the sorcerer Israfel Al-Malik returns home and finds the lands in turmoil.  His old ally, the King of Hesperia, is dead under mysterious circumstances, and he seeks the truth.  Everywhere there are signs of plots and counterplots, signs of darkness working beneath the surface.

The king's granddaughter, Amarantha, is caught in a web of intrigue, hemmed in my power-hungry wizards who seek to use her to control the realm, and when she and Israfel join forces, they learn there is much more than that at stake.  An ancient evil - older than their civilization - is awake again.  From out of the dark past comes a nameless power.  One who has devoured entire empires to feed his hunger, and who will do so again unless he is stopped.

  • I'm an award-winning author trying to make a living doing what I love.
  • I run these campaigns to live so I can keep doing this.
  • By contributing you will keep me alive and fed, and help make self-publication more successful.

What We Need & What You Get

I need money, we all do.  A lot of self-published authors do so as a sideline, for me this is my livelihood.  Money lets me keep doing what I do.

  • The goal may sound like a lot, but after fees come out that leaves less than you would think to live on for about 3 months.
  • This time out, I will be providing many perks tied into my writing-advice blog, The Writer's Brain.  I will offer critiques of anything from stories up to full-length novels.
  • This will be different than our other campaigns, because the entire book will be done by the time the campaign is finished.  The ebooks will go out in a few weeks, and the print version will follow after within a month or so.  There will be very little waiting.  Even if I don't make goal, every perk will be fulfilled.

The Impact

Here's where I'm supposed to talk about how this project is important to the world.  Which probably seems silly, only I think this project - and others like it - are very important.  This is the cutting edge of the publishing business, and here I am trying to prove by example that a writer can make a living at what they want to do.  And I don't mean be one of the one-in-a-million longshots we all read about.  I mean being able to be good at what we do and with that carve out a career that can support their life.

  • Here we are dismantling the gatekeepers and the idea of the arts as a lottery.
  • We have run 10 campaigns to success before this one.
  • You help keep me alive, and I entertain you.  That's what we do here.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest fear I have this time out is that people will not be interested in work that is not adult.  I have put out 14 books (13 and a half?) of action/adventure erotica, and stepping away from that is scary.  I hope those who have followed us will keep doing so, and hopefully bring in new people as well.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can help spread the word, that is always fantastic!  Tweets, posts, reblogs, Facebooking - all of it helps us!
Also, think about heading over to The Writer's Brain and maybe even checking out my Patreon.

story:
Story of My Book

The Undergraduate Fiend is a manual for anyone who is currently recruiting for finance or even mildly interested in getting a job in finance. The book will provide direct answers to all questions that come up throughout your recruiting experience from high level strategy to nitty gritty concerns like resume fonts or Email formats.

My name is Chiwan Kim and I am the author of The Undergraduate Fiend. I wrote this book because I wanted to share the insights I learned when I recruited for finance with those interested in the industry.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover what you specifically have to do in order to land that dream job for you in finance. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for networking and all the different steps necessary for finance recruiting in you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you to realize what you have to do, why you have to do so, and how to effectively do so at every time point throughout the recruiting process.

In this book, you'll learn about all you need to know throughout the 1)Pre-recruiting phase, 2)Application phase, 3)Interviewing phase and the 4)Post-recruiting phase. A brief breakdown of each section includes:

Pre-recruiting phase - This section will cover the finance mindset and research necessary for meeting all the necessary mandates before devoting yourself to the recruiting process.

Application phase - This section will represent the bulk of the book as it covers all the details and tips on writing a resume, writing a cover letter, virtual networking, and in-person networking which are the most important building blocks of the recruiting process.

Interviewing Phase - This section will guide you for studying the specific area of interest within finance and how to fully prepare for your interviews.

Post-recruiting Phase - This section will provide more insight on the game plan after you land your dream job. This mainly consists of maintaining your network.

You will love this book if you need a game plan for landing your the finance job you always wanted or for those who are intimidated about the whole process.
The Undergraduate Fiend is a non-fiction book that speaks to students and any who are looking at recruiting for a job in the finance industry and breaking down the steps to achieve that goal.

 

The Book

The book is written in 4 Parts....

Part [1] contains the introduction + Chapters[“The Finance Mindset”,“The Research Phase”]. This section will introduce you to what the book will provide in depth and the “guidelines to figuring out the finance mindset you’ll need before you get started” and how to conduct the initial research before jumping into the process.
The whole recruiting process can be somewhat overwhelming which is why it is extremely important you have a good understanding of what you want to achieve and why. Once this part is finished, the steps to achieving it are all conveniently laid out for you to absorb and follow.

Part [2] contains Chapters [“Writing a Resume”, “Writing a Cover Letter”, “Virtual Networking”, “In-person Networking”]. This section will walk you through the fundamental strategy of each core requirement in finance recruiting along with relevant stories and examples. There are usually many questions that spawn during this phase, which is why there will be answers to questions that you may have even been too embarrassed to ask anyone. Some examples might be questions like “What word do I use for starting my bullet point on my resume?” or “Do I use hello or Dear when I write emails to professionals?”. You no longer have to get lost in the body of random opinions on forums and on the web, this book will clarify everything for you.

Part [3] contains Chapters [“Studying Your Area of Interest”, “Preparing for the Interview”]. This section will break down how to prepare for your interviews and how to conduct them. This is the last step remaining between you and the job so we want to make sure we are more than 100% prepared. Interviews are practicable and as long as you follow the steps, you will notice that you are actually comfortable in an interview setting. Interviews are also divided into video/phone interviews and in-person interviews which is why the book will provide separate guidelines for both versions.

Part [4] contains Chapters [After the Interview & (Hopefully) the Offer”]. This section will emphasize what remains to be important after you receive the offer. After you celebrate the amazing offer and once you come back to reality, there are still a few boxes needed to be checked to prepare yourself before actually starting the job. If you already made it to this part, you might as well keep up with the good work.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in February, 2020

The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)

The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter

Once I reach $4,000 of funding, excess proceeds will be used for further investments into the book and related business activities. The original plan was to publish the book in an audio-book  and hard cover version with extra proceeds but this initial plan did not seem to be high in demand leading to this change.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish

A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book

Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)

Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback

The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover

I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book

And more...

 

About the Author

Chiwan Kim is an incoming analyst at JP Morgan and a Duke University senior with a bachelor of science degree in Statistics and Economics with a finance concentration. JP Morgan is one of the oldest global financial services firm that has a presence in 100 markets leading in investment banking, financial services for consumers and small businesses, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.

He wrote this book to help those who are struggling or need advice for successfully recruiting for finance after looking back at his own experience. He analyzed the strategies, tips, dos and do-nots that he learned throughout the process and created a standardized solution that can be applicable for any reader who intends to start a career in finance.


Chiwan was born in Seoul, South Korea and he is a passionate hip-hop lover who likes to record music and write rap. He also served in the Korean military in 2015-2017 and is a big player as well as a big fan of Dota 2.

For more information you can connect with Chiwan at chiwankim2014@gmail.com and kchiwan on instagram or simply Chiwan Kim on Facebook and Linkedin.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #TheUndergraduateFiend and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

 

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Chiwan

story:
La Novela

Tres mujeres y otros tantos hombres se reúnen para celebrar la jubilación de una de ellas. Durante la sobremesa, esta hace una pregunta acerca de un suceso que transformó profundamente la relación entre el grupo e incluso cambió las existencias, truncándolas. Las demás personas se ven abocadas a un pasado de horror y angustia. Décadas más tarde de que ocurriera el hecho que marcó sus vidas, por primera vez se atreven a hablar de ello. Afloran sentimientos de culpa, temores no superados todavía, confesiones que se han mantenido férreamente silenciadas. El fantasma del pasado sobrevuela ominoso la escena, poniendo sal en la vieja herida. Un drama íntimo, duro, devastador, cargado de veracidad, narrado por seis personajes muy distintos entre sí, unidos por la amistad y el hilo del destino. Todo ello dentro de una atmósfera con cierta perspectiva feminista y denuncia social.

El Autor

Santa Cruz García Piqueras, nacido en Molina de Segura (Murcia, 1950). Ingeniero Técnico Químico. Está jubilado. Forma parte de «La Molineta Literaria», de la que es socio fundador. Ha obtenido varios premios literarios. En solitario, tiene publicados dos libros de relatos: El libro de los Tiempos y Las voces de Setenil. Algunos de sus cuentos aparecen en diversas antologías. Desde muy joven está vinculado al mundillo teatral. Su primer texto dramático se estrenó en 1966. En la actualidad, dirige Avesco Teatro, para el que escribe los textos que representa.

Una Muestra

«Teresa aparta el plato con los restos del postre y apoya los codos sobre la mesa. Mira, una a una, a las cinco personas que compartimos mesa con ella. En su rostro flota una sonrisa que tiene algo de melancólica. Imagino que va a hacer algún comentario amable. O quizá quiera darnos las gracias por haber acudido en bloque a su invitación. Se me antoja que se siente a gusto, que está complacida con nuestra compañía. Ante su gesto relajado, supongo que el resto razona de modo parecido. Teresa. Tierna como caricia de abuela, serena y profunda como lago de montaña, vitalista cual torrente recién nacido. Con la atención centrada en ella, aguardamos para ver qué desea compartir con su vieja peña. Ahogo un suspiro: sigo queriéndola como cuando éramos jóvenes.
          La veo inspirar aire profundamente. «Va a hacer una confidencia», pienso. Ha juntado las palmas de las manos ante el rostro y tamborilea entre sí, de forma casi imperceptible, las yemas de los dedos; los índices rozan sus labios. ¡Cuánto daría por besarlos de nuevo! Creo percibir una leve transición en su ánimo. Con esa voz reposada, algo ronca, que tiene, pregunta en un susurro:
         —¿Quién mató a don Julián la noche que intentó violarme?
         Sobresalto general. Aldabonazo de temor. Reaparece en mí el miedo, la angustia, el desconcierto. Es como si, de pronto, el tiempo dejase de fluir. Al oír la pregunta, los demás tenemos una mueca de perplejidad. Durante unos segundos interminables, nos miramos trastornados, incapaces de reaccionar.
         Nos vemos abocados al recuerdo».

El Objetivo

En esta campaña preventa nos hemos propuesto alcanzar el equivalente a 55 reservas, es decir, 880€, recibiendo quienes participen el libro en su casa sin gastos de envío (en España) antes de que entre en circulación... existiendo incluso la opción de reservar el libro con tu nombre en los agradecimientos por un poco más del precio de venta, como detalle exclusivo.

También, usando la opción BACK IT, podéis realizar donaciones a la edición; opción a través de la cual no se os pedirá dirección de envío porque no conlleva contraprestación de ningún tipo.

Media

Por otro lado, independientemente de que colaboréis realizando vuestra reserva o no, en ocasiones no se puede, sería una inestimable ayuda que os hicieseis eco de esta campaña a través del boca-oreja o por redes sociales... la Cultura, Distrito 93 y Santa Cruz García Piqueras os lo agradeceremos.

story:
Overview

Have you ever wanted to raise money for a charity, candidate, cause, or start up but been frozen in your tracks before you could even pick up the phone? Ever gotten in a fundraising rut because you just kept hearing No? Or do you just not think you can cut it as a fundraiser?

This book is about facing your fears of fundraising and the inspiration to get you started. I wrote it because there are too many of books about HOW to fund raise, but NONE about breaking down and dealing with the anxiety that is holding you back. My book The Fundraiser will publish in July 2020.
 

Story of My Book

Most conversations about fundraising focus on receipts, outreach, stewardship, and strategy. But very few answer the question how do you get the confidence to make that first ask?

The Fundraiser answers the big questions on everyone’s minds: What do I do when someone says no? Who do I even call? Or how do I keep fundraising?

My name is Meredith White and I am the author of The Fundraiser. I wrote this book because I want fundraising to be more approachable, less intimidating and more accessible to anyone who has the drive to do it.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how to conquer your fears surrounding fundraising and realize you have it in you to succeed. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for fundraising in you and your organization. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you keep on fundraising no matter what.

In this book, you'll learn how to face your fears and gain the confidence to fund raise through five parts:

  • What makes a good fundraiser and how I discovered fundraising
  • How our own fears of fundraising are easier to handle than you think
  • How the roadblocks you face are just part of the process
  • How to get started and understand you have what you need to be a fundraiser
  • Where to go from here and finding fundraising efficacy

You will love this book if you want to start fundraising now or need that extra push!

The Fundraiser is a non-fiction book that speaks to fundraising novices and anyone afraid of talking to strangers. It's for those who are looking to level up and make that big (or even small) fundraising ask for the first time.

 

The Book - The Fundraiser
The book is written in 5 Parts....

Part 1 contains the introduction + additional chapters. You’ll learn about what makes a good fundraiser and I how I discovered fundraising myself. Stories include how some initial setbacks were actually a good thing for my career and how introverts can fund raise too.

Part 2 contains Chapters 3-5. You’ll learn about all the biggest fears of fundraising, how I faced them and why my dad swears by Snickers and a Pepsi.

Part 3 contains Chapters 6-7. We’ll dive in to the the roadblocks you we all face along the way and how to finally get started. Even a bit about how risks are a good thing.

Part 4 contains Chapters 8-9. You’ll learn about self awareness and how you can be an expert goal setter like Beyonce.

Part 5 contains Chapters 10-11. We'll finish with an easy to follow fundraising pyramid, next steps and a friendly reminder that you are in fact a fundraiser.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get
This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July, 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this summer!


When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.

  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more.....

 

About the Author

Meredith White is a veteran political fundraiser with over a decade of experience raising funds across the political spectrum. From PACs, Senators and presidential campaigns to Capitol Hill and Corporate suites, Meredith brings her unique expertise to light on how she’s faced her fundraising fears and learned from the best.

I wrote this book so you don’t have to be afraid of making that first fundraising ask ever again. It’s for people who think fundraising is only for the fearless or extroverts. I wrote this book because over and over again I heard the same strategies for fundraising and yet no one was addressing all the junk you have to sort through with yourself before you even make that first pitch or donor call.

Outside of fundraising I’m an avid traveler, friend maker, music lover, and CrossFit enthusiast. I am always starting a new needlepoint project, recently eloped in Iceland, swear by public transit, and can thrift shop with the best of them. Plus I finally figured out how to make the perfect homemade pizza.

For more information you can connect with Meredith at meredithtwhite@gmail.com and @meredithtwhite on Instagram and Twitter.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #thefundraiserbook or #youareafundraiser and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.


Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,

Meredith

story:
My Story

Who: I'm a third-year journalism student at Ball State University who specializes in feature writing.


What: I'm trying to raise money to participate in a university-approved program ("BSU at the Games") that will allow myself, over 30 other journalism students and a few faculty members to cover the London 2012 Summer Olympics. We do not have event passes to the games, but we will be traveling to London to produce content surrounding the games (news and feature stories, info-graphics and interactives, video coverage, photo essays and more). I will be a part of the feature-writing team, and I will write articles and create multimedia stories about the Olympic athletes, their experiences, their families, the atmosphere of London and more. Prior to this three-week program, I will be studying abroad in Worcester, England for six weeks, making a total of nine weeks abroad.


Where: London and Worcester, England


When: June 13 - July 27 (Worcester study abroad program)

July 27 - August 14 (BSU at the Games program)


How: With your help! Unfortunately, traveling to one of the most popular travel destinations during the single most important international sporting event is quite costly. This is an experience I cannot duplicate, and my participation in this program would be a dream come true.


Credibility

My online portfolio: ekthompson.com

Personal Twitter account (I'll be tweeting updates while abroad over the summer): @ekthompson2410

BSU at the Games Twitter account: @bsuatthegames

BSU at the Games website: coming soon


The Impact

I haven't had much travel experience because of financial limitations. I did, however, have the opportunity to travel abroad to Ireland with an Honors class over spring break 2011. This new opportunity to travel to London and Worcester will shape my career-related experience (the opportunity to cover the Olympics supersedes any opportunities I would have to do a summer internship in the States) and my education (I'll be taking classes taught by British faculty in Worcester for six weeks).


I also hope to use my experience to encourage other students with financial constraints to find ways to travel abroad. Even spending just a week in Ireland broadened my world-view and positively altered my perceptions. I believe that everyone should try to take advantage of travel opportunities, so in addition to the content I create for BSU at the Games while in England, I will be writing a weekly blog for the Ball State student-run, award-winning newspaper, The Daily News (www.bsudailynews.com). I hope that by sharing my experiences through this blog, I will be able to show others that opportunities like this are within reach.


What I Need & What You Get

BSU at the Games summer program - 2,478.25 (includes airfare, lodging, program support)

Worcester summer study abroad program - 6,132.00 (includes lodging and meals, cultural visits, program support)

Tuition - $1700

Total - 10,310.25


I have already paid $500-deposits for both programs with my savings, and I have applied for scholarships in attempt to cover as much of the costs as possible. However, I cannot reach this total goal without the support of patrons like yourself. Whatever I cannot raise through fundraising efforts and through scholarships and grants, I will have to try to pay out-of-pocket (through loans).


What do you get for helping out with my cause? See the perks on the sidebar.


Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! The more exposure my fundraising efforts get, the closer I will get to reaching my goal. Any other ideas for fundraising are welcome. Thank you for your time and contributions!

story:
What’s the project

As a Body-Centered Psychotherapist, Therapeutic Bodywork Practitioner, Body Mind Centering® Practitioner, and teacher for over 30 years, I have seen so many women beautifully caring for others, but not prioritizing their own care. I was able to support my clients to care for themselves and live more joyfully, and I believed that a book using my heart centered, body-mind approach would be useful to many women. 

My goal is to publish a book that provides the support, encouragement and practical tools to help women enjoy sustainable, nurturing self-care. Over many years I have developed my ideas, written this 300-page book on self-care expressly for women. Now I need your help to get The Heart of Self-Care professionally designed, published in print and e-book formats, and marketed to a broad audience. 

About this book

 This easy to read, all-embracing book offers an empowering, practical, mindful, body-centered approach to self- care with the wisdom of the heart as the model. 

This book is about genuine self-care, which is absolutely not self-improvement. It is not about “fixing” the things that are “wrong” with you, nor is it about trying to become perfect according to some external criteria. No, the heart of self-care is about accepting, valuing and loving yourself exactly as you are. It is about being kind and compassionate towards yourself, and about treating yourself gently and with respect.

What will your dollars cover? 

Your support will cover the costs of producing a self-published first run of the book, and you can be one of the first readers!!   The project costs include: cover and book design, page layout, project management, printing, creating an E book, proofreading, photography and beginning a marketing  and distribution campaign. 

The book has been professionally edited. I have a book designer and other professionals ready to go - what I need is your help now!!

More About the Book  

Here's a quote from the introduction of The Heart of Self-Care…A Women’s Guide to Joyful Living and Well-Being.  “You may wonder: Do I really need all this tending and care? Yes!  That's why it's so important to learn to listen to your body and to your heart, which this book will guide you to do.

 So, with this book, I invite you into the very heart of your own self-care. I ask you now to imagine caring for yourself, prioritizing your own needs and tending to them, just as your heart does. Can you imagine: having a nourishing and caring relationship with yourself and your body; savoring all the joy and pleasure possible in your life; enjoying physical activity, having a more comfortable, relaxed relationship with food, feeling your body as a source of wisdom, comfort and pleasure, and taking time for yourself, time to be, time to dream?”

Does this book speak to you or a loved one?

Maybe you feel that this book would benefit you. Maybe you feel that this book would encourage a woman you love to be kinder to herself…your good friend, your partner or wife, sister, mother, grandmother, or aunt.

Maybe you are a bodyworker, massage therapist or psychotherapist who have wished that there was a book like this now to share with your clients with their clients.

Become part of a community to support yourself and/or the women in your life whom you love to experience more well-being and joy, help get this book published.  

About Linda Tumbarello

Linda has specialized in body-mind healing, and working with trauma. Utilizing a wide range of physical and psychological healing tools, Linda’s training and credentials include: Licensed Mental Health Counselor, Certified Body Mind Centering® Practitioner and Teacher, and Certified Dynamic Embodiment Practitioner.

Linda has developed a powerful way of working with the body and mind using hands-on work, body-centered psychotherapy and movement. She has worked with many people wanting to heal from injuries, illness, accidents, body image issues, physical and emotional trauma, childhood abuse, and those who want to enjoy moving and staying vital, especially as they grow older.

Her therapeutic work supports each person to feel whole, regardless of physical injuries or illness, emotional distress, or difficult/traumatic life experiences. 

Linda was a faculty member in The School for Body-Mind Centering® Practitioner Training Program for over 25 years. For over 20 years, Linda taught in the Dynamic Embodiment Training Program in New York City with Dr. Martha Eddy. Linda developed and taught many continuing education workshops for bodyworkers and massage therapists. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, but you'd like to support the project:

    •  Share this project link on your social media page, or email it to friends and family. You can use the Indiegogo share tools (upper left) right now.

    •    Got resources and connections?  If you know someone who can help support or promote this campaign, please connect me!

What happens after we hit our crowdfunding goal ? 

Stretch goals will include: expanding the marketing campaign and building a platform to reach as many women as possible to increase the launch marketing including: graphic design, audio and video content, and social media, free talks and workshops, and book discounts for those who could benefit from the book, and who cannot afford the cost.

story:
Short Summary

For the past 30 years my husband Dan and I have kept copious notes with correlative evidence of many of the causes of my seizures and compiled them into this book, "Seizure Triggers." 

Do you or someone you know suffer with seizures? Did you know that 1 in 100 Americans will have a seizure at some point in their lifetime? And that the majority will likely never know the cause?  Neurotoxins, environmental toxins, food additives, dyes, potent smells; could these be seizure triggers? They are for me. In this book, I share my seizure triggers that my neurologists over the years have never even asked me or told me about. I share my personal discovered triggers as well as others that people have shared with us. I offer ideas and ways on how to avoid these triggers and decrease the possibility of actually having a seizure. Do these triggers affect each of us the same way? No. Could knowing about them possibly help avoid having a seizure? Yes.​

I have olfactory (smell) triggered seizures, which is a type of epilepsy called "reflex epilepsy". It is not common, but maybe because it is not well known. According to a recent study, olfactory function in epilepsy has not been thoroughly researched. People are having more seizures than ever before. Why? Because we live in a toxic world. Environmental toxins invade our living environments, our homes, our food, our everyday lives...yet, so many are unaware of what they can do to the brain. 

Join us in the fight against epilepsy to uncover these previously overlooked seizure triggers.

We are sharing what we have discovered because people need to know.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We have had one basic overview done of the initial manuscript. Next, we need to move forward with copy editing. The goal amount is set at $5,000.00 which will go toward the following:

  • Graphic design - Cover design and logo; which some of you may be helping with. The current cover is a mock-up placeholder only. 
  • Layout design - Physical copy and E-book formats.
  • Editing - Copy editing.
  • Marketing - Launch and promotional efforts.
  • Publishing - Revision and publication of my manuscript.

 

*What Do You Get?  MY BOOK! (and a little more… :)

PERKS:

  1. The E-book "Seizure Triggers"

  2. The book "Seizure Triggers"
  3. A "What Elephant?" T-shirt   *Check out "About our Shirts" below
  4. The book and a T-shirt
  5. Two (2) books
  6. The book *PLUS including additional features:
  • Helping me decide on a cover design/logo for my book
  • A signed copy of my book (one)
  • A "What Elephant?" T-shirt
  • Your name appearing in the "Special Recognition" section of my book
  • Share your personal triggers in my book (Author discretion)

      7. The Advocate Package:

  • Helping me decide on a cover design/logo for my book
  • Twenty signed copies of my book (20)
  • A "What Elephant?" T-shirt
  • Your name appearing as an Advocate in the "Special Recognition" section of my book
  • Share your personal triggers in my book (Author discretion)

 

* You may prefer to simply donate and help spread epilepsy awareness. If so, hit the “Back It”  tab under the goal amount at the top right of the page and you can enter any donation amount you would like.

 

ABOUT OUR SHIRTS:

With all of our T-shirts, you will be able to select the style/size/color: 

*Toddler 2T-5T (grey only)

* Youth S-XL (grey only)

* Adult Unisex XS-XL (purple or grey)

*Toddler/Youth T-shirt (grey only)


 

*Unisex Adult - purple T-shirt

 

*Unisex Adult - grey T-shirt

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

*T-shirts are non-refundable/non-exchangeable. Maybe give it as a gift if it does not fit. :)

At some point in the future, I will offer more opportunities for T-shirt purchases. Thank you so much for your understanding! #WhatElephant? #SeizureTriggers

 

The Impact

One in 26 people will develop epilepsy and 10% of Americans will have at least 1 seizure in their lifetime. 65 million people worldwide have epilepsy, making it one of the most common neurological disease globally. Epilepsy is more than twice as common in the U.S. as cerebral palsy, muscular dystrophy, multiple sclerosis, and cystic fibrosis combined.

Spreading epilepsy awareness and increasing the knowledge of seizure triggers is our goal.

 

Risks & Challenges

Those of us with epilepsy deal with risks and challenges every day.

The risks and challenges of this campaign is my getting the book to you. To reduce this challenge, I have included free shipping and handling within the United States. 

Those of us fighting epilepsy know all too well that there may be a bad day, a seizure, a migraine; this challenge is mitigated by sheer determination. We will get his book out to each and every backer. We believe in the cause.

 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    You can help in other ways.

    Please share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn.  Please include #SeizureTriggers and #WhatElephant? and tag me as well. 

    This venture includes you! It's about what we can do together. Let's help make a difference for those fighting epilepsy...one less seizure at a time.

    Thank you so much for your support,

    ~Judi Bruns (and of course Dan)

story:
Story of my book

My name is Stein Broeder and I am the author of The Business of Trust: How Trust Creates Business Value Through Employee and Customer Experience. I wrote this book because I wanted to explore how trust really works in the business world. I set out to learn how organizations and business leaders can drive real business impact by optimizing their employee and customer experience to earn and build trust. I began writing this book with a pre-pandemic mindset, but as we have progressed through this pandemic I have come to realize now, more than ever, trust is what is going to separate those who realize success from both a leadership and business standpoint.

My hope is that by reading this book you will discover how trust really works and how employee and customer experiences are the best pathways to earning and building trust. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for driving business impact in you. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you start thinking about how to apply trust drivers to your business or organization.

In this book, you'll read about the characteristics of trust and why trust is so important in business. You will learn about:

  • The speed of trust: When there is trust, things happen faster. Trust creates momentum and enables progress.
  • The economics of trust: When trust goes up, speed goes up and cost goes down.
  • The trust bottom line: Trust is the most valuable asset of any organization

 

You will love this book if you are interested in understanding why trust matters in the business world.

The Business of Trust is a non-fiction book that speaks to business leaders who want to build an organization that is founded in trust. 

 

The book - The Business of Trust

The book is written in 5 parts...

Part 1 contains the introduction and chapters 1-3. In this section, you will discover the reasons why I’ve embarked on this journey to learn more about trust and what exactly sparked my curiosity. You will find out why trust is fundamental to the success of any leader and business while also learning how to inspire client obsession in your team through relentless discovery, meaningful connection and earning trust.

Part 2 contains Chapters 4-7. In this section, you will discover why trust is said to work wonders. Hint: speed. Learn how trust translates into economic terms so that you can quantify the impact building (or breaking) trust really has.

Part 3 contains Chapters 8-10. In this section, you will learn the best way to build and earn the trust that is vital to the success of your business or organization. Trust is the currency and experiences are the transactions through which value is earned and built. Find out why customer experience is a superpower and the reasons why you need to invest in the employee experience. Hot take: employees are your most important customers.

Part 4 contains Chapters 11-13. What’s the best way to learn? From history. Explore how the most effective leaders have built trust and how companies today are painstakingly working to build trust moment by moment. Don’t forget that trust can be lost too! Fast. Trust is built in drops and lost in buckets.

Part 5 contains Chapters 14-17. This is when you will be introduced to the 3 trust-drivers that matter most and learn how you can apply them to your employee and customer experiences to start driving real business impact.

 

What I need & what you'll get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor - I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2020.
  • The cover design of my book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, eBook formats)
  • The copyediting for my book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter.

 

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • A signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your name will appear in a special acknowledgements section of my book (“with special thanks to”)
  • Early access to the introduction of my book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover

 

About the author

Stein Broeder is a marketing communications professional with 18+ years of experience. He is currently the lead of the digital events division for Microsoft Advertising. He has a BA in English/Creative Writing and an MA in Communication from the University of Washington where he authored “Thinking About Spokespersons: a Study Comparing Celebrity and Non-Celebrity Endorsers.” He began his career in the healthcare vertical working at Publicis and then helped co-found White Space Healthcare Marketing, a healthcare marketing agency, in the Seattle area. 

Stein became passionate about the concept of trust while helping to formulate client obsessive behaviors for Microsoft’s Advertising division. He realized the key to building trust was through experience. In his most recent book, he wanted to find out the the reasons why and what others had learned so he could then share that knowledge in the hopes of inspiring others.

Outside of work, Stein enjoys telling stories, drawing pictures and playing make-believe (with his kiddos). He lives in the foothills of Snoqualmie, Washington with his wife, two kids and dog.

You can connect with Stein on Twitter (@steinbroeder) or on LinkedIn (linkedin.com/in/steinbroeder).

 

Risks & challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other ways you can help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #TheBusinessofTrust and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or direct message on social media.

 

Thank you for your support.

Stein Broeder

You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship. Other ways you can helpSome people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #TheBusinessofTrust and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my pre-sale campaign page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or direct message on social media.
 Thank you for your support.Stein Broeder

story:
The Pitch:

In 1977, NASA launched the Voyager space probe, which carries a golden disc of recorded information about life on planet Earth, in case it’s ever found by intelligent life “out there.” In much the same way, BBC America is broadcasting a signal across the Pond, telling Americans about life in the UK. The transmission has been received by two intelligent life forms—husband and wife team Lisa Bonnice and Jeff Swiney—who are curious to see how accurately they are interpreting that signal, and they intend to report their findings back to you.

They have many questions:

  • Does every town has a castle nearby?
  • How many Doctor Who museums are there?
  • What exactly is a Jammie Dodger?
  • Is Blackpool really like Las Vegas? 
  • Which town has the best fish 'n' chips?
  • How on earth is the Welsh language pronounced?
  • And, doesn’t it feel wrong to drive on that side of the road?


Lisa and Jeff intend to find the answers to these questions, and more, and report back with their findings in Blackpool Calling--a series of blogs, vlogs and an eventual book. Lisa plans to take a photo of the sunset over the Irish Sea, from the top of the Blackpool Tower, as a symbolic statement of “Transmission received and understood.” Blackpool called, and she and Jeff answered. They will report back to BBC America fans what it’s like, across the Pond, and broadcast a signal of their own, from the Blackpool Tower itself.


The "Third Person" introduction:

Jeff and Lisa Swiney (“Bonnice” is Lisa’s pen name and Swiney is pronounced “Sweeney”) have been a couple for 24 years. They met at Snickerz Comedy Bar, when both were touring standup comedians, working with such acts as Tim Allen, Jeff Foxworthy and Drew Carey. For a while, they combined forces as comedy team Sweeney & Sweeney, and hosted a show called Sweeney and Sweeney’s Hollywood Revue, a variety show designed for radio. The show was taped at the Ice House in Pasadena, CA. Since then, they’ve settled into a more ordinary life, but they never lost their taste for humor, especially when combined with fun and quirky road trips.

Lisa is an MSNBC.com Excellence Award-winning writer. She appeared in 2013 on the ID network’s program Catch My Killer, in an interview about her best-selling book, Fear of Our Father. Her radio show, Shape Shifting with Lisa Bonnice, is based on her first book, Shape Shifting—reclaiming your perfect body, and airs on BlogTalkRadio. She is working on a follow-up to Shape Shifting, and will challenge herself to stay fit on the road, after losing 65 pounds.

Jeff, like Lisa, was a nationally touring stand-up comic in the 80s and 90s. He has dedicated his life to pursuing a Jimmy Buffet lifestyle (barefoot and on the beach, perhaps with a margarita in hand). Whether living on the beach in a tent, or in a nudist resort in Florida, he’s an avid life spectator with a wry sense of the absurd.

Lisa has been travel-blogging since 2010, when she and her friend Vicci went on a trip they called Epiphany Quest. Vicci had just divorced and needed to clear her head, so the two women drove from Texas to the Pacific Coast Highway, where they risked (almost) certain death driving up PCH toward San Francisco and Mount Shasta. On the way home, they stopped in Lake Tahoe, Salt Lake City, Denver and Roswell, where they toured the Roswell alien crash museum.

That same summer, she and Jeff went on their own Epiphany Quest across the eastern section of the United States. Lisa blogged the trip and reported on their adventures of driving a car that broke down more often than it ran, sipping moonshine in the hills of Kentucky, and finding salvation in the face of disaster (start reading here). Humorous and touching, this trip let Jeff and Lisa know that this is what they need to be doing with their lives: telling road stories.

Their next trip was to Washington DC to blog about Jon Stewart and Stephen Colbert’s Rally to Restore Sanity and/or Fear. Since then, they haven’t done any major traveling because life took them elsewhere for a while, but they’re now planning a 12-week trek across the UK, beginning in the mystical southwest, in search of Arthurian legends and the beauty of Devon, up into Wales, to see Doctor Who’s Cardiff and some of Jeff’s ancestral sites, through Liverpool to check out some Beatles history, up to Scotland to track down some of Lisa’s ancestors (including royalty!), sampling the UK’s tastiest local food and most beautiful country walks, and ending with a sunset snapshot over the Irish Sea from the top of Blackpool Tower. Lisa is already blogging about the trip at http://lisabonnice.wordpress.com/2013/08/15/next-on-my-bucket-list-blackpool-england/

Lisa will be posting blogs and photos from the road. She’ll be using high-tech gadgets to do so, as she has learned from previous travel blog efforts how important good tech is to a trip like this. She’ll be learning how to use a smart phone, travel apps, new-fangled cameras and a travel-friendly computer to blog the trip, and writing “how-to” blogs for tech newbies as she learns. She has a keen eye for what makes for an odd or quirky story. She’s has an innate sense of direction and rarely gets lost. Of the two, Lisa is the trip navigator.

Jeff, on the other hand, barely knows how to turn on a computer. He can play video games and surf the web, but this technology will leave him flummoxed.  He can’t take a non-blurry photo to save his life and texting on his cell phone is not on his list of “Things Jeff Enjoys”— however, he’s fun-loving, friendly, adventurous, and keeps Lisa from being too serious. Of the two, Jeff is the clown.


Lisa's "first person" pitch to you

  • My name is Lisa Bonnice, and I'm an author/radio show host. I'm working on a new writing project and need to do a lot of research in the United Kingdom. (Read my blog here, for more information.) While I'm there, on this "Bucket List" trip, I intend to blog about technology and travel, interview British show biz folks (the ones we see on BBC America), write reviews about food and lodging, explore ancestral sites and walk across the countryside.

  • I have a confirmed interview scheduled with Sarah Parish, the actress who played the female lead in Blackpool. She has also been on Doctor Who and numerous other BBC programs. She can currently be seen on BBC America, on Saturday nights, on their program Atlantis. I have query letters sent out to numerous other British actors and am confident that I will land interviews with several.

  • When I started planning this trip, the costs were covered, but the project that was going to pay for it fell through. I still need to do this, but funding has become an issue. Because I am doing something out of the ordinary, it's hard to pay for a project like this unless you're creative. So, I'm using this win-win method of raising money. You help me, I help you.

  • Your help will allow me to not only make a Bucket List event occur, I'll finally be able to get this book series written, as a result of the research I'll be doing. Plus, we'll all learn a LOT about the world, new technology and how to use it. And along the way, you'll find out who has the best Fish 'n' Chips in Great Britain!

What I Need & What You Get

  • I am intending to raise at least $25,000 to pay for airfare and expenses for three months overseas (and continuing to pay my bills at home). Some of that money is to be raised through crowdfunding, some is through sponsorships,and some is just saving my pennies.

  • I'm offering signed copies of all of my books, including one copy of my best-seller Fear of Our Father, signed by both me and my co-author Stacey M. Kananen.

  • I'm looking for sponsors who are willing to pay for any of the following:

    1. Cell phones and service;
    2. Travel friendly computers;
    3. Airfare;
    4. Lodging;
    5. Car rental and other transportation.


    Sponsors will be mentioned generously on blogs, vlogs, my radio show, and with logo/product placement. Sponsors for cell phones, for example, will be mentioned every time we talk or write about their use, i.e., if I'm writing about learning how to use the new phone, or discovering a trick that it can do, or if I'm posting a blog about being able to use the phone to find a restaurant or something. This type of thing will occur at least once a week.*

    Cross-promotion is also a possibility! Nothing like a win-win to help everyone ... well ... win!

  • Hans Decoz is possibly the best-known Numerologist in the world. His software program is the one used by Tarot.com. I own a licensed version of the same software and can generate identical reports.

    A Personality Report, Diamond Report and a One-Year Forecast is valued at $45.
    (I'm asking $30)

    A Compatibility Report is valued at $110.
    (I'm asking $75)

    All I need is your full name at birth, the name you use now (how do you introduce yourself to people?) and your birthdate. I'll also need your email address to send the .pdf file to you.

  • If I don't reach the entire goal, we're still going on the trip. It's just going to be a lot more Spartan than I'd like.

The Impact

  • Bare minimum, I'll be able to write a series of metaphysical-comedy novels that are trying to push their way out of my brain. Also, I'll be telling fun stories on my blog about the trip, and showing you the world--including Doctor Who museums and shooting locations. If you're a fan of BBC America, like I am, you'll enjoy this a lot.

  • The world is getting smaller and smaller. In many ways, we feel closer to each other, thanks to the Internet, but in other ways we feel isolated and at odds. Part of this plan is to show that everyday life is just that, no matter where you live.

  • I have a successful track record in connecting people. I've written four books, one of which is a best-seller and another includes a foreword by Neale Donald Walsch. I also host a show on BlogTalkRadio that helps people to figure out how to fix what's broken in their lives and become happier and healthier while they do it.

  • Check out my site at http://www.lisabonnice.com for more information.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • I'd love it if you'd tell your friends about my books and radio show. Aside from Indiegogo, I'm also raising money other ways, like selling low-cost numerology reports and books. Every penny counts!

  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools. Please and thank you. :-D

  • Before you go, be sure to click that "Contribute Now" button.
    Go ahead. You know you want to.


*************************************************

* While I'm not a fan of labels, I consider myself to be sort of a New Agey, Liberterianish, Feminist kind of person, who doesn't take herself too seriously. I reserve the right to turn down sponsorship from any person, entity, company, etc. with whose politics/policies/raison d'etre I am uncomfortable. Wouldn't you? ;-)

story: Since 2005 Rising Sun Press has published the newsletters of the New Afrikan Black Panther Party Prison Chapter, The White Panther Organization and other groups within the United Panther Movement. These newsletters have provided an important lifeline to the cadre and supporters of the United Panther Movement, keeping them informed and educated from the perspective of the contemporary Panther movement which is continuing the legacy of the original Black Panther Party founded by Huey P. Newton in 1966 in Oakland California. These newsletters have been provided for free to prisoners all across the USA.  Demand was so great that we had to suspend publication while we scraped together funds to replace worn out equipment. We still need to raise operating funds to resume publication.

story:
The A4 Prints 

 You can view all 6 of the A4 prints on our Facebook page by clicking here.

Who are we? 

Annmarie Devlin AKA DevoArt will be illustrating the fanzine & each one of the submissions used will be accompanied by a personalised illustration. Whether that be a design accompanying your poem or a comic strip complementing a short story, the content of this fanzine will be allot more than just words on the page.

Check out some of her work here. 

Mick Clocherty will be in charge of articles. Mick has just finished his first book "The Psychedelic Dinosaur Bible" the first chapter of which will be available in Issue No.1
You can check out the page he runs "Dear Telly" here. 
Some of his writing here and here.

Stephen O'Toole studied creative writing at The University of Glasgow class of 2011.  He will be in charge of the short fiction section. 
You can check one of his short stories here. 

Sam Small is a poet from Glasgow.
Check out some of his work here.

Graham Patrick is a self-employed graphic designer.He will be formatting the fanzine. He also formats "Wheel Scene" a monthly rollerblading magazine, you can check that out here. 


Money, Money, Money and why we need it. 

The more money we raise for this fanzine the better we will be able to make it 

  • We can reach our goal of 1000 copies a month
  • We can print it in colour 
  • We can have it distributed in Edinburgh as well as Glasgow 
  • We can set up a website to make it available online and free to everyone
  • We can pay writers for submissions  

The Important Stuff

Poetry in Glasgow & Edinburgh feels like it's about to change in a big way but we still don't have anything to pull it all together. One of the most exciting things about this Fanzine is that we'll have a full listing of all poetry gigs in Glasgow & Edinburgh, all in the one place, for both city's.
That's really cool.
Hopefully it will benefit everyone and allow people to discover everything we've got to offer.
In other words we need to stop. Collaborate. And Listen.  


But I'm Skint!

 If you're not able to donate to the fanzine then don't worry. The last thing we want is for anyone to be less financially secure because of a fanzine! But there are lots of other ways you can help us.

  • Share our video or our Indiegogo page on Facebook or Twitter 
  • Write a poem or a short story and send it to us for submission 
    thehighflightfanzine@gmail.com
  • If you run a night in Glasgow or Edinburgh that includes short fiction or poetry email us and let us know, we can put your event in our listings section.

The first Issue should be out in August but we'll send out any perks as soon as we can once the fund raising is complete. 

Thank you for taking the time to check out our project

Big Love.


The High Flight 

by 
John Gillespie Magee, Jr. 
(9 June 1922 – 11 December 1941)
Oh! I have slipped the surly bonds of Earth
And danced the skies on laughter-silvered wings;
Sunward I’ve climbed, and joined the tumbling mirth
of sun-split clouds, — and done a hundred things
You have not dreamed of — wheeled and soared and swung
High in the sunlit silence. Hov’ring there,
I’ve chased the shouting wind along, and flung
My eager craft through footless halls of air....

Up, up the long, delirious, burning blue
I’ve topped the wind-swept heights with easy grace.
Where never lark, or even eagle flew —
And, while with silent, lifting mind I've trod
The high untrespassed sanctity of space,
- Put out my hand, and touched the face of God.

story:
The Golden Sun is about how people develop their identity and come to understand their world. While the story is set in the early 20th century, the themes of the story’s characters are modeled after those of our own world; that is, it is set in a post-modern time when people begin to feel meaninglessness creep into their lives. The main character, Cezal, feels "baseless," especially after the recent loss of his mother, and decides to jump on a train to visit her hometown to try and connect with her past. On the way, he meets many different people, all with different personal philosophies and ways of life, and comes to find himself more through them.

My name is Robert Shafer and I am the author of The Golden Sun. I wrote this book because I think there’s always more about ourselves to discover. We tend to think we know ourselves or know what we would do in any given situation, but this is often not the case. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will see and understand different perspectives about the world and in the process, come to understand yourself better. 

The Novel

The Golden Sun largely takes place on a train as the main character, Cezal, is on the way to his mother’s home town. With setting inspired by the Trans-Siberian Railway, the story follows his travels through late-summer, fall, and into winter. On the way, he meets many people, but among them, there are three whom he spends the most time with. The first is an old lady who is taking one last trip, while she’s still spry enough. She’s headed to a quaint mountain village known for their canola flower fields. She reflects on her life with him and they get into much philosophical conversation. The next character he meets is a young, wanna-be ideologue named Zamen, who’s on his way to a remote settlement for a fresh start, and to try and start a political movement to eventually take it over. The third character he meets is an artist named Alja, who is heading to her childhood town to try to reconnect and gain inspiration from her past. Cezal ends up joining her at her old house in the forest, where she continues with her art. While there, their isolation from the remoteness and the oncoming winter leads them to understanding each other in ways they never would have expected. Watch as their individual realities begin to melt away.

You will love this book if you like books that explore personal identity, that have to do with the meaning of life, and that have social commentary. The Golden Sun speaks to anyone who feels lost and wants to learn more about themselves, or who want to grapple with themes of meaning and morality in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that The Golden Sun inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

 

  • What is my sense of self-identity based in?
  • What is my sense of morality and does this come into conflict with other people’s sense of morality? How does one go about reconciling this?
  • Do I accept the direction our society is headed in, and what is that direction?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing these questions will change us all for the better. 

The Book itself

The Golden Sun is written in 4 parts.

Part 1 contains the author’s note + chapters 1-3. This includes the exposition, which is the most significant portion of the book to deal with the main character, Cezal. It also includes the section with Iprazhan, the old lady. The things they talk about have to do with mortality, tenderness, ego, beauty, what is important in the end, and how to be a good person.

Part 2 contains chapters 4-6. This is the section with Zamen, the ideologue. His advice is far more Machiavellian and his character is supposed to fit much of the criteria for an übermensch-type figure. He talks about ideology, society, people’s self-conception, narratives, and what people “truly” want.

Part 3 contains chapters 7-9. This is the section with Alja, a painter, who’s headed back to her home town. She’s very disillusioned with the world and generally has a rather pessimistic outlook on life. Many of the trends with her have to do with disappointment, relationships, and self-importance.

Part 4 contains chapters 10-11. This is the cabin portion of the story. Here, the narrative begins to focus more and more on Alja as her reality becomes increasingly abstract.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

 

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Summer.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author

Robert Shafer is an undergraduate student at McGill University, studying Philosophy and Economics. His particular academic interests lie in moral theory, metaphysics, and philosophy of economics.

He wrote this book to comment and reflect on modern society in the hopes of sparking conversation and self-reflection about what it means to live in the modern world. How different is our world now from 100, or even 1,000 years ago? How have people changed in that time? What is societal progress, and are we progressing as a society? How is technology changing the way we create relationships and interact with the world? What is the role of the individual in the modern world? He feels that we are entering an age where the relationship between the individual and the wider world is changing more quickly than ever before, and that in order to handle these changes, we need to know ourselves better than ever. Particularly, he wanted to examine the concepts of self-identity, meaning, and morality in a more artistic way.

When not writing or studying for school, he likes to hang out with friends, sing karaoke (poorly), and go explore the outdoors.

For more information, you can connect with Robert Shafer at ro.eo.sh@gmail.com and on Instagram @robert.shafer.author.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #thegoldensun and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your support!

Thanks again,
Robert
